loans.name: Maludahan's Group

texts.en: Maludahan is the treasurer of this group. She is 55 and divorced. Maludahan is a resident of Kerben, a small village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Four years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, she started to sell fruits and vegetables in the market. At the moment, her business runs well; she earns about 9,000 soms per month. Maludahan applied for the loan because she needs additional financial funds for purchasing a variety of fruits and vegetables. In the future, with the profits gained from her business, she plans to start repairing her house. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Leidy Graciela

texts.es:
Leidy de 20 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde algunos años Leidy se dedica a la comercialización de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral (gallinas y pavos), los cría en los corrales que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades de su casa.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar de alimentos balanceados y de granos naturales, para que engorden y poderlos ofertar a un mejor precio a sus clientes, con las ganancias pagará el crédito otorgado y mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia.  Leidy con su vitalidad, trabajo y empeño a logrado salir adelante poco a poco junto con su familia y poderle dar mejores oportunidades académicas a su hijo.
texts.en:
Leidy, age 20, lives with her husband and child in their own house.  They do not have the basic services.  They live in the rural zone in the Tambogrande district, Piura department.  This zone is known for its agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For some years Leidy has been selling sheep and poultry (chickens and ducks).  She raises them in corrals in her backyard.  She feeds them balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they have grown she sells them to her customers or at different markets in the zone.  With the income she is able to cover the household expenses.  

She has requested a loan for 1,000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy balanced feed and natural grains.  She will use these to fatten the animals and to be able sell them for a better price.  With the income she will pay for the loan and improve her family’s standard of living.

With her vitality, work, and determination, Leidy has been able to get ahead with her family little by little.  Also she is able to give her son better educational opportunities.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and natural grains for her animals.

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and running water and her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past six years, she has operated a clothing business and she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanauba’s major business challenge is theft due to the insecurity of her area of operation. 

Mwanauba is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase bundles of clothing to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. In the future, Mwanauba dreams of having a formal store and business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La Señora. María socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, este sector es de clima frió y tiene una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente es amable, carismática mantienen las tradiciones y cultura de sus padres, se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población ha migrado o salen diariamente a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades.
 
La Señora María tiene 57 años, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 3 de ellos son casados e independientes, 4 trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, 1 estudia en la universidad y 1 estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que habita es de una de sus hijas.
 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de comida en un mercado de la ciudad, labora sin un horario fijo 4 días a la semana y tiene este negocio 21 años. En su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y gallinas que son para su consumo y para la venta.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes y chanchos, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal.

Su meta es crecer en el negocio de cría de animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. María is a member of the Barrio Sucre communal bank. She lives in the Cumbe parish. This sector has a cold climate and a beautiful view of nature. Its people are kind, charismatic, and maintain the traditions and culture of their parents. They work in agriculture and raise animals. A lot of the population has moved away or travel to the city every day to work various jobs.

Mrs. Maria is 57, married, and has 9 children from this union. Three of these children are married and independent, four work and help out economically, one is in university and one attends a school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They live in the home of one of her daughters.

Maria sells food in a market in the city. She works without a fixed schedule 4 days a week and has had this business for 21 years. In her home, she raises guinea pigs and hens for her consumption and for sale.

She will invest the money from this loan in the purchase of guinea pigs and pigs. This is her second loan in the communal bank.

Her goal is to expand her business raising animals.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and pigs.

loans.name: Nixon

texts.en:
Nixon, a 29-year-old married father of two children aged five and four years, is a resident of Kitale,Western Kenya, where he has been a farmer for four years, producing and selling milk, beans and eggs.

Nixon will be receiving his third loan from Juhudi Kilimo, this time for 60,000 KES, to purchase more poultry to increase his egg production. Providing more income for his family and quickly repaying the loan are his immediate priorities.

Nixon says a scarcity of both animal and poultry feeds remains a challenge to the farmers.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 58, a resident of Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Dioscoro, a construction worker. They are working hard to support their children who are now in college, because they know that education is quite important for their children’s future and security.

Teresita operates a variety store adjacent to their house. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Teresita earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Aside from this she also earn extra income from a direct sales business like AVON.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day

To help her expand her business, she is requesting a Php 21,000 loan to buy additional grocery items, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. The loan will also ensure extra capital for her direct selling business, and she can offer more AVON products to her old and new customers. This will bring forth added income for the family and will improve their living conditions.

Teresita dreams of expanding her business, possibly to a mini-grocery store. In this way she can give her children a good future and help them attain their dreams. She does not only hope for material things for her children, but most importantly she wants them to serve God and get involved in church ministry. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share her hopes and aspirations regarding her family.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 32 years old. She is married and is rearing her six school-aged children. She lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

To earn a living, Liza operates a transportation business - pedicab in particular. It is a vehicle, somewhat like a bicycle, capable of carrying a maximum of 7 persons, but only a short distance. She has been operating this kind of service for over 5 years, allowing her to receive a total monthly income of 9,400 PHP, taking into consideration other irregular sources of income. Liza has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

Liza is hopeful to sustain business deals and day-to-day needs of the family. She plans to save some portion of her income for her children's education.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Sara Rossana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”ATIPAY”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sara; La socia tiene 33 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 1 hijo de 1año de edad; la socia trabaja restaurando obras de arte, la socia tiene en casa un espacio perfectamente acomodado para poder  trabajar restaurando diferentes obras de arte; la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en su matrimonio, la socia desea casarse con su conyugue y para esto ella requiere el préstamo para poder comprar su vestido, pagar todos los gastos nupciales y en esta ocasión ella desea el crédito para invertirlo en ella y en su felicidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en su matrimonio.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sara, 33, is a member of the “Atipay” communal bank that’s located in Huanchac District, Cusco Province and Department.  She’s in a common law relationship and has a 1-year-old son.  She works restoring works of art and has a space in her house that’s perfectly adequate to work restoring art.  

She needs the loan to invest in her wedding.  She wants to marry her spouse and needs a loan to buy her wedding gown and to pay the other nuptial costs.  On this occasion she wants the loan to invest it in herself and in her happiness. She requests the loan to invest in her wedding.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to repay according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to pay for her wedding.

loans.name: Denis F.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni city in northern Sierra Leone, to apply for a loan of 6,700,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. 
Their leader is Denis. Born in Yengema in eastern Sierra Leone, the 56-year-old is married and has five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school. Denis has been a professional teacher for 35 years now. He has applied for this loan in order to pay school fees for his children and renovate his house. He will also invest some of the loan in business.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children, renovate his house, and invest in business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of three children. Hussein has owned an electrical equipment and materials shop since 2010. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. He is well known in the surrounding area. 

Hussein is requesting a loan of $2400 to renovate and repair the wall in his shop and to add to his inventory. He is aiming to earn more profits so he will have the opportunity to provide a better life for his whole family.

loans.use: to renovate and repair his shop and increase his inventory.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La Sra. Beatriz, vive en la meseta D. Achumani y vive con sus dos hijos ya profesionales, uno D. ellos viaja constantemente, ella se dedica a la repostería, elaboración D. galletas, donas tortas, hace mas D. 20 años, elabora queques, tortas y humintas, que reparte en las confiterías D. la zona central y zona sur, es una cliente que trabaja con Emprender desD. el año 2002 , es una cliente muy responsable, y trabajadora, ya que al margen D. esa actividad se dedica a la venta D. refrescos y abarrotes, con el dinero del crédito comprara harina, levadura, etc. para la elaboración D. sus galletas, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Beatriz lives on the Achumani plateau with her two children who are already professionals. One of them travels constantly.

Beatriz spends her time baking. She has been making cookies, donuts, and cakes for more than 20 years. Beatriz distributes cupcakes, cakes, and corn cakes within the central and southern districts. She has been a client of Emprender since 2002 and has demonstrated that she is very responsible and hardworking. In addition to this business, she also sells soft drinks and groceries.

The money she requested will be used to buy flour, yeast, and other ingredients for making cookies. She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos es de la ciudad de Santaní, vive en su propia casa con su esposa e hijos. Tiene 55 años de edad, tiene varios hijos que ya son todos adultos.
Es el dueño de una despensa, comenta que hace ya 10 años que mantiene su negocio, por lo que ya tiene bastante experiencia en el comercio. Dice que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por tener una vejez digna y decorosa, ya que no quiere ser molestia para nadie.
En cuanto a su negocio ya tiene muy buena clientela y siempre tiene muchos pedidos, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás productos,con los cuales podrá abastecer su negocio y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is from Santaní City. He lives in his own house with his wife and children. He is 55 and has several children, all of whom are adults.
He says he has had his business for ten years so he has a lot of experience in commerce. He says he makes all this effort in order to live decently in his old age. He does not want to depend on anyone.
As to his business, he already has a very good clientele and always has a very high demand. That is why he is asking for a loan in order to purchase groceries, drinks, diary, baked goods and other products that will allow him to stock his business and meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase groceries, drinks, diary, baked goods and other products.

loans.name: Maximus

texts.en:
Maximus is  a 30 year old hardworking man.He is a banker and has been in this profession for three and a half years.His personal goal is to be going for further education and his business dream is to have well built rental houses.
Maximus intends to use the loan to renovate his rental houses.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 64, is a married woman with seven children, all of whom graduated from school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated a goat meat selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Her dream is to expand her business and improve her living standards.

With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase goats for meat sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for sale as meat.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama is a petty trader selling tin tomatoes, salt, charcoal and other food items in Ayensudo, near Elmina.  She has been selling charcoal for two years. Mariama is married to a businessman and has three children. She uses her income to assist the husband in paying utility bills. She needs this loan to buy more food items and charcoal for sale. With the new profit, Mariama will expand her business.

loans.use: buy more food items and charcoal for sale

loans.name: Chansokun's Group

texts.en:
Chansokun is 32 years old, married and has two dependent children, one son and one daughter, who are too young to attend school. She is a farmer who has been farming on her two-hectare farmland to make a living for ten years and she supplements her income by selling Chinese noodle and rice soup in the village. 

Chansokun received a loan from VisionFund five years ago. The previous loan from VisionFund have helped her make a living better. She earns more than US$25 per day but is able to save less than five U.S. dollars daily. With her business growth, she and her co-member in the group, who has also been with VisionFund for five years, are applying for another loan. She wants to buy ingredients, kitchen ware etc. for her business. This loan will enable her to run her business well and she hopes to buy necessary comforts for her family and send her children to school and keep them there.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, kitchen ware, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Farihan

texts.en:
Farihan, a 19-year-old single lady, is the only girl in a family with five boys.

Farihan is a civil engineering student in one of the Jordanian universities. She has applied for a loan so she can pay for her semester's fees to get her bachelor's degree. Then she will work in the field while continuing to get a master's degree.

loans.use: to pay for her semester's fees.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself as determined and honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using bicycles. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes and insecurity. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more bicycles. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is Joseph's first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en: Yaw is an Organic and Fair Trade certified Oil Palm farmer who lives in Bomso in the Kwaebibirem District of the Eastern Region of Ghana, West Africa. He is 45 years old and married with 4 children. Three of his children are having basic education, and others having Senior High School education. Yaw believes Organic Oil palm is profitable and helps protect the environment. In this regard, he wants to secure a Kiva Micro loan to purchase a Malaysian knife for harvesting and maintenance of his farm.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting/pruning knife

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria owns a small store where she sells many food items. She started off by just selling fruits and vegetables, but eventually her business grew to include dairy products and soft drinks. She is requesting the loan because she wants to invest in canned goods that are very popular amongst her customers. She does not have the investment capital to go out and buy these goods and make them part of her product line. Maria has a very stable business that shows the capacity of introducing new products. Her customer base is very strong and the product she plans to introduce promise to generate revenue. Maria is a 28 year old single mother of three children who moved to Guayaquil in search of work and a better for life for her children.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in new products for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Agnes wants buy 12 medium size steers.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a sharp entrepreneur selling women’s clothing at one of the local markets in Zaporoshye. In the five years she has had her business, she has gained valuable experience and insight into running a successful market business. She sells a variety of clothing, and is careful with the products she chooses to offer. She watches what other vendors are selling and then tries to distinguish her business by selling different products. Currently, Nataliya makes about $400 profit every month.

Having the business has been a big help for Nataliya and her husband. Not long ago, they were able to purchase a home outside the city and eventually would like to do some remodeling. She and her husband have one son.

Nataliya has requested a loan for $1000 so that she can purchase additional inventory for her business. She would like to increase the selection of sizes she has available and buy seasonal clothing in bulk to prepare for the upcoming busy summer season.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Thum

texts.en: Mr. Thum P. is 66 years old and lives with his wife in Kampong Cham Province.  He owns a plantation that grows various crops, which gives him an average income of $4 per day.  This loan will be used to purchase seeds and farm supplies for him to increase his efficiency.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and farm supplies

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.en: Gulnar S. is  a 36-year-old woman, is married and has three children. She has her own orchard in Hasanli village in the Salyan region and has been in this business for four years. Now she requests a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides to improve her orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her orchard

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
In a humble home, in the village of Pukara, we find hardworking and joyful Doña Agustina (64 years old), making her beautiful pottery (pots). She makes them in the traditional manner, out of mud and clay. And, thanks to her nimble and creative hands, her work has enabled her to provide her 3 beloved children a higher education as well as fully meet the needs of her family. Now, despite her advanced age, she remains willing to continue expanding her business by working dilligently in her art. In order to continue realizing her plans, this exemplary woman wants to get a loan to be used fully for the purchase of raw materials (clay and wood), which she will use in the creation of her valuable pots, and thus move her small business forward. She promises to repay the loan over a period of 8 months. Let us support this worthy mother and help her prosper with her noble work.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

En un humilde domicilio del pueblito de Pukará, encontramos muy laboriosa y alegre a doña Agustina de 64 años de edad, realizando sus hermosos trabajos de alfarería (ollas), basados en barro y arcilla, de manera tradicional; gracias a sus ágiles y creativas manos esta labor le ha permitido brindarles estudios superiores a sus tres queridos hijos y satisfacer plenamente las necesidades de su familia, ahora, pese a su avanzada edad sigue deseosa de seguir expandiendo su negocio y para esto trabaja diligentemente en este bello arte.Para concretar sus planes esta ejemplar mujer desea obtener un préstamo para utilizarlos plenamente en la compra de materia prima (arcilla, leña) para la elaboración de sus valiosas y creativas ollitas y así sacar adelante su pequeño negocio, ella promete rembolsar el préstamo en un lapso de ocho meses. Apoyemos a esta digna madre a prosperar con su noble labor.

loans.use: Purchase of clay and wood to increase her production of pottery.  (Compra de arcilla y leña para incrementar su producción.)

loans.name: Justa Marleni

texts.es:
Señora Justa Marleny is a hard-working and very happy person. She was able to complete her studies only to the first grade of secondary school. She is 34 years old and has 4 children in all, but only two still need her care.

She works from10 in the morning selling cebiche (a Peruvian dish made from raw fish marinated in citrus juice and spices), noodles, papas a la huancaína (a potato dish served on lettuce with a special sauce) and combinations. At noon she prepares and sells lunches and in the evening she works selling anticuchos (a dish consisting of grilled, skewered meat). Her business is located near her house in the Nuevo Jerusalén sector of the district of La Esperanza, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad.

For many years Justa has worked hard at this business, but only working in the day. With the first loan of 100 soles that she received from Manuela Branches she bought a small grill and began to sell anticuchos in the evenings.

The loan of 400 soles, which she will pay in 4 months, will buy tables, a package of noodles, oil and dishes. Señora Justa dreams of being able to buy a refrigerator and finishing her house so that she can add on a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Justa Marleny es una persona muy alegre y trabajadora, estudió sólo hasta el primer grado de secundaria, tiene 34 años de edad y 4 hijos en total pero dos aún necesitan de su cuidado.

Ella trabaja desde las 10:00 de la mañana en la venta de cebiche, tallarín, papa a la huancaína y combinados. Al medio día prepara y vende almuerzos y por las noches se dedica a la venta de anticuchos. Su negocio está ubicado cerca de su casa en el sector Nuevo Jerusalén del distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad.

Hace muchos años que se dedica a este negocio, pero sólo trabajando en el día. Con el primer préstamo de S/.100 que recibió de Manuela Ramos empieza a vender anticuchos por las noches, para ello compra una pequeña parrilla.

El préstamo de S/.400.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará mesas, un paquete de fideos, aceite y platos.

La señora Justa sueña con comprarse una refrigeradora y con terminar de construir su casa para que más adelante pueda poner un restaurante.

loans.use: To buy assets (tables and dishes) and groceries (noodles and oil).

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra AZIAWONOU, age 33, sells "ablo", a local corn bread that is much appreciated by the Togolese people. She has been in this business for two years and is married with five children. To meet the extreme demand, she would like to use this loan to buy three sacks of corn and two cartons of sugar, thus increasing her production capacity and finally to clear profits that would enable her to make ends meet for her and her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Madame Abra AZIAWONOU est revendeuse de « ablo », une pâte locale qui est tant appréciée par la population togolaise. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 02 ans. Agée de 33 ans, madame Abra est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Pour répondre à la demande exorbitante, madame Abra AZIAWONOU désire par ces fonds acheter 03 sacs de maïs et 02 cartons de sucres, augmentant ainsi la capacité de son activité et in fine dégager des profits lui permettant de venir à bouts de ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy 80 sacks of corn for making a local style of bread called "ablo"

loans.name: Zulayho.

texts.ru:
Zulayho M. lives in Vahdat. She is married, has 5 children and is 50 years old. Zulayho is a homemaker and raises livestock. She has 6 years of experience in this area. Zulayho plans to use her loan to purchase a dairy cow which will provide her with milk. She will sell the milk in her town, which will help her family’s finances. In addition, this will provide local residents with fresh milk at affordable prices. Zulayho plans to pay back the loan over a 10 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мусулмонова Зулайхо Рахмоновна проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем имеет 5 детей. Возраст 50 лет. Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством. Опыт в бизнесе 6 лет.на планируемый кредит хочет купить дойную корову, что позволит ей получать молоко. Полученное молоко планирует использовать для продажи в городе.. Что поможет улучшить финансовое положение ее семьи.Кроме того продажа молока позволяет обеспечить население свежим молоком по доступным ценам.Погасить кредит клиентка планируе в течении 10 месяцев

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lorgia

texts.es:
Señora Lorgia belongs to the community bank Santa Bárbara, located in the food section of Market No. 2, of the district of Calleria in the province of Ucayali. She is 43 years old and a mother of five children. Her husband is a construction worker, but the income that he has does not meet the family's needs to sustain themselves. With her first loan received through Manueal Ramos of 300 Soles, she decided to invest in food sales.

Presently she has a food sales position. She wakes up very early to prepare her foods and focuses on opening up her business in the morning, once finished her daily duty she prepares herself for tomorrow's work day.

With this loan of 1500 Soles, which she will pay back in five months, she will invest it in purchasing supplies for preparing her dishes like: rice, sugar, milk, condiments, chicken, stews, vegetables, etc.

Lorgia is very happy: her business is growing, her family feels very proud of her for her achievements, and now she is able to give the best to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

La señora Lorgia pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Bárbara, ubicado en el Mercado No 2 Sección comidas, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 43 años y es madre D. 5 hijos, su esposo es albañil, pero los ingresos económicos que tiene no le alcanzan para el sustento familiar. Con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 deciD. invertirlo en la venta D. comida.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un puesto D. venta D. comida, se levanta muy temprano para preparar sus comidas y dirigirse a abrir su negocio, una vez terminado su faena diaria se prepara para la jornada del día siguiente.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,500 el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invetira en la compra D. víveres para preparar sus comidas como: arroz azúcar, leche, condimentos, pollos, menestras, verduras, etc.

Lorgia esta muy feliz, su negocio esta creciendo, su familia se siente muy orgullosa D. ella por sus logros y ahora pueD. darles lo mejor a sus hijos.

loans.use: products for the preparation of her foods

loans.name: Tchotcho Anastasie

texts.fr:
Mrs. Tchotcho Anastasie A. was born on March 13, 1969 in Lomé. She is married to Mr. Parfait Paraiso who is a bicycle mechanic. She sells cooked food and locally produced clothing in the Agoè neighborhood. In the mornings, she sells cooked rice and in the afternoons she displays tailor-made clothing.

Having increased her working capital thanks to her first loan of US$ 500, which she reimbursed in a timely manner, she was able to improve her profits while satisfying the needs of her clientele, mainly made up of tailors.

She expects this loan in the amount of US$ 725 to allow her to better serve her clients by purchasing 15 bolts of poplin and acquiring a machine for overcasting seams with a view to improving her sales.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Madame A. Tchotcho Anastasie est née le 13 mars 1969 à Lomé. Elle s’est mariée à Monsieur PARAISO Parfait qui est un mécanicien à deux roues. Elle est restauratrice et revendeuse d’articles de couture dans le quartier d’Agoè. Dans la matinée, elle fait la restauration de riz et expose les articles de couture dans l’après midi.

Ayant augmenté son fonds de roulement à travers son premier crédit de 200.000FCFA qu’elle a d’ailleurs promptement remboursé, elle a amélioré son bénéfice en satisfaisant les besoins de sa clientèle constituée majoritairement des tailleurs.

Le crédit qu’elle sollicite d’un montant de 300.000FCFA devait lui permettre de mieux servir ses clients à travers l’achat quinze (15) rouleaux de popeline et l’acquisition d’une machine à surfilage en vue d’améliorer ses ventes.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 bolts of poplin and a machine for overcasting seams

Achat de 15 rouleaux de popeline et acquisition d'une machine à surfilage

loans.name: Tagi

texts.en:
36-year-old Tagi L. is married, with three children. For over two years, Tagi has developed experience making sarongs and dresses with her sewing business, Her business is open six days per week and she earns approximately 180 Tala (~75 USD) per week.

Tagi has received two previous loans from SPBD. SPBD loans remained her only access to capital as she has been unable to qualify for loans from traditional banks. She will use her loan to purchase different kinds of clothing materials includer a roller, needles, thread, pain brushes and paints. She hopes that as her business improves, she will be able to pay for her kids' education and home improvements.

loans.use: To purchase sewing and clothing materials

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva has been working in agriculture since she was a small child. Now that she is a mother and has an obligation to maintain the well-being of her household, she works more eagerly than ever at her familiar tasks. She wishes to improve her products, with this objective: to collaborate with her beloved children in the work of making their dreams reality.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Eva, desde pequeña ha estado vinculada con la labor agrícola, ahora que es madre y tiene la obligación de mantener el bienestar dentro del hogar, se dedica con más ahínco a sus labores acostumbradas y desea mejorar sus productos con el objetivo de colaborar con los sueños de sus amados hijos.

loans.use: Injection of capital in order to improve her products.

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
Maruja, a diligent and exemplary mother, has made her main income from her business of selling take-out food. Her six children have given and still give her the strength to persevere. After being abandoned by her partner and the father of her children, Maruja took control of the household and decided to adapt a small space in her house for her business. She sells salchipapa (fried potatoes), salchipollo (a chicken and fried potato dish), and rice with eggs. These delicious dishes sell at prices so affordable that she has been able to increase the number of her clients enormously. She still has the courage and strength to persist in the expansion and improvement of her business and thereby increase the quality of life for her sons. She dreams of providing them with a good education so that they will grow up to be good men with better opportunities. This loving mother needs your financial support, support which will be invested in renovating her place of business and acquiring food staples at wholesale prices. Let’s grant the request of this selfless mother.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer.

Esta ejemplar y diligente madre ha hecho de su negocio su principal ingreso económico y la de sus 6 hijos, quienes le dieron y le dan la fuerza suficiente para seguir perseverando, aún después del abandono de su pareja y padre de sus hijos, desde entonces, Maruja tomó sola las riendas de su hogar, para ello decidió adecuar un pequeño espacio de su vivienda y vender comida al paso tales como: Salchipapa, salchipollo y arroz con huevo, estos deliciosos platos los vende a precios sumamente cómodos por lo que se ha incrementado enormemente la cantidad de clientes, pero doña Maruja sigue teniendo suficiente coraje y fortaleza para persistir en la ampliación y mejoramiento de su negocio y por ende la calidad de vida de sus hijos, a quienes sueña ofrecerles una buena educación para que el futuro sean hombres de bien con mejores oportunidades. Esta amorosa madre requiere de tu apoyo económico, apoyo que será invertido en hacer refaccionar su puestito de venta y adquirir insumos de primera necesidad al por mayor. Posibilitemos la petición de esta abnegada madre.

loans.use: The renovation of her place of business and the purchase of  food staples at wholesale prices

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Miss Chanthol N. (22) is single and living with her parents. She has one sister who is a silk weaver and one brother. Her parents grow bananas and raise cows. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss Chanthol has been a silk weaver for seven years, a skill she learned from her neighbour. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. The main income in the family is from her and her sister's weaving.

Chanthol is requesting a loan of $1000 to build one rest room for the family to use.

loans.use: To build one rest room.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Cruzkaya

texts.en:
Cruz Kaya P. F. is a member of the community bank Minca. She is 26 years old and has 2 children, ages 4 and 1. With her family she runs a hostel and has been working there for the last 10 years. 

With the loan she will invest in the family business by purchasing juices, refreshments, sodas, and artisan goods and by maintaining the showcase of local traditional goods. She dreams of one day opening her own bazaar and selling artisan goods, clothes, shoes, gifts and wallets. Going to school to specialize in a professional field is also one of her goals. Currently, she lives with her in-laws, and she would love to move into her own place.

loans.use: Purchase juices, refreshments, sodas, and artisan goods for the store

loans.name: Saodat

texts.en: Saodat O. is 50 years old. She’s married with five children, is a hard worker. Her husband had been earning a very low wage that didn't cover all the family's expenses, so he left for Russia two years ago to earn more money. That’s why Saodat saw that it was necessary to enter the family business. She began to sell  foodstuffs in her family grocery store, with the help of her younger son. The business is stable, and that allows her to improve the living condition of her family. Today, Saodat is asking for a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300), which she will use to offer a better service for her clients and improve the appearance of her store. She promises to pay back this amount in 8 months. She is thankful for the trust and aid that you offer her.

loans.use: To increase the range of foodstuffs she sells

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Mrs. Chhem K., is a rice farmer, and is aged 36. She lives in Koktlokle Commune in Siem Reap Province and has seven children, two of whom are married and live away from home, and one is a fisherman who makes a profit of $5 per day. She is married to Mr. Sham Nhang, 44, a fisherman, who fishes in Tunle Sap Lake, and has been in this business since 2001. Chhem seeks a loan to purchase planks for her house. (Mrs. Chhem's husband in the picture because she was not available that day.)

loans.use: To purchase planks for her house

loans.name: Abdujamol

texts.ru: Абдучамол отец двоих детей,жена домохозяйка.Сам Абдучамол мастер по производству мебели разных видов.В последнее время у него идут заказы на спальный гарнитур.Он со своим напарником работает на дому у клиентов.Ему понадобился кредит для закупа необходимых полуфабрикатов для его работы,фанеры, деревянные доски,и.т.д. Абдучамол первый свой кредит закончил хорошо без нарушений.Кредит помог ему как в семейной жизни, так и в работе.Он благодарен всем инвесторам за поддержку и финансирование.
texts.en:
Abdujamol is the father of two children, and his wife works as a housekeeper. He is a master craftsman who makes various kinds of furniture. Of late he has had several orders for wardrobes for the bedroom. He and his partner work in the client's home. Abdujamol is in need of a loan for the purchase of the semifinished products needed for his work, plywood, wood boards, etc. Abdujamol repaid his first loan without any mishaps. The loan helped help him out both with his family and at work. He is grateful to all the investors for their support and financing.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cabinet Maker

loans.name: Mrs. Sann Chao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people, living in Tuol Khsach village in Kampong Cham province, comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Sann C., the 63-year-old village bank president, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Muon Vanny, helps her in her small farming business. They face an obstacle because they do not have enough money to buy fertilizer to support their field. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Sann C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the fields, and she would use the rest of loan to purchase fuel to water the field to make her crops more productive. She is the mother of three children who are employed in a garment factory.

One member in this group has a loan that is end-of-term, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support their field, and various other reasons.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: Ukombozi Group

texts.en:
Victoria M. has owned a small food vendor store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She works 12 hours a day at her business and currently earns an average monthly profit of $400. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She hopes to grow her business by increasing her profit through this loan.  

Victoria is 40 years old and married. She has three children, ages 20, 18, and 11.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Tabu S., who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to grow her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia vive en casa de sus padres en la calle sucre de la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como empleada de limpieza en un centro de salud donde percibe el salario mínimo, que ahora es de 647.00 bolivianos. El crédito que solicita es para pagar la inscripción de su hija en un instituto para que pueda estudiar enfermería.

No es cliente de Impro pero por la actividad puede acceder a un crédito, además del carácter social del crédito.
texts.en:
Virginia lives in her parents' house on sucre street in the Alto Llojeto area of La Paz. She works as cleaning staff in a health center where she earns minimum wage, which is now 647.00 bolivianos. The loan requested will pay for her daughter's registration at an institute where she can study nursing. She is not a customer of Impro but the activity will help her to access a loan, in addition to the social nature of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Registration costs for her daugter to study nursing.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 41 years old and married with five children. She is a hair stylist and she also sells hair extensions and creams. She has been in this business for a long time.

She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions and creams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and creams to sell

loans.name: Prisons B Chandiru Betty Group

texts.en: Betty C. is a 40-year-old widow with five daughters and one son, all in school, as well as three additional dependents. She has operated her business of selling millet and local brew for over 20 years and is now requesting a loan to purchase millet and millet flour, yeast, and sorghum for making local brew. Betty’s dream is to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase millet and millet flour, yeast, and sorghum for making local brew.

loans.name: Rosaria Milambo

texts.pt:
Rosaria Milambo D. S. é natural de Maputo, tem 24 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de um filho com um ano de idade. Apenas sustenta o seu filho e marido.

Rosaria estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, desde a sua infância passou no bairro Inhagoa um D. bairros do distrito Urbano nº 5 da cidade de Maputo. A três anos que rosaria é gestora do seu próprio negocio que cconsiste na compra e venda de produtos diversos com destaque aos refrigerantes que adquira a caixa por 150,00mt e vende por 240,00mt.

Rosaria solicita o empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez e nunca se benificiou noutras instituições. Futuramente Rosaria pretende construir uma grande loja para diversicar mais os produtos.
texts.en:
Rosaria Milambo D. S. is a native of Maputo and is 24 years old. She is married and the mother of a one year-old son. She only supports her son and husband. Rosaria went to school until the 9th grade and stopped because of poor conditions. She grew up in the Inhagoa neighborhood, one of the neighborhoods in the Urban #5 district in the city of Maputo. For three years Rosaria has been manager of her own business that consists of buying and selling various products with the stand-out being soda which she acquires for 150MT and sells for 240MT per box. Rosaria is requesting a loan through Hluvuku and Kiva for the first time, and she has never borrowed from other institutions. In the future Rosaria intends to construct a great store to diversify her products.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of diverse products

loans.name: Jabe

texts.en: Jabe L. is 32 years old and is married to a policeman. She has four children and her children go to school. Jabe is currently in the business of selling green vegetables and is requesting a loan to purchase smoked fish to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Mrs. Sushila B. is a tailor in the town of Bhatkepati in Kathmandu. She opened her tailoring shop four years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls. She prefers to make popular dresses like kurta salwar, blouses, ladies’ long dresses, makhshi and others. Before starting her own business, Mrs. B. took a six month training course in tailoring.

She plans to use the loan of Rs 15,000 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to add to her family's income and spend on her son’s education.

Her husband's name is Rustam B. and he works in a private office. She has one son who is now in pre-primary school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for tailoring

loans.name: Chapaquitas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Chapaquitas” esta representado por la señora Mirian Janeth y conformado por 12 miembros, una mayoría D. las socias se dedica a la venta D. productos como la comida, cosméticos, edredones, combustible y al transporte público D. pasajeros. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es bastante alta pero la dedicación y las ganas D. trabajar son las que prevalecen ante la competencia. El destino del financiamiento es para la  adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, materiales y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta que les permitirá generar un  mejor ingreso para brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. En general los miembros del grupo cuenta con experiencia gracias a financiamientos en entidades similares a la fundación Agrocapital por lo que conocen la modalidad D. trabajo así como la responsabilidad y compromiso que se requiere para recibir un apoyo económico para sus negocios.Debido a que alginas socias no pueden dejar sus puestos D. trabajo sus esposos son los que se reunen en el gruposon los casos D. la señora Deysy y la selñora Noemi.
texts.en:
The “Chapaquitas” group is represented by Mirian Janeth and has 12 members. Most of the members are vendors of a variety of products such as food, cosmetics, bedspreads, and fuel, while others proviD. public transportation of passengers. The level of competition in the commercial environment that they work in is quite high, but their dedication and willingness to work helps them to succeed against the competition. The purpose of the financing is for the purchase of merchandise, ingredients and raw materials, and for enlarging their sales stalls, which will allow them to generate more income and improve their families' standard of living. Overall the members of the group have acquired experience thanks to loans from other entities similar to Agrocapital, which is why they are familiar with the financing system and the responsibility and commitment required in order to obtain economic support for their businesses. Because some of the members cannot leave their businesses unattended, their husbands are the ones who meet with the group. That is the case for Deysy and Noemi.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, 45 years old and married, has nine living children ranging in age from 29 to 5 years old. A seller of second-hand clothes for over 10 years, Pamela buys them from Nairobi and sells them in a local market in Kisumu. When the post-election violence erupted in late 2007, her clothes were stolen and her kiosk was burned down. She is still trying to recover from this hardship, and business is difficult now. She says that most customers do not have good money to pay, so the business is hard to maintain.

Pamela will use the money to buy more clothes to sell, and she hopes to use the profits to educate all of her children, some of whom are in college while others are in secondary and primary school. “God willing, they will finish school,” she says.

loans.use: To buy more stock.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Nine people living in Tnaot village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Chreb H. is a 41- year-old village bank president. She is a cloth weaver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more silks and raw materials to make more cloths. Her husband, Mr. Prak Soeun, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, he is a worker who has been hired by the villagers. This couple has five children, two of whom help the parents work while the others are attending the local school. 

One member in this group loans is end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: By purchasing more silks and raw materials to make more cloths.

loans.name: Shakhla

texts.en: Shakhla is applying to Kiva for her second loan. She is enjoying running her business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy cloth to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy cloth for her tailoring business

loans.name: Nyikang

texts.en:
Nyikang C. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to build a charcoal store.

Nyikang is 48 years old with a husband who is a peasant. She has 4 children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a charcoal store

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 40 años, es padre de 3 hijos (estudiantes) y vive junto a su esposa quien lo ayuda en todas sus actividades. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la compra y venta de pecado, pero también es propietario de dos motocarros, uno de ellos lo maneja un chofer particular y el otro, lo maneja él en sus momentos libres, ambos brindan el servicio de “mototaxi”, es decir transporte de pasajeros. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se siente bien con lo que hace, además le es rentable, ya que tiene dos ingresos, uno por sus motocarros y el otro por la venta de pescado. Para más adelante, Juan quiere tener un almacén de pescado y trabajar con mayor comodidad.
Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, lo que gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos sus compañeros trabajan coordinadamente y son puntuales en sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la refacción de sus motocarros, aproximadamente gastará  2000 soles y con lo restante en la comprará más pescado.

loans.use: Reparación de sus motocarros y compra de pescado

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
44-year-old Genelyn B. is a rice farmer. She takes care of her eight children.

Genelyn experienced difficulty when her rice field got flooded and it was a big problem for her whole family. But she is thankful to God she was able to get through it and move on.

Genelyn is also grateful she became a member of CEVI because she can now borrow money at the low interest rate of 2% per month. Now she is requesting to loan of Php 12,000 which she will use to acquire farm inputs needed at her farm.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics in bulk

loans.name: Ruth Elieth

texts.es: Ruth Elieth de 23 años es soltera, trabaja en el MINED de Santo Tomas desde hace 15 años como maestra multigrado en la zona rural, se va los Lunes y regresa los Viernes de cada semana, habita junto su mamá, esta solicitando su primer credito y espera se beneficiada con el fondo kiva para terminar de construir su cocina, pues actualmente la tiene en la salita, tiene comenzado los arranques, solo le falta levantar 3 paredes y ponerle el techo, y con el credito comprara los materiales y hacer el trabajo hasta donde cubra el dinero que se le financie. Expresa que por sus compañeras de trabajo que tambien son clientas de esta institucion se dio cuenta que AFODENIC y KIVA apoya a las personas para que mejoren sus viviendas y las condiciones de vida de su familia por lo que decidio solicitar el financiamiento.  El mayor sueño de Ruth es poder seguir mejorando su casa y poder brindarle comodidad a su mamá y su familia que tenga en el futuro.
texts.en:
Ruth Elieth is 23 years old, single, and has been working in the Santo Tomas MINED for 15 years as a teacher at various grade levels in a rural area. She heads off to work Mondays and comes back on Fridays every week. She lives with her mother. This is her first loan request and hopes to be the beneficiary of the kiva fund to finish building her kitchen. As of now she has it in her small living room. She has initiated the beginnings of a kitchen and only needs to build three more walls and a roof. With the loan she will buy the materials and work until she repays the loan. She states that through her coworkers, who are also clients of this institution, she found out that AFODENIC and KIVA support individuals to improve their standards of living. This is how she decided to request a loan. Ruth’s biggest dream is to continue improving her home and offer her mother and family amenities for their future.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Garza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Kitchen construction

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is 56 years old and married with six children between the ages of 24 and 39 years old. She runs a clothing business, selling new and secondhand clothes. She's been in business for 24 years and has two employees. She says that her customers are loyal. She previously worked as a teacher. She requested this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy new stock of clothing (10,000 KES) and to expand her shop (10,000 KES).

Anastasia describes himself as hardworking, focused and determined and says that since she became a member of Faulu she has learned how to keep records and manage her business. In the future, it's her hope to improve her standard of living and expand her shop into a supermarket.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and expand the business premises

loans.name: Brisayda

texts.es:
Brisayda, es el nombre de esta trabajadora y dedicada mujer, que a sus 29 años vive con su esposo (Dante), de también 29 años, y con su hijo Johan de 4 años. Juntos, y muy felices por lo que hasta ahora han logrado, viven en su casa que es propia en un pueblo tranquilo de la sierra del Perú.

Cada día es un esfuerzo constante para salir adelante, ella debe trabajar de lunes a domingo, desde muy temprano hasta llegada la noche, y fuerzas no le faltan, ya que es muy activa. Su negocio es la venta de productos comestibles en la tienda que tiene desde hace 4 años en su vivienda, allí vende la más variada cantidad de productos que sus asiduos clientes buscan, a quienes atiende amablemente, porque este negocio le brinda buenas ganancias.
Brisayda sabe que todo esfuerzo tiene su recompensa y es por eso que trabaja a diario, casi sin descanso; atiende a sus pequeños desde muy temprano, los alista para el colegio y empieza su labor. A veces la vida nos demuestra cuánto es capaz de esforzarse una madre por el bienestar de sus hijos, no hay cansancio, no hay nada que lo impida y así es Briseyda una mujer incansable.

Este es el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura de ser responsable, además no quiere dejar mal a su banco comunal, ya que está integrado por otras mujeres muy empeñosas. Brisayda tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en surtir su tienda de comestibles con más mercadería para cubrir las necesidades de sus vecinos y clientes que le compran a diario.
texts.en:
This hardworking, dedicated woman is called Brisayda. She is 29 years old and lives with her husband Dante, who is also 29 years old, and her four-year-old son Johan. Living together in their own house in a quiet village in the mountains of Peru, they are very proud of all they have accomplished so far. Every day is a constant struggle to make progress. Brisayda has to work seven days a week, from early morning until nightfall, but she finds the strength for this as she is very energetic. She runs a business selling groceries in the shop she has owned for four years in her own home. There she sells the wide variety of products that are sought after by her regular customers, who she serves in a friendly manner, as this business generates a good income. Brisayda knows that her efforts are rewarded and so she works day after day, with almost no time to rest. She gets up very early to look after her little ones, get them ready for school and then start work. Sometimes life shows us just how much a mother is capable of doing for the wellbeing of her children. Without tiring, nothing stops Brisayda - she is indefatigable. This is the seventh loan Brisayda has had from Kiva Field Partner, Microfinanzas Prisma (MFP). There is no doubt about her responsibility, and furthermore she does not want to let down her community bank, which includes other enterprising women. Brisayda is thinking of investing the money she is requesting in stocking up her grocery store with more merchandise to cover the needs of her neighbors and customers who buy from her every day.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih has worked as a bread distributor since 2007. He delivers bread in his town and its surroundings. He's become well known in the whole region, with customers who await his passage daily. Today, Rabih is asking to borrow $1,200 to change his van motor for easier pick-up and transport to the houses.

loans.use: To change his van motor

loans.name: Umirnisso

texts.en:
Umirnisso is a married woman with three adult children. She runs a grocery business selling different kinds of foodstuffs. Her twenty eight years of being in business have helped her store flourish into a successful enterprise. Umirnisso would like to see her business grow still further. She believes additional financial assistance will help guarantee expansion and higher profits. Umirnisso’s integrity, good reputation, stability and rich experience working in commerce should secure prompt repayment of this loan and consistent progress in her business.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: foodstuff like sweets, tea, sugar, juices, soft drinks, preserved food

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria M. is from the town of Turod Norte Cordon. She is 53 years old. Gloria is the leader of a 5-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Gloria is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Gloria raises and sells pigs. Gloria has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to buy feed and supplies for her pigs. This will be Gloria's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy feed and supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: La Sra Amelia A. M. de  36 años de edad, cuenta con  casa propia de material de adobe ubicada en la Urbanización Sebastian Barranca de Santiago.Tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar. Trabaja como empleada del hogar con 3 años de experiencia. Adicionalmente percibe otros ingresos de pensión. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño a logrado adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Amelia A. M. is 36 years old. She owns a home made of adobe in the Sebastian Barranca Housing Development in Santiago. Her child attends school. Amelia has been working as a housekeeper for three years. In addition, she receives income from a pension. She is an enterprising woman who, thanks to her efforts, was able to acquire her own property.

Amelia needs a loan to finish construction of her home, which was affected by the 2007 earthquake. Her dream is to have all of the construction completed on her home so that she can enjoy a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that has been provided to her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of her house

loans.name: Teodoro German

texts.es:
German es socio del Banco Comunal Laureles.
German es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, German tiene una mototaxi con el cual realiza transporte de pasajeros, además German vende ropa a pedido, sus ventas son al crédito.
German necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi.
Los sueños de German son tener casa propia y ahorrar.
texts.en:
German is a member of the communal bank Laureles. He is married, 42 years old, and has 4 children. German transports passengers in his mototaxi (a motorized rickshaw). He also takes orders for clothing and extends credit to his clothing customers. German needs a loan of $450, which will be used to maintain his mototaxi. His dreams are to have his own house and to save money.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance of his mototaxi

loans.name: Sogbossi

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Allada dans le département de l’Atlantique, H. Sogbossi vit depuis 20 ans au quartier Gbégamey à Allada. Mariée à MINANKPE Antoine un chauffeur, Sogbossi est mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés. Sogbossi vit avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple se partage ensemble les charges familiales. Sogbossi n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Sogbossi prépare et vend de la nourriture (riz accompagnée de diverses sauces) à Allada. C’est également à Allada que Sogbossi fait ses approvisionnements. Sogbossi exerce cette activité depuis trois ans et a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Sogbossi désire augmenter sa production et mieux faire face à la demande des clients. Pour cette raison, Sogbossi sollicite un troisième prêt.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Allada in the "département" (administrative district) of Atlantique, Sogbossi has lived for the past 20 years in the Gbégamey neighborhood of Allada. Married to Antoine MINANKPE, a driver, Sogbossi is mother to five children, all at school. She lives with her children and her husband. The couple share responsibility for the family expenses. Sogbossi never went to school. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, she prepares and sells food (rice accompanied by various sauces) in Allada. She also gets her supplies in Allada. She has been carrying out this activity for three years and has already had two loans from ALIDé, both of which she repaid without incident. In the face of increasing demand from her customers, Sogbossi would like to increase her production and be able to satisfy better this demand. For this reason she is applying for a third loan.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of rice, a can of oil and condiments for sauces

loans.name: Family Tree Group

texts.en:
Mohammed F., the leader of the group of five borrowers called Family Tree, is 50 years old, married and has six children who range from 2 to 21 years old. He could not continue his education through junior high school. For 25 years Mohammed has been tailoring at the Pipelines Road in Redlight, Paynesville, Liberia. He sews quality clothes with good designs and also gives his customers a warm smile when transacting with them in order to encourage them to continue to buy from him.

Mohammed started operating with 15,000 Liberian Dollars but now has about 25,000 as working capital. He sometimes faces problems with a breakdown of his sewing machine, which in turn slows down business for him. He plans to use his 14,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 70,000.00 in Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more tailoring materials to serve customers. His goal is to expand his business into a clothing factory and improve the living conditions of his family.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Mohammed is the one holding the sign, while Famata is inset at the lower right.

About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials to serve customers.

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es: María Dolores G.  D. M. D. 50 años D. edad, es una señora acompañada, quien trabaja vendiendo huevos D. forma ambulante, así mismo comercializa queso y crema, en las diferentes colonias D. Tonacatepeque, en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual resiD. también. Así mismo su esposo es comerciante ambulante, forma en la cual ambos se han ganado la vida por más D. 10 años. María es muy trabajadora y dedicada a lo que hace por lo que su mayor deseo es poder aumentar la cantidad D. huevos  que comercializa y D. esta manera contar con la posibilidad D. ofrecerlos por mayor a tiendas y otros tipos D. negocios en los cuales se comercializan productos alimenticios. D. esta manera ella podrá contar con clientes los cuales compren por mayor, aumentando D. esta manera sus ventas. Es por esto que María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para realiza el deseo D. mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
María Dolores G. D. M. is a married woman of 50. She works selling eggs, cheese and fresh cream in the neighborhoods of Tonacatepeque, in the province of San Salvador where she is resident. Her husband is also a salesman, and together they have sustained themselves for the past 10 years. María is a dedicated and responsible worker. She strives to increase the quantity of eggs available in order to expand her sales to stores and other wholesale businesses. In this way she can supply her products to larger establishments for increased stability and sales volume. By expanding into wholesale supply, she hopes to greatly improve her business and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale quantities of eggs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying manure and other farm supplies

loans.name: Amuna

texts.en:
Amuna L. is currently in the business of selling dresses, pairs of trousers and bedsheets and is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell.  Amuna is 40 years old and is widowed. She has 7 children, and 3 of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Casiano

texts.es:
Casiano,  tiene 39 años, es casado, tiene 6 hijos y es natural de provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco de la comunidad de Pitucando. Actualmente,  el socio vive en la ciudad de Huambutio donde tiene una pequeña fábrica de extracción y elaboración de yeso. 

Casiano pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL CARMEN DE HUAMBUTIO” y hace dos años atrás, su primer crédito fue de S/. 1,000 soles y ahora requiere el préstamo de los S/. 500 soles para comprar más leña que cuesta la arroba 8 soles. 

Casiano se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Casiano is 39 years old, is married, and has 6 children. He is from the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, from the town of Pitucando. He currently lives in the city of Huambutio, where he has a small factory for the extraction and processing of chalk. Casiano belongs to the “Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio” communal bank. His first loan, two years ago, was for PEN 1,000.00 and now he needs a loan of PEN 500.00 to buy more firewood, which costs PEN 8.00 per 14 kg. bundle. Casiano is grateful for the opportunity provided by him through this program and he promises to make his payments according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Carlos C. le esta haciendo falta los acabados del interior. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo, ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. 
Desea que sus dos pequeños hijos tenga una casa mucho mejor donde puedan vivir.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como oficial de carretera. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Hortensia Juárez esposa del señor Carlos, ya que le día de la visita el se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The lady in the picture is Mrs. Hortensia Juárez, wife of Mr. Carlos who was at work the day of the picture. The interior of Mr. Carlos C.'s home is in need of the finishing touches. He seeks a loan since he currently can't count on the sufficient funds needed to purchase the material and pay the person in charge of the home improvements. He would like both his children to have a better house to live in. He plans on re-paying the loan with his income working as a highway official.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing interior of the home

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more mobile phones

loans.name: Sothea

texts.en:
Mr. Sothea T. (in the photo), is 31 years old and his wife, Mrs. Malini Len, is 29 years old. They have been married since 2001 and have two children--one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Sothea has been a bicycle and motorbike repairer for ten years. He operates the business in his village. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. Sothea is asking for his first loan in the amount of US$ 1,000. He will use $500 of the loan to purchase motorcycle spare part for his business and another $500 to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare part for his business and buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia pertenece al Banco Comunal Obreras hace 10 años y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones amenas con sus compañeras además que le enseñaron a ser puntual.
