Eulalia es conviviente, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, Eulalia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Eulalia vende relojes que reparte a amigos y familiares.
Eulalia solicita un crédito de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azucar, aceite.
Los sueños de Eulalia son comprar un carro para su distracción.
texts.en:
Eulalia has belonged to the communal bank "Obreras" for 10 years, and what she finds most enjoyable are the entertaining meetings with her fellow group members who, in addition, taught her to be punctual. Eulalia lives with a partner and has 7 children, 1 of whom is in school. Eulalia has a store in her house where she sells groceries and vegetables every day. She also sells watches that she distributes to her friends and acquaintances. Eulalia requests a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles that she will use to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil. Eulalia dreams of buying a car for her personal use.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe G. is from the village of Poblacion III. She is 46 years old and is married with four adult children. Fe owns and operates a pottery business, manufacturing and selling pots to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over sixteen years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Fe joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials needed to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Fe plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a young man 29 years old. He is married to a tailor and together they have three children ages 9, 7 and 5 years. He is head of a family of five people and they live in Christopher’s house that he has managed to put up using hard-earned income from farming. He is a farmer and says he has been one since he was very young. Droughts are his stumbling block in some seasons but he says he is expecting better results from his farming business. Christopher says he feels he must diversify his sources of income to sustain his family in terms of welfare and education. He intends to use the loan funds to buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Chu Thị Loan's Group

texts.en:
L. Chu Thị is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. L. is the group leader of a five-member group L. offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual L., they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Cầu Gạo nhóm 05 (Nhóm 12).

L. is married and has two school-aged children. L. is a tailor who provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. L. has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000,000 VND a month.

In 2009 L. joined SEDA to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous L. of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA that was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She is now requesting a new L., her second from SEDA, of 6,496,000 VND that will be used to purchase additional fabric and materials. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Đinh Thị T. is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND L. to support her business in the food sector making and selling food. 2. Nguyễn Thị H. is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND L. to support her business in the food sector running a food stall. 3. Đỗ Thị T. is a 22-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,496,000 VND L. to support her business in the services sector operating a service-based business. 4. Chu Thị X. is a 34-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND L. to support her business in the food sector making and selling food.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this L. was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

L. Chu Thị (20213030020) là 39 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.. L. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Cầu Gạo nhóm 05 (Nhóm 12).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. L. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, L. kiếm được khoảng 5.000.000 VND. Vào 2009, L. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. L. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Đinh Thị T. (0) là 37 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. 3. Đỗ Thị T. (0) là 22 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.496.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ. 4. Chu Thị X. (0) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional fabric and materials

loans.name: Isroil

texts.ru: Сафаров Исроил проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 21 год. Холост. Образование среднее. Занимается перевозкой людей. Он в основном предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области уже год. Кредит берет для закупа автомашины. Он намерен продать свою старую машину и купить новую.
texts.en: Isroil S. lives in the city of Kulob.  He is 21 years old, single.  He has a secondary education.  Isroil is involved in passenger transportation.  He primarily provides taxi service.  Isroil has been in this business for one year.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of a car.  He intends to sell his current old car and buy a new one.

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
Maria Magdalena  de 58 años de edad es soltera, trabajó para el MINED como docente durante 20 años, pero actualmente esta jubilada y recibe mensualmente pension como maestra jubilada. 

Esta solicitando su 11vo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda construyendo la cocina de su casa para mayor comodidad de su familia.Habita junto a sus 2 hijos los cuales son mayores y le apoyan con los gastos de la casa.  

La profesora Maria Magdalena expresa sentirse muy agradecida con AFODENIC ya que con los creditos poco a poco a ido mejorando su vivienda, y espera seguir contanto con el apoyo de esta institucion para seguir mejorando su casa ya que es el patrimonio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena is 58-year-old single woman who worked for MINED as a teacher for 20 years but has retired and is now receiving monthly pension. 

She is requesting her eleventh loan with the goal of improving her housing by constructing a kitchen for the greater comfort of her family. She lives with her two older children who provide support with household costs. 

Maria would like to express her great appreciation for AFODENIC since the loans have helped her improve her home little by little. She hopes to continue working with this institution in order to continue improving her house since it will become her children's.

loans.use: to build a kitchen

loans.name: Federita

texts.en: Federita A. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Cayhagan, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures. She provides transportation, buys and sells rice, and is also a pump boat operator for fishing. Her husband Sergio A., who is 47 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are 17 to 28 years old, with two of them already working and the youngest child currently going to school. Federita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Federita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 27,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $233, thus raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing 30,000 PHP, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for her future, her business and her family's needs. Federita A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for her business operations

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida P. is a 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Patria, Pandan, Antique, Philippines. Her elder son could not continue his studies in college because of poverty and lack of resources, but she never loses her hopes for her children.  The couple works hard in order to earn money to sustain their basic needs and to have savings for the future of their children.  They wanted both of their children to finish college.  Bienvendia also dreams of having a concrete house, which is separate from her variety store.

Bienvendia has been a member of ASHI for two years.  As a member, she maintains her good performance in repayment and attendance because she does not want ASHI and its field partner to lose their trust in her.

Bienvendia has requested a loan of 20,000.00 PHP, which will be used as a down payment for a motorcycle. This motorcycle will help decrease the family's  expense for transporting their child to school.  It could also give them additional income.  Bienvendia will also invest some of her loan as additional capital for her variety store.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida K. was born in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She graduated from trading college and has worked in this sphere for 30 years.  
In 2000, after the death of her husband, she became the only bread-winner for her three children. In order to find means of subsistence, Farida tried her hand at reselling footwear at the local market. In 2005, she obtained her first loan to broaden the range of goods she sold. This loan was used as intended and repaid without any delays.  

But in June 2010, Farida lost her business during violent clashes in the city of Osh caused by political turmoil. Her small shop was burned to ashes. However, she doesn’t give up easily and is ready to resume her lost business and continue her work. To help her do this, Farida is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS. She plans to spend the extra profits on providing a good education for her daughter.  

Farida is optimistic person, who doesn't look back and moves ahead. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to assist the especially vulnerable. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: El Sr. Moisés vive en la zona del plan 3000, vive ahí desde hace 8 años en alquiler, tiene dos lotes en la urb. Satélite donde esta construyendo su casa. El tiene una imprenta y serigrafía  el cual lo atienden junto a su esposa y una de sus hijas, por estas fiestas de fin de año tienen mucho trabajo  en la elaboración de tarjetas y calendarios,  el crédito que esta solicitando es para comprar materiales de construcción  para terminar de construir su casa. El sr. Moisés es proactivo en su trabajo y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijas, son una familia muy unida, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Moisés lives in Plan 3000 neighborhood.  He has been living in a rented house there for 8 years.  He has two plots of land in the Satélite development where he is building a house.

Moisés has a printing and silk screen printing business where he works together with his wife and one of his daughters.  They have a lot of work with the end-of-year holiday season, making cards and calendars. 

Moisés is requesting a loan to buy building materials so that he can finish building his house.  Moisés is proactive in his work and has the support of his daughters.  They are a very close family.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Abu Bakarr's Group

texts.en:
In the photo above are members of the AD Wurie Secondary School, situated in Lunsar, a town in northen Sierra Leone. These diligent and hard working teachers have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 3,300,000.00 in order to help them pay school fees for their children or invest in business or buy pieces of furniture, house building materials, or a plot of land, etc. AD Wurie Secondary School was founded in 2003. The school is staffed with 26 teachers with an enrollment of 600-700 pupils. 

With the help of this loan, leader of this group, Abu Bakarr T. (pictured second from right) will use his share of the laon (SLL 400,000) to buy house building materials like iron corrugated zinc, nails, boards, etc. Abu Bakarr is a 32 year old man, married to a teacher, and they have four children, two of whom are attending primary schools and the rest are not of school going age. Abu Bakarr was born in Lunsar town.

loans.use: To buy house building materials like iron corrugated zinc, nails, boards, etc.

loans.name: Flor María

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Estrella De Belén que se reúne cada 15 días en el Barrio Santa Marianita de la ciudad de  Manta, conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, en  este lugar la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica a la pesca y a las faenas del mar.

Para la señora Flor este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le agrada porque desde que ingreso sus compañeras más antiguas le han brindado todo su apoyo de igual forma la institución. Ella tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro  hijos de 8, 6, 4 y 2 años, los dos mayores están en escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la pesca.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, nos cuenta que sus clientes le realizan muchos pedidos y ella tiene que tenerlos para cuando ellos llegan de sus faenas en el mar. Trabaja dos  días de la semana y aprovecha cuando llegan los pescadores para  realizar sus ventas, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o una vez al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa como:  pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas, interiores, entre otras prendas. Sus sueños son tener un local comercial.
texts.en:
The village bank Estrella de Belén meets every 15 days in the neighborhood of Santa Marianita in the city of Manta, which is known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular with local and foreign tourists during the summer.   Most of the people there are fishermen or make their living from the sea in other ways. 

This is Flor's second cycle with the village bank and she is grateful because since she joined the group her older colleagues have given her a lot of support, as has the institution.  She is 26 years old, married and has 4 children - 8, 6, 4, and 2 years old - the oldest two of which are in school.  Her husband is a fisherman.  

Flor sells clothing door-to-door and also out of her home, where her customers come to her.  She tells us that her customers make a lot of requests and that she has to have them ready for when they return from the sea.  She works 2 days a week and takes advantage of the days that the fishermen come in to make her sales.  She sells to her customers on credit and charges them every 15 days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise every 15 to 30 days, depending on how often it's necessary.  

This loan is to buy clothes such as pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, underwear, and other clothes.  Her dream is to have a store.

loans.use: Buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Musu J

texts.en:
Musu is a 41-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have two children, who are 8 and 17 years old. In 2010, Musu established a retail food business because she was confident that it could be a means of providing a better livelihood for her family.

Musu is seeking a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL ($725), which would be used to buy more provisions such as sugar, milk, margarine, and sardines. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 267,000 SLL. In the future, Musu intends to acquire her own store. She plans on educating her children with the additional profits she expects to generate as a result of this loan. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., sugar, milk, margarine, and sardines

loans.name: Maria Jesusa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria; La socia tiene 1956 años D. edad, la socia es casada,  la socia tiene 4 hijos y todos son independientes, la socia antes se dedicaba al cuidado D. su nieto y ahora ella y su familia incursionaran el un nuevo proyecto, ellos comprarán pollos 200 apara empezar e iniciaran la crianza D. estas aves D. corral, la socia tiene mucha fe en que todo le irá muy bien y pronto estarán aumentando más pollos y así creciendo el negocio familiar, la socia conocedora D. la crianza D. pequeñas aves D. corral, sabe y tiene la pasión para hacerlo y apoyar a la familia en este proyecto, La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra D. pollos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. 200 pollos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “PATRON SAN SEBASTIAN communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province and department. 

The member‘s name is Maria. She is 54 years old, married and she has four independent children. In the past, Maria took care of her grandson. Now she and her family want to start a new project. They will buy 200 chickens to start breeding poultry.  Maria has lots of faith in this project and soon they will add more chickens in order to expand the family business. The member is the expert on the small birds. She knows how to take care of them and she has the passion for this and for supporting her family in this project. Maria wants to invest the money in the purchase of chickens. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of 200 chickens. 

The member is happy about the granted loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase 200 chickens

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Emprendedoras se denomina el grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Ita el 20 de mayo de 2009, gracias a que la actual Directora General la Sra. Lourdes J. contactó con la asesora para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, logró juntar a 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 5° ciclo.
La sra. Lourdes se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en su casa, está casada y tiene 2 hijos varones, ella desea poder vender a mayores escalas y cantidades, pero para lograr eso necesita más variedades para ofrecer, por ello solicita el crédito a fin de poder comprar cosméticos Avon y volver a venderlos en las cantidades que ella cree le traerán buenos ingresos económicos.
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
This group of women is called 'Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Enterprising Women).  The group was formed in the city of Ita on May 20th, 2009.  The current Director General, Lourdes Jiménez, contacted an advisor to find out how the 'Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras' (Committee of Enterprising Women) works.  She managed to get together 21 women who are now happily working on their 5th loan cycle.

Lourdes' business is selling cosmetics from home.  She is married and has two sons.  She would like to be able to sell on a larger scale and in larger quantities but in order to achieve this she needs a greater variety of products.  For this reason, she has requested her loan so that she can buy Avon cosmetics and sell them in the quantities that she believes will make her a good income.

All the members of this group carry out activities in order to raise funds.  They help each other to achieve the goals that they have within the group and with Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics (especially from Avon)

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with six children, four boys and three girls. Five of her children attend school while one is still young for school. For the past two years, she has operated a palm leaves selling business for use in roofing houses, and she sells at the market and from home to her neighbours and passersby. Kadzo faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transporting palm leaves in her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting, she wants to purchasepalm leaves and resell them at a profit. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase palm leaves and resell them at a profit

loans.name: Castillito De Arena Group

texts.es: La Banca de Emprendimiento Castillito de Arena es una Banca Nueva que figura desde una mínima actividad hasta la venta de comida, esta banca se caracteriza por afinidad y conocimiento entre las mismas. La Presidenta es la Señora Claudia  quien vende medias y dulces en su puesto de la uyustus una feria muy conocida de la ciudad de La Paz, viviendo como cuidadora ya hace 20 años, tras  las dificultades en su vida supo sobresalir y seguir adelante con la ayuda de su pareja quien le apoya en todo momento con el dinero del crédito desea compra mercadería en medias al por mayor, el deseo de la Sra. Claudia es el de comprarse un terrenito y hacer construir su casita para poder irse a vivir ahí ya que el cuidar la casa donde esta implica también mucho riesgo, es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecida con la institución `por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The “Banca de Emprendimiento Castillito de Arena” is a new bank where its members are involved in different things, including food sales.  Its members are close and know each other very well.  Claudia is the group’s president and sells socks and candy from her stall in a very well known La Paz fair.  Having lived carefully for the past 20 years, amid life’s difficulties, she has learned to get ahead with her husband’s backing.  She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise, like socks in bulk.  She wants to eventually buy some land where she can have a house built, because it’s risky to live where she lives now.  She is a hard working woman who is very grateful to the institution for the support it has given.

loans.use: to buy socks for resale

loans.name: Jairo Nahun

texts.es:
Jairo,  reside en Guatajiagua, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, él vive con su familia compuesta por: su madre y tres hermanos, Jairo y sus hermanos trabajan juntos en esta época de invierno en el cultivo de maíz y frijol.
Su padre le enseño a trabajar, la ventaja es su experiencia y su desventaja es el clima, ya que los cultivos dependen de la condición del clima, además les ayuda a sus amigos dándoles trabajo. Él actualmente solicita un trabajo para comprar abono y contratar mano de obra para iniciar con la poda del terreno.
Este préstamo le ayudara a realizar el trabajo agrícola, con la esperanza de tener una buena cosecha y por lo tanto este mejor la comercialización de la producción. Su aspiración es tener su propio negocio, su propia vivienda ya que vive con su madre y hermanos, él espera triunfar poco a poco tanto en lo económico como social.
texts.en:
Jairo lives in Guatajiagua in the department of Morazán.  He grows corn and beans.  He lives with his family, which consists of his mother and his three brothers.  Jairo and his brothers work together in this time of winter to grow corn and beans. 

His father taught him to work.  His advantage is his experience, and his disadvantage is the climate, since the crops depend on the condition of the climate.  His friends also help them by giving them work.  He is currently applying for a loan in order to buy fertilizer and hire workers to start preparing the land.

This loan will help him to carry out his farming, with the hope of having a good harvest and therefore better sales of his produce.  His aspiration is to have his own business and his own home, since he lives with his mother and brothers.  He hopes to triumph bit by bit both economically and socially.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and hire workers to start preparing the land.

loans.name: Nyeupe Group

texts.en:
The Yahaya, who is in his late thirties, is married and has four children who are still going to school.  He has had a construction welding business since 2000.  He works from 7.30am to 6.30pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Yahaya's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy spares parts for his welding business and to pay school fees for his children. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  Yahaya is requesting another loan to buy more materials for the welding business. His dream is to one day finish building his house, which he has already started.

Yahaya will share this loan with his loan group ,"Nyeupe", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the picture, Yahaya is 3rd from right in the back row.

loans.use: To buy materials for his welding business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is 35 years old.  She is married and has 7 children, all of them go to school.  Betty sells cassava flour and has borrowed a loan to stock more cassava flour to sell.  She hopes to construct a concrete house in the future with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: buy cassava flour

loans.name: Valiko

texts.en:
Valiko is 53 years old and lives in the village of Tsintskaro, Kartli Region. He is married and lives with his wife Mary, 27-year-old son, daughter-in-law and 2-year-old granddaughter.
Valiko is a taxi driver. He drives his own car and earns approximately 500 Laris per month. Recently, the number of customers has decreased because he has had to charge higher prices for his service because of the petrol price increase. Not many villagers can afford to use the taxi service at a higher price. Because of the abovementioned problem, Valiko has decided to change his taxi's fuel system from petrol to gas, which is cheaper than petrol and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 per cent. It will allow Valiko to decrease the price of the service, which will attract many customers. Increasing the number of customers and cutting his costs will positively affect his profit. He will pay a local auto service center to change the fuel system. The increased income will be used for family wellbeing.

loans.use: to pay for a fuel system change for his taxi.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 34 years old and is a married woman. She has been running a small rice farm since 1996. Her husband is also a farmer.

Merlyn helps her husband till their land. Rice is the primary crop that they grow. According to Merlyn, she earns about 5800 PHP per month.

Merlyn's loan will be used to purchase gasoline for the tractor, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She hopes to be a successful businesswoman someday.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline for the tractor, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Lisy

texts.es:
La Señora Maria Lisy tiene 39 años de edad, esta casada, vive en  la ciudad de Encarnacion.
Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas desde hace ya unos años. Es muy conocida en el barrio por las joyas que trae para la venta. Ella es muy buena mujer. Se define como una mujer trabajadora y luchadora. Cuenta que todo lo que hace es a miras hacia un futuro mejor.
Ella sueña con algún día poder abrir una joyería propia donde pueda ofrecer una gran variedad de joyas. Esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que gracias a su trabajo ha podido salir adelante y solventrar los gastos de la casa.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas joyas, como ser pulseras, cadenas anillos y demás, para tener mas variedad de productos. Desde ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Lisy is 39 years old, married, and lives in the city of Encarnación.  She has been selling jewelry for some years.  She is very well known in her neighborhood for the jewelry that she sells.  She is a very good woman and describes herself as a hard-working and tenacious woman.  She tells us that everything she does is with a view to creating a better future for herself.

Maria Lisy dreams that some day she will be able to open her own jewelry store where she will sell a wide range of jewelry.  She is very proud of what she does since, thanks to her work, she has been able to get ahead in life and cover her household expenses.

Maria Lisy is requesting a loan to buy more jewelry such as bracelets, chains, rings, etc., so that she can offer a wider range of products.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to sell such as chains, bracelets, rings, etc.

loans.name: Diana Del Socorro

texts.es:
Diana de 38 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por ser  agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace algunos años Diana se dedica a la comercialización de ganado ovino (ovejas) y aves de corral (gallinas y pavos), los cría en corrales amplios que tiene en la parte posterior de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales, una vez que hayan completado su crecimiento, los vende a sus clientes o en los diferentes mercados de la zona  y con los ingresos podrá cubrir sus necesidades y obligaciones de su casa.   También tiene tierras de cultivo donde siembra de limón,una vez que cosecha lo comercializa.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar de alimentos balanceados y de fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras de cultivo, con las ganancias que obtenga por la venta de sus aves como de su limón pagará su crédito otorgado y mejorará el nivel de vida de su familia.  Diana con su responsabilidad y empeño está logrando que su familia salga adelante, con la finalidad que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades en un futuro.
texts.en:
Diana, 38, lives with her husband and children in her own house; it does not have basic utilities yet and is located in Tambogrande District which belongs to Piura Department.  This area is noted for farming, livestock raising and crafts making.

For a few years now Diana has been selling ovine livestock (sheep) and barnyard fowl (chickens and turkeys).  She raises them in spacious corrals she has in her back yard.  She feeds them nutritionally balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they complete their growth she sells them to her customers or in various local markets and uses income from the sales to cover her household needs and commitments.  She also has farmland where she grows lemons that are sold when harvested

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed and fertilizer to improve her farmland.  She will use profits from her fowl and from her lemon sales to repay the granted loan and to improve her family’s standard of living.  Through her hard work and dedication Diana has managed to move her family forward her only goal being that her children have other opportunities in the future.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed and to buy fertilizers to improve her fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a vegetable selling business in the Philippines.

Violeta requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell.

Violeta has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 51 years old and is married.  She has 8 children.  Her children are between 32 and 14 years old. Veronica’s husband works as a farmer and driver.

Veronica has been engaged in farming for 25 years. She helps her husband till their land and plant crops, such as rice and corn. Veronica applied for a loan because they do not have the capacity to buy the farm inputs that they need. Veronica plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for tractor rent.

In the future, Veronica hopes to improve their house. She also hopes to have a good business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for tractor rent

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 44 years. He is married to Mildred and they have four children. He has been a landlord for the last 16 years, making a monthly profit of 6,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). He has been loaned KES 20,000 with which he plans to renovate his rental houses.

With the anticipated profit made, he plans to purchase another plot to build more rental houses, and also plans to educate his children.

He hopes to expand in the near future and build flats for rental.

loans.use: to renovate his rental houses.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business. She operates from home and her neighbors and passersby are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transport in her business. She dreams of expanding her business. 

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Juan Mario

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, en casa familiar, el se dedica a vender productos de limpieza (detergente para lava platos,  desinfectante para pisos y azulejos) trabaja desde hace seis años, no tiene un horario establecido, el producto lo reparte por mayor a sus clientes.
El préstamo lo necesita para mejorar su negocio poder obtener más producto de buena calidad (lavatrastos, desinfectantes para piso e inodoros) y sobre todo incrementar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Juan es que su familia tenga lo necesario para vivir y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and two children in their family home.  He works selling cleaning products (washing-up liquid, disinfectant for floors and tiles).  He has been doing this for the last six years, and doesn't have a fixed work schedule.  He distributes his products at wholesale for his customers.

He needs the loan to improve his business, by being able to buy more good quality products (dishwasher detergent, disinfectants for floors and toilets), and above all to increase his income.

Juan's dream is that his family has what they need to live, and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy dishwasher detergent and disinfectants to sell.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is 61 years old, married, and has seven children. To earn a living, he runs a retail shop.  He started the business six years ago. 
 
Besides, he owns rental houses which earn him extra income.  Previously, he owned a bar. Josephat has retained his business because of his hard work and determination. 

 He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to add more rental houses.

loans.use: to add more rental houses.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36-years-old, married and has one child. 

Haydar has been the owner of a women's clothing shop since 2010. He sells cosmetics, accessories and clothing. He has more than five years experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting $1200 loan in order to build an outdoor ceiling, produce ad boards and to purchase more mannequins for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to improve his family’s life.

loans.use: to build an outdoor ceiling, produce ad boards and to purchase more mannequins for his shop.

loans.name: Melecio

texts.es:
el sr. Melecio tiene 44 años de edad, vive en unión libre y es padre de 5 hijos, Melecio se dedica a la caficultura desde hace más de 9 años y también tiene unas vacas lo que le han cambiado la manera de alimentarse a sus hijos, en su casa la mayoría del tiempo esta la leche para sus hijos, en la zona donde vive es raro que las personas tengan leche todos los dias.
Melecio realiza sus trabajos de campo con sus hijos mayores, sus ganancias son 100% netas.
Utilizara el credito para la compra de un panel de energia solar, pues su sueño es que sus hijos vivan mejor y cambiarles aun más sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Sr. Melecio is 44 years old, in a common-law relationship, and the father of five children. He has been a coffee grower for more than 9 years. Melecio also owns a few cows, which has changed the way he feeds his children. Most of the time he has milk available for his children. In the area where he lives, it is rare that people have a daily supply of milk.

Melecio performs the work in the fields with the help of his older children. His earnings consist of 100% profit.

He will use this loan to buy a solar panel system. His dream is for his children to live better and to transform their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a solar panel system.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.es: Johnatan, de 26 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su mamá Elena en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ataura. Él es un joven con aspiraciones, hace poco terminó la carrera técnica de agronomía. Desde ese entonces son 4 años de experiencia sembrando maíz, de calidad en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que le fueron heredados de parte de sus madre, a quien quiere mucho. Gracias a su conocimiento logró adquirir buenos ingresos, ahora desea ampliar sus conocimientos con una carrera universitario, eso es su objetivo. Para ello formó una empresa de carpintería y construcción de obras de infraestructura para el sector público y privado. Gana muy bien en estas actividades, por eso está pensando contratar a profesionales para ampliar sus ganancias y tener más clientes. Él pertenece al banco comunal “hacienda” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente feliz, pues recibe el apoyo de todos ustedes, quienes le permiten seguir en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues su asociación lo conforman personas responsables y solidarias. Johnatan, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales y herramientas para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de maíz.
texts.en: Jonathan, age 26, is a responsible man. He lives together with his mother, Elena, in their own house, located in the town of Ataura. He is a young man with aspirations, who recently completed a technical degree in agronomy. Since that time, he has had 4 years of experience growing high-quality corn on his own farmlands. This land was passed on to him by his mother, whom he loves very much. Thanks to his knowledge, he has been able to achieve a good level of income. Now he would like to broaden his knowledge with a university degree, which is his objective. For this purpose, he formed a company providing carpentry services and infrastructural project construction for the public and private sectors. He earns very well from these activities, and thus he is thinking of contracting professionals to broaden his earnings and have more customers. He belongs to the "Hacienda" communal bank, and this is his second loan with MFP, where he feels happy because he receives support from all of you, who permit him to continue with his business. He also promises to be punctual with his loan payments, since his association is made up of responsible people with a strong sense of solidarity. When he receives this support, Jonathan will invest the funds he is requesting in buying natural fertilizers and tools to maintain his corn crops.

loans.use: to buy tools and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Fetuao

texts.en:
Fetuao is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Fatausi. She is married and has two school-aged children.  

To make a living, Fetuao makes and sells food, primarily baked goods, in the local community. Fetuao has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 600 WST a month.

In 2010, Fetuao joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Fetuao has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.  

Fetuao is now requesting a new loan of 1,000 WST, which will be used to purchase a new oven. This will be the second loan taken out by Fetuao from SPBD. 

Fetuao plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new oven.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 36 years old and a single mother of one.  She runs a salon so as to earn a living.  She has been in this business for thirteen years.  She also does farming to supplement her income.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money.  

She hopes to become a prosperous business-lady in the future.  She has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy hair braids and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy hair braids and cosmetics.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Promujer Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo de señoras que ha recibido dos préstamos por parte de Fundación Mujer, ahora se financiara a dos integrantes del Banco Mujer, Anita y Herminia,quienes van por el segundo nivel de créditos, ambas son vecinias de Paso Canoas, frontera de Costa Rica Panama, y se dedican a la misma actividad de servicios, venta de comidas y golosinas, desde hace varios años atras; pero no son competencia directa entre si, ya que Herminia tiene su local sobre la calle principal a la aduna y Anita la tiene en una comunidad que se llama Laurel que se ubica a unos 6 kilometros de Paso Canoas.
Esta es una fuente importante de generación de ingresos para la economia domestica, ya que en el caso de Herminia es su única fuente de ingresos y en el caso de Anita, su compañero es un trabajador subempleado de labores agricolas, quien muchas veces no logra trabajar una semana completa, de allí que lo que logra llevar a su casa como salario es variable y con la actividad de Anita se complementa el presupuesto de la familia.
Este préstamo se utilizara para reforzar el capital de trabajo de las sodas y se invertira en la compara de refrescos gaseosos, jugos, galletas y bocadillos así como en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los casados, hamburgesas, tacos ete.
Las metas a corto plazo es poder contar con recursos economicos, para hacer mejoras a sus viviendas, tanto en sus techos como los pisos.
texts.en: This is a group of women who have received two loans from Fundacion Mujer (Women’s Foundation).  Now, the organization will fund two of the members of Banco Mujer (Women’s Bank), Anita and Herminia, who are in their second loan cycle.  Both of the women are neighbors in Paso Canoas, on the border between Costa Rica and Panama, and they have worked in the same business, selling food and candies, for many years.  They are not in direct competition with each other since Herminia’s store is on the main street and Anita’s is in a neighborhood called Laurel which is 6 kilometers from Paso Canoas.  This is an important source of income generation for their families, as it is Herminia’s only source of income and Anita’s partner is an under-employed farm worker who often cannot work a full week.  What he is able to bring home as salary varies, so Anita’s work supplements the family’s budget.  This loan will be used to strengthen the capital earned from selling sodas and will be invested in the purchase of the raw materials to make hamburgers, tacos, etc.  The women’s short-term goal is to be able to count on their financial resources to make home improvements, both on the roof and floors.

loans.use: buy soft drinks, juices, crackers, and candies.

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
A widower from a village of the Thmor Koul district, Thoeurn is 32 years old and has no children. He is a farmer and he has been farming on his 1.5 hectare farmland for nearly twenty years to earn a living. Also, he buys and sells rice and cassava to better support his family. 

Thoeurn has been with VisionFund since 2008. The loans have helped him to make a living better. With his current business, he earns more than US$20 per day but is able to save only US$2.50 daily. Now Thoeurn and his co-member Kunthea who has been with VisionFund for five years are applying for another loan. He will use his entire share of the loan to hire workers to harvest his rice crop. He hopes that his rice crop will be harvested on time and available for sale. He also hopes to buy necessary comforts and renovate his house.

loans.use: To hire workers to harvest his rice crop.

loans.name: Adowa

texts.en: Adowa  cooks "banku" (fermented corn dough) and fried fish for sale at Asebu Ekroful. She is a single parent  and has six children.  Adowa has been selling "banku" and fried fish for 10 years. She feeds and clothes her children and  pays their school fees with her income. She will use loan to buy fish and maize in bulk for the  preparation her "banku" and fish to sell. She hopes to use the new profits  to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fish and maize in bulk.

loans.name: Epifania Morales Luis

texts.es: La socia es del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y madre de 6 hijos.Es dueña de un negocio de venta de locería, frazadas y otros productos de uso doméstico, también trabaja a base de pedidos. Ella dice que todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú pudo educar a sus hijos de manera adecuada y progresar al lado de toda su familia, y mucho de eso lo aprendió con las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como locería, frazadas, artículos para el hogar.
texts.en: The member is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy II.  She is 46 years old and is married and the mother of 6 children.  She owns a business selling pottery, blankets and other products for domestic use.  She also works based on requests.  She says that all this time as a member of FINCA Perú, she has been able to educate her children in an adequate manner and make progress alongside her entire family.  Much of this she learned from the training sessions that she received at her Communal Bank.  The loan that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of merchandise for her business such as pottery, blankets, and other household items.

loans.use: To purchase pottery, blankets, and other household items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Kisii area of Kenya, which is not far from Masai land. She has five children. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and crops; she has been doing this work for four years.

She stated that what she most enjoys about farming is the "income received from it." Her biggest challenge is that she "needs more time." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "Juhudi."

Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "Low interest." This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session: "Help people to improve life."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Mary replied, "It will improve their livelihood."

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mary owns the following: cow, poultry. She does not own pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito net and solar power, but does not have electricity, running water, sewing machine, TV, or DVD.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and a water tank.

loans.name: Gs Los Mon-Tes Group

texts.es:
Don Jose Gabriel es una persona con 50 años  de edad el vive con sus hermana,  tiene su negocio de pulpería/abarrotería  y cuenta con un  deposito de frescos desde hace  20  años,   se dedica a esta actividad  que  realiza  en su casa de habitación en su  comunidad, y tiene muchas otras actividades que le generan ingresos. 

Don José Gabriel con el crédito que está solicitando necesita  comprar  más productos  como ser refrescos, granos básicos, huevos, manteca, escobas, paraguas, grapas, arroz etc...Para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, está muy contento de la oportunidad que Prisma le puede brindar.
Su sueño  es ampliar el negocio, para poder tener mejores ingreso y tener una mejor vida. Esta solicitando el crédito en forma grupal y sus integrantes son:

Don Emiliano Ernesto se dedica al compra y venta de ganado. 

Doña Mercedes Emérita se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas.
	
Choluteca, Honduras –  Septiembre  del 2015
texts.en:
José Gabriel is 50-years old and lives with his sister. He has a grocery store business and has had a fresh food store for 20 years. He does this job in his house in his community and has many other jobs that get him income.

With the loan that he is requesting, José Gabriel needs to buy more products such as soft drinks, basic grains, eggs, butter, brooms, umbrellas, staples, rice, etc., to cover his customer's orders. He is very happy for the opportunity that Primsa can offer him.

His dream is to grow his business to be able to have better earnings and have a better life. He is asking for a loan in group form and the members are:

Emiliano Ernesto works buying and selling cattle.

Mercedes Emérita works making and selling tortillas.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2015

loans.use: to buy more products such as soft drinks, basic grains, eggs, butter, brooms, umbrellas, staples, rice, etc.

loans.name: Nepher

texts.en:
When smallholder farmers come together, they are powerful,” says Nepher, a 36-year-old farmer who has eight children and lives in the village of Ndalu in the Kitale area of Kenya. For the past three years she has been actively involved in mixed farming. She has been practicing crop farming, but she has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements. This is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, she will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that she will use to greatly improve her crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure her of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. Nepher is very visionary, and her goal for the season is to boost her crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Nepher is a responsible mum and a hard worker who is willing to make every effort to meet her goals which includes leaving her farming business to her children one day to continue the work. Help Nepher with the loan she needs and allow him to realize her dreams.
During this festive and holiday season support smallholder women farmer in Kenya!

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is 45 years old, married with six children. Two of whom are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Nena has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Nena requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and new tools for her tricycle passenger.

Nena has been in this business for three years. In the future, Nena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and new tools for her tricycle passenger.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Lucy would like to buy 125 bags of cement for her hardware store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Rosemary would like to buy more utensils for her porridge and food stuff business and settle in a kiosk

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Mr. M. has sixteen years of experience in the field of publicizing local businesses. He distributes pamphlets and plays ads over his vehicle-mounted public address system. He is asking for a loan of $1,000.00 to upgrade to a more powerful sound system, so that he can get more clients and give his wife and children a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Sr. M. es una persona que cuenta en este ramo con 16 años de experiencia su actividad dar a conocer negocios. Por medio de perifoneo y folletos, con este negocio mantiene a su familia .El necesita un crédito de $ 1.000.00 DLLS. Para comprar un equipo de sonido más potente. Para tener mas clientes y dar una mejor vida a sus hijos y su esposa.

loans.use: To buy public address system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more chicks and increase stock in the pharmacy

loans.name: Arifa

texts.en:
F. Arifa was born in the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory in the Gubadli region, situated in the west part of Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasuses. She is 45 years old and the mother of three children. Right now, she lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan. She started her business in 2002. She sells creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, etc. Her daughter helps her at this work. 

In 2004 Arifa borrowed $500 from Normicro, to buy perfume goods and to expand her business. With this business she earned little money. Her income was enough for only some of her family's basic needs, but she had difficulty in covering other family needs like medication, clothes, and school fees.

Next, she borrowed $700 to buy more merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory and to be able to offer her clients a bigger variety and quality of goods. Now she needs $1000 for expanding her business even more and improving her family living conditions.  She wants increase the number of clients and increase her income considerably. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Expanding her business and improving her family living conditions.

loans.name: Catalina De Los Sant

texts.es:
This woman is from the city of Managua. She started her business in the outskirts of the market 14 years ago with a modest working capital of $80.00, money that she saved through her hard work selling cigarettes on the streets. She started her business when she realized that she would not be able cover her and her children's needs.

When she started her business she didn't sell many products and the conditions in her shop weren't great because she started in a modest, small kiosk. Thanks to her hard work and perseverence and after much sacrifice, she was able to refurbish her store and pay for her children's education.

She now offers a wide variety of products. She has been working with CEPRODEL for 3 years and has a record of 13 loans, which have helped her because thanks to the funding she has prospered.

Esta señora es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Su negocio empieza en las afueras del mercado 14 años con un modesto capital de trabajo de US$80.00, fruto de sus ahorros que logro reunir con mucho esfuerzo cuando vendia cigarrillos de manera ambulante en las calles. Ella inicia el negocio al observar que no lograba cubrir las necesidades propias y de sus hijos.

Dicho negocio contaba con apenas algunos productos y las condiciones del local no eran las apropiadas ya que empezo en un modesto y pequeño kiosko. Como fruto de su esfuerzo y perseverancia con mucho sacrificio logró acondicionar el local y darles educación a sus hijos.

Ella ahora oferta una amplia variedad de productos. Trabaja con CEPRODEL, desde hace 3 años con un record de 13 creditos, lo cual le ha beneficiado porque gracias al financiamiento ha logrado prosperar.

loans.use: To purchase products to stock up on inventory

loans.name: Fuifui

texts.en: Manunu village is inland on the east side of Upolu island. It's one of the most promising centres in the history of SPBD in Samoa. Fuifui is one of their clients and this is her second loan from SPBD. She will use the money  for her children to return to school next year. She will spend the rest to replace some of her plantation equipment. From her business in harvest season she gets nearly $1000 a week. This helps with her family's everyday living expenses and covers her church and family affairs contributions.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation and for her children's school expenses

loans.name: Mariam's Drink Shop Group

texts.en:
Mariam, is 28-years-old and is married with a 7 year old child. She owns a soft drinks business, which she started in 2005. She sells soft drinks from 6am to 7pm daily, and now makes a monthly profit of about $55 from her sales.

In the past, Mariam successfully took out a loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more soft drinks. She now hopes to take out a new loan to start selling snacks with her drinks. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in timber, food, fruit and vegetables, and general items sales.

loans.use: To start serving snacks with her drinks

loans.name: Dodarbek.

texts.ru:
Dodarbek M. lives in the Rudaki region, he is 45 years old, is married and has 5 children. He has a vocational education. He is a welder and works in a private shop that makes metal products such as stoves. He has 25 years of experience, this profession is the sole source of support for his family and provides him with a decent income. Dodabrek will use his loan to purchase necessary instruments and materials (metal). He will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Мирзоев Додарбек Яридбекович проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 45 лет ,замужем имеет 5 детей.Образование средне-специальное. По профессии сварщик. Работает в частной мастерской по производству металлических изделий: печки, тапчаны и т.д. Опыт работы в данной сфере 25 лет.Этот вид деятельности единственный источник дохода его семьи.Кредит хочет получить для того чтобы купить необходимые инструменты и материал ( металл). Эта деятельность дает неплохой доход. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase instruments and materials

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs Ngô Thị Kỷ is 39 years old. She joined TYM fund in 2000. She had a rice husking business, the waste bran & husk were used to feed her pigs. After a year of success, she started investing in pig farming. She had high hope for this business. She built new pig pen and also a biogas installation. She also sells vegetables. Her family income is 200-300 USD a month. Today, there are 27 pigs in her stable each weighing 30 kg. This time she requests a loan of 1200 USD to buy breeding pigs and mash. She also has plan to convert part of her land to raise egg laying chickens. Mrs Kỷ lives in Sóc Sơn with her husband and their 2 children.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Tham gia Quỹ năm 2000 chị Ngô Thị Kỷ, 39 tuổi, vay vốn buôn bán thóc gạo, tận dụng cám nuôi lợn. Sau năm đầu làm ăn hiệu quả, các vòng vốn sau chị vay mức cao nhất đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn với qui mô lớn. Chị Kỷ tiến hành xây dựng chuồng trại, bể bioga. Bên cạnh đó chị Kỷ còn bán thực phẩm tươi sống tại trung tâm thôn. Mức thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị hàng tháng khoảng 200-300USD. Hiện tại trong chuồng nhà chị có 27 con lợn thịt, mỗi con khoảng 30kg. Vòng vốn này chị Kỷ xin vay 1200USD mua thêm lợn giống và thức ăn gia súc. Chị cũng đang có dự định cải tạo vườn tạp xây dựng chuồng trại chăn nuôi gà đẻ. Chị Kỷ hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 2 con tại Sóc Sơn.

loans.use: Buy pigs and mash.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 27 years old and lives in Southern Lebanon, located in Tyre. Fatima owns a small market, where she sells a variety of goods. Fatima would like to apply for a loan to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Yuli

texts.id: Usaha sehari-hari Edi Suyanto adalah sebagai pedagang bakso. Usaha ini dijalani sudah sejak lama. Dengan berkeliling, setiap harinya dia menjual bakso buatannya menggunakan rombong atau gerobak kayunya. Kegiatannya sehari-hari dimulai dari pagi dengan berbelanja bahan membuat bakso dari pasar terdekat seperti bawang merah, mie, sayur dan daging sapi. Setelah diolah dan matang, pada sore harinya dia berkeliling untuk berjualan. Tetapi terkadang dia juga berjualan di Sekolah Dasar dekat tempat tinggalnya. Penghasilan dari berjualan bakso sementara ini cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Dia berkeinginan suatu saat nanti bisa menabung untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya yang saat ini tinggal di Jawa.

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Maximiliana's Group

texts.en:
Mariela, Maximiliana, and Lucia belong to the Village Bank Huascahura.

Maximiliana lives with her boyfriend, is 34 years old and has three children. Maximiliana sells cereals in the Ayacuchan jungle – her sales are wholesale and she distributes to stores and also buys fruit from the jungle that she sells at the market in the city of Ayacucho.

Mariela lives with her boyfriend, is 19 years old, and has one child. Mariela sells various products such as cleaning articles and hooks. She sells these things on Sundays at the fair in the city of Huanta.

Lucia is married, 38 years old and has six children. Lucia weaves sweaters by hand and sells them to her neighbors as well as to people who order them from her. Lucia also buys baby chickens which she sells in the different towns of the region.

Mariela, Maximiliana, and Lucia need loans of 900 soles, 900 soles and 600 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of toothpaste, asphalt, brushes, detergent, beans wheat, barley and chicken.

Mariela, Maximiliana and Lucia dream of having a mototaxi, building their own houses, and that their children complete their studies.

loans.use: To purchase toothpaste, asphalt, brushes, detergent, beans wheat, barley and chicken.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es:
Alex is 26 years old. He is a young father who earns money through the transport of passengers in his motorcar as well as through the care and maintenance of a small shop in his spare time. Together with his wife, Alex strives to provide for the care and education of his small children. Alex needs to buy spare parts for his motorcar and to get it repaired so that he can be sure it works every day, and little by little, he would like to expand and offer more and improve his shop. For this he turns to you to ask for this loan promises to pay it back punctually. Alex knows the strength of his youth and this helps him to set new goals for himself. He hopes that you put your confidence in him.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva volunteer.

Alex es un joven padre de 26 años, dedicado al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro, y en sus momentos libres al cuidado y mantenimiento de su bodega. Junto a su esposa se esfuerzan para cumplir con el cuidado y la educación de sus pequeños hijos.Alex necesita comprar repuestos para su motocarro y mandarlo a reparar para seguir trabajando diariamente, y poco a poco ir ampliando e implementando más y mejor su bodega, por ello que recurre a ustedes para solicitar un préstamo, que promete pagar puntualmente. Alex sabe que las fuerzas de su juventud lo ayudan a emprender nuevas metas, y espera que pongan su confianza en él.

loans.use: To buy spare parts to repair the motorcar he uses for passenger transport and to improve his shop

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti C. is a resident of Tangal Lalitpur.  Tangal is one of the busiest bazaars of the Lalitpur district.  Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.  

Mrs. Shanti C. has four members, including herself, in her family.  A few years ago, her husband, Mr. Siddhi Ratna C., died, so she now has sole responsibility for her family.

Shanti C. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Tangal.  She opened her grocery store three years ago to improve the living standards of her family.  She sells different grocery items in her shop.  She has two sons and one daughter who help in her shop.  Her older son works in a finance office.  Her younger son and daughter help their mother in her grocery store.

Now, Mrs. Shanti C. is requesting a Rs 25000.00 loan to buy various grocery items such as rice, maize and snacks to expand her shop.

loans.use: To buy various grocery items to expand her business

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Ярматова Малика проживает в районе Хуросон. В центре района имеет диллерский центр , где реализует пластиковые карты сотовых компаний. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить карточки. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 5 лет . Дело приносит доход позволяющий прокормить семью. Она замужем и имеет одного ребенка.Увеличение товарооборота позволит ей обеспечить рынки района данным видом товара. Погашать  кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Malika Y. lives in the Khuroson region. She owns a dealership center at the center of the region where she sells plastic cards from cellular companies. Malika plans to take out a loan in order to purchase a supply of cards for sale. She has been in this business for 5 years. The business brings her an income that allows her to feed her family. Malika is married and has one child. Increasing her inventory will allow her to provide regional markets with phone cards. She plans to pay back her loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of phone cards

loans.name: Las Maria Group

texts.en:
"Las Maria" is one of the prime examples of the good affects of microcredit loans. Every member of this group of 15 is applying for their 7th loan! Each member took out their first loan from Esperanza International having virtually nothing. Now, going on their 7th loan, each member has had success with their very own business. 

Antonia A. is the chosen group representative and has proven to be a great leader and a blessing to the group. She is a very hardworking woman who is very diligent in everything she does. She is the mother of 5 children, and they were the reason she took out her first loan. She has always wanted to provide a good life for her family, and for the first time in her life she is starting to be able to provide for them. She looks for this next loan to increase her business and to continue to grow. She dreams of being able to travel and having her own thriving food market someday. On behalf of Antonia, the rest of the group, and Esperanza International: Thank you for your support!!

loans.use: Small Food Store

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.en: Dilshoda U. is 28 years old. She is married with two children. Since she was a young girl, Dilshoda has helped her mother with her clothing sales business. Four years ago, Dilshoda began selling towels and different kinds of dishes in the store, since her husband’s income was not enough to cover their family expenses. That was how she got a taste of the business and found that it earned her sufficient income. Currently, she works in this business full time, and thanks to her enthusiasm, she has made a name for herself in the market. However, her clients request more and more things each day, which is why Dilshoda is requesting a loan of 1000 Somoni ($300), which she will repay within a 6-month term. With this money, Dilshoda will be able to purchase more towels and dishes and thereby give her business a boost. With your help, Dilshoda will be able to help her children prosper and go to school.

loans.use: To buy more towels and dishes to sell

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Mrs. Yim S. was born in Svay Prey Village in Kampong Cham Province.  She is a breeder who raises pigs and ducklings.  

Since the first business is going well, she wants to expand it.  So, she decided to ask for a loan to buy four piglets for breeding.  She would use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food for her pigs.  Her husband, Mr. Pol Pin, is a farmer who owns 3-hectares of land to cultivate rice to earn a living.  

Mrs. Yim S. is 37 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom is a construction worker, while two others are attending the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old.  Her husband is shown with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy four piglets for breeding.  She will use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food for her pigs.

loans.name: Sajida Parveen M. Arshad Group

texts.en:
Sajida Parveen baji is a 33-year-old married lady and resides in a place called Kot Radha Kishan which is 24 km from the city of Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the past 14 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is a factory worker. She has four kids: two sons and two daughters. None of her children goes to school.

Sajida baji is involved in a milk-selling business with an experience of 9 years. She has got good recognition for her hard work. Sajida baji does this work to improve her family’s living standard. She means to continue to do this work until she is satisfied with the living standard of her family, e.g. when she is able to send her children to school and renovate her house. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a micro-finance institution in Pakistan). Now she is requesting a loan to buy another buffalo to expand her milk-selling business.

Sajida baji is the group leader for some more women. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk-selling business. Hanifan baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Mukhtayaran baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (tea and sugar) for her tea stall. Rehana Kosar baji wants a loan to buy an ox to till the land.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her milk-selling business

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn E. is a villager in Kvet village, Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a chicken breeder. Her husband, Mr. Bay Sok Ban, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. However, his field is infertile and so Mrs. Lorn E. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to purchase two more chickens for breeding. She is 29 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and two chickens.

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en:
Jafar M. is 46 years old.  He is married with three sons.  He is an entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as sweets, preserved foods, soft drinks, juices and other items in his grocery store. 

Jafar is not alone in this business.  His whole family actively helps him with sales.  Jafar's additional source of income is teaching. 

Jafar applied for a $1200 loan to grow and expand his business.  He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and a while to achieve his goals and become a successful entrepreneur.  We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: Purchase food products

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida M. is 48 years old and is a consistently well-performing member of ASHI. She owns a variety store and has been able to maintain her business for almost six years. She had only P 110.00 as starting capital, which she used to purchase breads and candies. 

She is married and blessed with five children who inspired her to pursue her dreams. Her requested loan of P 30,000.00 will be an important tool for her variety store. It will allow her to purchase additional stocks and will help her to get discounts by buying in volume.

Zenaida dreams of expanding her variety store into groceries so that her business can help sustain the academic needs of her children until they finish their studies or become employed.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks for variety store.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick sells spare parts for machines to his customers. He loves this business because he makes lots of profit from it. He is hoping for a loan of N70,000 to purchase more spare parts to sell. He is 36 years old and is married with 2 children. He says "thanks" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more machine spare parts to sell

loans.name: Rose Adhiambo

texts.en:
Rose Adhiambo A. is a 46-year-old single mother of two children aged 28 and 26. She sells bed sheets, blankets and bowls imported from Tanzania in Nymasaria slum, here in Kisumu.

Rose recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy more sheets, blankets and bowls for resale

loans.name: Dadau Candiru Jennifer Group

texts.en: Mrs. C. Jennifer is aged 25 years, married with 2 kids and 5 orphans as dependents, all going to school. She has been in her business for over 3 years. She is using the loan to purchase ground nuts, cassava flour, simsim (sesame seeds), charcoal, and tomatoes for selling to her community and at her marketplace. Her dream is to see her kids through school.

loans.use: To purchase ground nuts, cassava flour, simsim, charcoal, and tomatoes

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es: Mario Alberto G.
