A. vive en Soyapango departamento San Salvador junto a su esposa y dos hijos, A sus 59 años de edad Mario sigue en la lucha de día con día para sacar a su familia adelante como hasta el momento lo ha hecho, Mario fue empleado por años pero al no estar satisfechas sus necesidades económicas decidió poner un negocio propio, el cual lleva ya 9 años a flote es una tienda con varios productos como espejos, cuadros y otros adornos a esta tienda Mario y su familia la llamaron  “Tienda de variedades Ruben” . Ahora Mario solicita este crédito para surtir su negocio con productos alusivos al mes de las madres que están siendo muy demandados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mario Alberto G. A. lives in Soyapango in the department of San Salvador with his wife and two children. At 59 years-old, Mario continues fighting day by day to bring success to his family and will fight until the moment he has done so. Mario was employed for years but did not meet his economic needs and decided to start his own business. He has been in business for 9 years and has a store with various products such as mirrors, paintings, and other decorations. Mario and his family call this store, "Tienda de variedades Ruben". Now Mario is asking for this loan to expand his business with allusive products for the month of mothers which have been highly demanded by his clients.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Natama

texts.en:
Natama S. is currently in the business of selling fruits like mangoes and bananas. She is requesting a loan to buy a moto bike to transport her fruits to the market. Natama is 37 years old and is married; her husband is a teacher. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services. These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase a moto bike to tranport her fruits to the market

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui L. is a 35 year old married woman who is the mother of two daughters aged 10 and 15. Both her daughters are attending a local elementary school. Her family lives in Uvurhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces.

In 2005, she started running a retail business selling food products at the local market. She has been renting a stall and purchases a variety of food products such as bread, cookies and candies from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. Nergui goes to Ulaanbaatar once or twice in every month for her business since food product purchase is cheap and UB city is located 450 kilometres away from the Uvurhangay province.

Her husband Choidorj is a constructor. Choidorj helps his spouse by going to UB city to purchase food products sometimes, when he has time. Nergui's eldest daughter Maidarsuren, 15, also helps her mother's business. Nergui requests a loan to purchase more food products to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy food products for her business

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en:
Bridget sells foodstuffs and frozen food like chicken, fish and turkey. She travels to the Republic of Benin to purchase her goods twice a week by bus.

Bridget is 33 years old and married with two children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and frozen food like chicken, fish and turkey to sell. She thanks you, a Kiva lender.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen food and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is single and is 35 years old. She sells foodstuffs like yams, plantain, melon and garri (roasted cassava). She is requesting the loan of N40,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs  to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah M. is married and has two children. She has received no formal education. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Sarah sells bread and also rice, which she buys and then resells in smaller quantities at Elmina, which she has done since 2003. Sarah uses her income to support the payment of her children’s school fees. Sarah will use the loan to purchase more rice for sale and also for ingredients to bake more bread to sell.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Sarah plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell and more ingredients to bake bread to sell

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en: Annaliza, 26, is a vegetable and fruit vendor within the village of Andres Bonifacio Diffun Quirino. She would like to buy additional vegetables and fruits in order to generate a larger income for her family needs. Annaliza is requesting a loan  of PHP5,000 as additional business capital.  She believes that through that loan she will be able to achieve all of her business dreams.  Aside from managing the business, Annaliza plays the role of a good wife to Mengfei Q..

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Vedaste

texts.en:
Vedaste N. was born in 1973, married and he has 3 children aged between 6 and 2.
 
Vedaste has a saloon since 2002 in which he employs 7 people working from 7:00 A.M to 9h30’ P.M. Vedaste is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a for the purpose of expanding his saloon in its size and purchasing many equipments to use in his saloon. With that expansion, Vedaste hopes to employe  more than 7 people and get more profit than before.

By using this new loan, Vedaste hopes to change his life by saving for the future and getting more food for his family.

loans.use: purchasing more equipments

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian L. is from the village of Biasong. He is 24 years old. Ian is married and has 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Ian owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ian has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Ian joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ian has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. Ian is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Ian from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mutesayire

texts.en:
S. is 33 years of age with one child and a dependent she takes care of as well. She is married and her husband works as well, earning a decent wage.

S. has been a successful entrepreneur in the clothing and material business for over eight years and earns approximately 100,000 RWF / month (approx. USD 175) for her efforts. She employs two other people as helpers in her enterprise. They all work long hours.

S. has had one loan previously from Vision Finance Company and it is worth noting that it was paid in full and on time. She is a tireless business person with much experience in her field. She hopes to build her business so that it can provide a stable future for her small and growing family, as well as provide needed jobs in her community.

loans.use: To buy new materials for the upcoming season

loans.name: Nurlan

texts.en: Nurlan M. is a young entrepreneur of 19 years who is responsible for looking after his elderly parents.  Nurlan began working at 17, assisting his father with his father's shop.  Now Nurlan is responsible for the whole shop.  His working day starts at 8 a.m. and finishes at 10 p.m.  He sells cell phone accessories in the center of Lankaran, a city in the southern part of Azerbaijan.  Nurlan has requested a 1606 AZN loan so he can increase the number of items he sells and also purchase cell phones for resale, as they are in very high demand by the local population.

loans.use: To purchase additional cell phone accessories and cell phones for resale

loans.name: Minaya

texts.en:
Minaya S. is 51 years old and single. The difficult circumstances and hardships of her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. 

For about 20 years, Minaya has been purchasing young cattle in the local market, fattening them, and then selling them at local markets. Minaya is a very hardworking woman and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. Thanks to her business she is able to support her parents and help her nephews. 

For this purpose, she is requesting a loan of  1,606 AZN to buy small cattle in order to expand her business. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live.

loans.use: purchase four calves

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia.
Desde hace 20 años se dedica al bordado, actividad que aprendió de su madre. Este arte significa para ella, la mayor fuente de ingresos para su familia. Marleny borda en la comodidad de su casa, por lo que aprovecha para realizar las labores domésticas y estar pendiente de sus hijos. Paralelo a esto, se dedica a la agricultura para tener ingresos extras para su hogar. 

Esta es la tercera oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una miembro activa de su  grupo, el cual con el paso del tiempo que se ha ido consolidando con el fin de incentivar el progreso de todos, lo cual anima a Marleny a trabajar arduamente. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará para la compra de hilos y telas para sus bordados, así como para adquirir abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Marleny, 38, lives with her husband and three children in their own house. For the last 20 years she has done embroidery, a skill learned from her mother. This art represents her largest source of family income. Marleny embroiders in the comfort of her home which also allows her to do her domestic chores and care for her children. As a parallel activity, she also farms to earn extra income for her household. This is her third loan with MFP. She is an active member of her group which, as time has passed, has become stronger aiming to motivate all the members to progress which motivates Marleny to work even harder. The funds requested will be used to buy thread and fabric for her embroidery as well as for natural fertilizers for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy textiles.

loans.name: Kaday

texts.en:
Kaday J. is a business woman who trades in provisions accessories. She owns a shop located at Torkpoi Town. She is married to a pastor and has three children; the eldest is in high school, the second is in infant school, and the third is a baby. She is among our best clients, and she has a very good credit history who graduated to individual loan.

She needs a loan to purchase additional provisions. She intends to use the proceeds of the loan to take care of her children up to university.

loans.use: To Purchase Provisions

loans.name: Sope Serigne Babacar Sy No. 5 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sope Serigne Babacar Sy est une association de femmes commerçantes de petite échelle travaillant dans Thiès, une ville située à 70 Kms de Dakar. Ce groupe qui porte le nom d’un grand marabout Tidiane a été fondé en 2006 par des femmes entrepreneurs pour augmenter leur pouvoir d'achat par le biais  d’une tontine (système de financement tournant dans lequel chaque membre cotise périodiquement une somme convenue et qu’on verse à tour de rôle aux différents membres). 
Cependant après quelques années de beaux compagnonnages, elles décidèrent d’adhérer à l’IMCEC afin de s’octroyer du crédit sans des demandes de garanties. C’est ainsi sous l’encadrement de l’agent de crédit de la mutuelle que les membres sont divisés en  sous groupe de 5, avec une présidente désignée et une trésorière pour chaque sous groupe. Ces sous-groupes, au nombre de 14 en ce moment, peuvent être le même pendant de nombreuses années.
Le groupe Sope Serigne Babacar Sy  organise des réunions chaque le 20 du mois où tous les sous groupes sont conviés pour verser leur remboursement auprès de la présidente et cette dernière sous l’assistance de la trésorière assure le versement à la mutuelle.
La présidente est Madame Coumba Faye et la trésorière Madame Oumou N. toutes deux habitantes de Thiès. 

Cependant le sous groupe Sope Serigne Babacar Sy N°5 est à son deuxième prêt dans la mutuelle et il est dirigé par la trésorière Madame Oumou N. âgée de 48 ans. Cette dernière mariée et mère de 5 enfants s’active dans le commerce par passion depuis 15 ans. Elle place du piment, du karité, du Nétetou....etc à ses clientes vendeuses dans le marché grand Thiès. Avec ce crédit, elle compte compléter son approvisionnement auprès de ses fournisseurs à Bamako au Mali. Ses revenus lui permettent de gérer les charges quotidiennes au niveau de sa famille et de régler les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. 
Elle est dans ce sous groupe avec Madame Ndeye Ndella T. (la trésorière)  vendeuse de poissons, Madame Ndou Gou N. vendeuse de parfums, Madame  Ndioba G. vendeuse de boubous et tissus et Madame Anta M.   vendeuse de bijoux et thiouraye.
Dans le cadre de leurs activités, elles sollicitent un prêt de 500000 F CFA où chacune pourra recevoir 100 000 FCFA.
texts.en:
The Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group is an association of businesswomen who own small stores in Thiès, a city located 70 kilometers from Dakar. This group, named after a great Tijani marabout, was set up in 2006 by entrepreneurial women who where eager to increase their purchasing power through a tontine (a rotating savings and credit system where a group of individuals regularly contribute an agreed amount; the total amount is paid alternately to an individual member). However, after several years of successfully operating their tontine, the group members decided to join the microfinance institution UIMCEC which could grant them loans without security. Under the supervision of a loan officer of the village bank, the group was divided into subgroups of five members, each subgroup with a chairwoman and a treasurer. Right now there are 14 such subgroups. They may have the same members for many years. The Sope Serigne Babacar Sy Group meets every 20th of the month. The members of each subgroup pay their installment to their chairwoman who, with the assistance of the treasurer, is in charge of repaying the whole sum to the village bank. The chairwoman of the subgroup Sope Serigne Babacar Sy No. 5, which applies now for its second loan, is Mrs Oumou N. and the treasurer is Mrs Ndeye Ndella T., both residents of Thiès. Mrs N., aged 48, is married and the mother of five children. She has passionately run her store for 15 years. She sells chili pepper, shea butter and nététou (a popular condiment in West Africa) at the market in Thiès. She will use her loan to get fresh supplies from Bamako in Mali. Her earnings enable her to provide for her family's daily needs and pay the school fees for her children. The other members of her subgroup are Mrs Ndeye Ndella T. (the treasurer) who sells fish, Mrs Ndou Gou N. who sells perfume, Mrs Ndioba G. who sells bubus (African dresses for both women and men) and cloths, and Mrs Anta M. who sells jewelry and thiouraye (a traditional mixture of grains and fragrant wood that is burnt with coal or charcoal). To bolster their activities, they apply for a loan of 500,000 CFA francs, and each will receive a share of 100,000 CFA francs.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their working capital

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles O. O. is thirty years old, is married and has two children. His business is located in Kisumu town centre along Oginga Odinga Street where for two years he has been selling electronics such as DVDs, VCDs, amplifiers, video decks and radios.

Charles’ major challenge is harassment by the local government. He also does not have permanent premises from which to run his business but he hopes that in the future he will own a shop within the town centre and supply electronics in large quantities. He also hopes that he will get a permanent place to do his business therefore retaining his customers.

Charles is using his loan to add stock to expand his business. He is hardworking, polite and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy more DVDs, video decks, VCDs and amplifiers to sell

loans.name: Kuzratullo

texts.ru: Изатуллоев Кузратулло проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 57 лет. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Изатуллоев Кузатулло имеет высшее образование. Более 10 лет он занимается животноводством. Кузатулло в основном откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Kuzratullo I. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 57 years old, married and has 8 children. Kuzratullo has a higher education. He has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. Kuzratullo mainly raises and sells livestock. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma C. is a 34-year-old rice farmer. She is not married and does not have any children. For more than two years, she has been managing a farm. She would like to have a larger harvest so that she can save more money for the future.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of the amount of 10,000 PHP ($225) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan proceeds to buy farm supplies and to pay her laborers for all their hard work in the field.

loans.use: To improve her harvest by purchasing additional farm supplies

loans.name: Brima O.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers at a primary school in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1980 by the Inspectorate Office, Makeni. It was opened to give formal education to the children of Yalisanda village. Presently, this school is staffed with 10 teachers and has 319 pupils. 

This is the first loan these teachers are requesting from SMT/Kiva lenders.  School staff from this institution, like many other schools staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or to invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Brima O. T., who is pictured on the left, is the leader of this group. He has taught for 32 years now. The 60-year-old Brima was born in Gbanti Kammaranka village. He is married to a businesswoman and they have 6 children – 1 in secondary school and 5 in primary school. Brima is seeking for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 in order to buy house-building materials – cement, nails and corrugated zinc.

loans.use: Buy house-building materials – cement, nails, and corrugated zinc

loans.name: Lester Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Lester Manuel C. M. es trabajador de la Alcaldía de Chinandega se desempeña como vigilante y habita en el barrio  la Florida.

El señor Lester Manuel C. M. es casado y su esposa también trabaja para la Alcaldía es operaria de limpieza,  ambos han tenido crédito con Ceprodel y han demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y cumplida con sus pagos.
texts.en:
Lester Manuel C. M. works as a security guard for the city hall of Chinandega. He lives in the La Florida neighborhood. Lester Manuel C. M. is married and his wife also works for the city hall as a custodian. They have both taken loans with CEPRODEL before and have shown themselves to responsible people who are reliable with their payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: personal expenses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more general goods to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 40, is a rice farmer in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She needs farm supplies to operate in her rice field but she lacks capital so she sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. This loan will enable her to purchase the supplies needed for her farm. She is the mother of five children. Rice farming is the only way she can provide the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: farm supplies

loans.name: Elicia Maria

texts.es:
Elicia de 60 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo (es parte del suburbio, habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, su esposo es guardia ellos tienen tres hijos de 39, 36, 33 años. 

Ella empezó desde hace tres años atrás con una maquina de coser vieja haciendo bordados, y cosiendo ropa dañada de sus clientes, por el buen trabajo que estaba desempeñando tuvo mas clientela. Ahora se ha podido comprar una maquina industrial y sus hijas le ayudan desde las 08h00am hasta las 18h00pm. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar Telas, hilos, cierres para su negocio, en el futuro quiere confeccionar ropa para almacenes.
texts.en:
Elicia, 60, lives in an urban zone in El Guasmo (part of El Suburbio inhabited mostly by retailers), Guayaquil; her husband is a security guard and they have three children who are 39, 36, and 33 years of age. Three years ago she started with an old sewing machine to do embroidery and repairing clothing for her customers. Her good work led to more customers. Now, she has managed to buy an industrial sewing machine and her daughters help her from 8am until 6pm. She will use the funds to buy fabric, thread and zippers; in the future she’d like to manufacture for department stores.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For fabric, thread, zippers.

loans.name: Libra Group

texts.es:
Libra es un grupo que se ubica en la Colonia Toluca en Chalco, Estado de México. María se informo acerca del trabajo que hace Fundación Realidad, y conversando con sus vecinas decidieron formar el grupo para poder solicitar un crédito que las beneficiara con sus negocios. Las integrantes son amas de casa a quienes les gusta tener sus propias ganancias y ayudar con los gastos de su familia, conformado por: Yolanda Román (venta de ropa de niña y bisutería), María Elena Solís (venta de juguetes y bolsas de regalo), Diana Karina Rodríguez (venta de calzado por catalogo) y María de Jesús D. Solís (venta de cosméticos por catalogo).
 
María de Jesús es la representante del grupo, su familia la conforma su hijo que cursa el primer grado y Juan su esposo quien trabaja de chofer. Ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo desde hace dos años, gracias a la motivación que recibió por parte de su cuñada fue que se decidió emprender un negocio, actualmente ella se siente satisfecha con sus ventas, el cambio de catálogos lo hace cada dos meses y trata de aprovecharlos, la mayoría de su clientela son mujeres. Sus planes son ahorrar parte de sus ganancias para poder comprar un terreno y construir su casa. María planea utilizar el crédito para la inversión de sus productos,
 
Cada integrante con expectativas diferentes, pero con deseos de salir adelante, planean invertir su crédito en la compra de productos que les hagan falta como: bolsas de regalos, juguetes, catálogos, ropa, compra de zapatos, artículos de bisutería y agradecen el apoyo que reciben de Kiva.
texts.en:
Libra is a group located in Toluca in Chalco, Mexico. Maria learned about the work that Fundacion Realidad does, and after talking with her neighbours they decided to form a group in order to be able to request a loan that will benefit their businesses. The members are housewives who like to have their own income and help with family expenses: Yolanda R. (children's clothing and costume jewellery sales), María Elena Solís (toy and gift bag sales), Diana Karina Rodríguez (footwear sales through a catalogue) and María de Jesús D. Solís (cosmetics sales through a catalogue). María de Jesús is the group's representative; her family is made up of her child who is in first grade, and her husband Juan who is a driver. She has sold cosmetics through a catalogue for two years, when thanks in part to the motivation of her sister in law she decided to learn a business. Now she is satisfied with her sales, and catalogues are changed every two months. She tries to take advantage of this, most of her clients are women. She plans to save part of her earnings to buy a plot of land and build her home. Maria plans to use the loan to invest in her products. Each member has different hopes, but they each want to get ahead and plan to invest the loan in the purchase of products that they need, such as: gift bags, toys, catalogues, clothing, footwear, and costume jewellery. They are grateful for the help they receive from Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gift bags, costume jewellery, toys, footwear and cosmetics catalogues, children's clothing

loans.name: Marta Regina

texts.es:
La joven Marta Regina es casada con un hijo de 3 años de edad, su esposo es profesor de educación primaria pero en la actualidad no ejerce su carrera por falta de plaza en los centros escolares, por tal razón él se esta dedicando a la siembra, ya que aparte de su profesión se han dedicado a la agricultura.
 Marta Regina es nacida y criada en una comunidad llamada el ojochal Posoltega y es precisamente en esa misma comunidad donde ella labora para la Escuela San José desempeñándose como maestra de educación primaria desde hace 9 años.
Marta Regina ha sido financiada por nuestra institución desde el año 2006 obteniendo 4 créditos siendo los primeros 3 para mejoramiento de vivienda y este último que ha sido para siembra de Ajonjolí ya que ella y su esposo también se dedican a esta actividad.
texts.en:
Marta Regina is married and has a 3-year-old son. Her husband is an elementary school teacher but isn’t practicing his profession due to lack of teaching positions in schools. For this reason, he is farming because he’s been a farmer in addition to his profession. Marta Regina was born and raised in a community called El Ojochal Posoltega and it is precisely in this community that she has been employed as an elementary school teacher in the San José School for the past 9 years. Marta Regina has been financed by our institution since 2006; she has had 4 loans. She used the first three of them to make home improvements and this last one will be for sesame crops that she and her husband also are dedicated to.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For farming expenses (purchase ingredients and till the land)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 53 years old, married and has 6 school-aged children. Elizabeth owns and operates a clothing business, manufacturing and selling clothing products to local businesses and community members. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Elizabeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional equipment and supplies, such as needles and thread. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Elizabeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment and supplies, such as needles and thread

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 51-year-old man from Lebanon, married with 7 children. Ali has owned a grocery store for 10 years. This is Ali’s first time requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. He plans to use the loan to buy extra refreshments (cold soft drinks) for the summer season to increase his store’s goods and income. This helps to improve his family's income. Ali’s dream is to own a bigger grocery store in the future, which will provide a good income for his seven children, whom he hopes will work with him to improve the business.

loans.use: To buy extra refreshments (cold soft drinks) for the summer season

loans.name: 02.02.13 Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
"Doan N. T. (50) is a 47 year-old woman living in the town of T. Hoa - Thanh Hoa.  Doan is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 13  T. hoa (02.02.13 T. hoa).

Doan is married and has 3 adult aged children.  To making a living, Doan operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattle for sale.  Doan has been engaged in this business for over 19 years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2003, Doan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Doan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.248.000 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.000.000 VND which will be used to purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future.  The loan will be the 6th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Doan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  T. T. Mai (49) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  N. T. Luan (35) is a 56 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  T. T. Linh (17) is a 24 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  N. T. Len (51) is a 49 year-old female who is requesting a 6.000.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase young livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: L. exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des articles de friperie. elle a une ancienneté de 8 ans dans ce commerce c'est pourquoi elle maîtrise tout le contour de ce commerce. elle s'approvisionne au marché  Local de hedzranawoé où ce commerce est très développé.son stock de marchandises est en baisse, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 5 balles de friperie. avec ce nouveau stock, elle pourra bien vendre et satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. L. has a revenue-generating business in second-hand clothing.  She has eight years of seniority in this business.  This is why she has a command of all its aspects. She gets her supplies at the local market in Hedzranawoé, where this commerce is highly developed.  Ms. L. is low on merchandise.  She is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 5 bales of used clothing.  With this new stock, she will be able to do well in her sales and to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul C. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. He is 19 years old and is married with one infant child. Paul owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Paul joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. Paul plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Rene es cliente antiguo, se encuentra en su decima secuencia, se dedica al lavado y venta de arena en el rio Mallasilla, en cuyo rio tiene un lugar delimitado de trabajo, especialmente en épocas de lluvia donde se extrae mayor cantidad de arena, él vive en Mallasilla con su esposa e hijo menor, quien se dedica  a la venta de carne de pollo en un puesto que adquirió en el mercado nuevo de Mallasilla, también tienen otros hijos mayores con hogar propio. Al margen de esta actividad don Rene viaja por temporadas a la localidad de Patacamaya a comprar ovejas en las comunidades cercanas y las vende en las ferias locales, es una persona dedicada a sus actividades y responsable, el dinero del crédito lo invertirá en la compra de Ovejas para criarlas y después venderlas. Esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rene is a previous borrower and this is his 10th loan cycle. He works washing and selling sand at the Mallasilla River, which has a defined work area, especially in the rainy season when more sand is extracted. Rene lives in Mallasilla with his wife and youngest son, who works selling chicken meat at a stand he obtained in the new market of Mallasilla. He also has older children who have their own homes. Aside from this business, Rene also travels seasonally to Patacamaya to buy sheep in the neighboring communities and then sells them at the local markets. He is a person who is responsible and dedicated to his work.

He will invest the loan in the purchase of sheep to raise and then sell. He is very appreciative of the institution for the support provided.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sheep

loans.name: Bulamu Bwoka Developement Group-Mukono

texts.en: Thirty-three year old Jalia N. is happily married, has six children, and is a member of the Bulamu Bwoka loan group. She knows that it is not possible to rest on your laurels in business, and this realization has allowed her to found and run for the last three years a flourishing grocery store. She plans to use her portion of this group loan to buy more food to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy more food items to sell at her grocery

loans.name: Shima Ii Group

texts.fr:
Oda K. est une femme commerçante âgée de 53 ans qui habite au Quartier Buyenzi en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle fait le commerce de produits d’habillement (habits et chaussures) au Marche Central de Bujumbura, un métier qu’elle exerce depuis 30ans. Au cours de ses années d’exercice de son metier, elle a ajoute les produits vivriers dans ses produits de commerce. Elle a fréquenté l’école jusqu’en 10e année de l’école secondaire. Elle est veuve. Elle arrivait au 6e cycle dans le crédit Communautaire avec Turame mais elle intègre maintenant le crédit solidaire. 

Elle est mère de 8enfants dont 4 ont déjà eu leur Diplôme et les 4 qui sont à l’école secondaire.
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  accroitre son capital  en achetant de grandes quantités de produits d’habillement et vivriers à revendre aux clients et ainsi pouvoir accroitre ses économies. Elle a préféré demander le crédit à Turame car elle a beaucoup de facilités à rembourser. 
 
Elle  est une des membres du groupe  solidaire« Shima II».
texts.en:
Oda K. is a 53-year-old shopkeeper who lives in the Buyenzi district of the Bujumbura mayorship. She sells clothing items (clothes and shoes) at the Bujumbura central market, a line of business she has been working in for 30 years. Over the years, she added food products to her product offer. She attended school until the tenth year of the secondary level. She is a widow. She is on her sixth cycle of group loans with Turame, but now also incorporates an individual loan. 

She is the mother of 8 children, of which 4 have already graduated and 4 attend secondary school.

She is requesting a Kiva loan to increase her capital by purchasing large quantities of clothing items and food products to sell to clients and thereby increase her savings. She preferred to ask for the loan from Turame because it will be easy for her to repay. 

She is one of the members of the « Shima II» solidarity group.

loans.use: To increase her capital by purchasing large quantities of clothing items and food products to sell to clients

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es:
DOÑA GLORIA APARECE EN LA FOTO Y ES LA MUJER QUE VISTE UNA SUDADERA ROSA Y UN SOMBRERO DE COLOR ROSA,  LAS DEMAS MUJERES SON LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO "MUJERES EXITOSAS" Y ESTAN PRESENTES EN LA CASA DE DOÑA GLORIA. 

DOÑA GLORIA ES UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA Y MUY ACTIVA,  EL GRUPO AL QUE PERTENECE DOÑA GLORIA SE HACE LLAMAR: 
“MUJERES EXITOSAS" , TODAS LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO DECIDIERON LLAMARCE ASI  POR QUE QUIEREN SER EXITOSAS EN TODO LO QUE HAGAN, DOÑA GLORIA ES LA LIDER DE ESTE GRUPO Y VIVE ES SAN JUAN TUXTEPEC BARRIO 1 QUE PERTENECE AL MUNICIPIO DE CHAPA DE MOTA  ESTADO DE MÉXICO.
DOÑA GLORIA TIENE 30 AÑOS Y ESTA CASADA ES MADRE DE 3 HIJOS Y SON VARONES:
-EL PRIMERO SE LLAMA SERGIO DE JESUS Y TIENE 12 AÑOS DE EDAD
-EL SEGUNDO SE LLAMA LUIS ANGEL TIENE 10 AÑOS
-EL TERCER HIJO  SE LLA JOSE JULIAN Y TIENE 7 AÑOS

EL ESPOSO DE DOÑA GLORIA SE LLAMA JUAN DE JESUS TIENE 36 AÑOS Y ES AYUDANTE DE ALBAÑIL,  SU ESPOSO  EN OCACIONES POR CUESTIONES DE SU  TRABAJO SALE A  LA CIUDAD DE MÉXICO POR 1 Ó 2 MESES   SIN VER A SU FAMILIA, DOÑA GLORIA ES AMA DE CASA PERO TIENE UNA ACTIVIDAD EXTRA QUE ES EL BORDADO Y VENDE SUS SERVILLETAS A LA GENTE DE SU COMUIDAD, LOS DIAS DE PLAZA PONE UN PUESTO MOSTRANDO SUS BORDADOS, LAS IMAGENES QUE BORDA PUEDEN  SER  ANIMALES COMO VENADOS, GARZAS Y OTROS, COMO TAMBIEN TODO TIPO DE FLORES.

LAS SERVILLETAS QUE BORDA DOÑA GLORIA SON DE MUCHA LABOR Y HAY QUE ESTAR HORAS Y HORAS SENTADOS PARA BORDAR, A DOÑA  GLORIA  POR LO REGULAR PARA UNA SERVILLETA CHICA TARDA 2 DIAS EN HACERLA Y PARA UN BORDADO GRANDE 2 SEMANAS COMO COBERTORES Y COLCHAS. 

LO DIFICIL  EN OCASIONES ES  BUESCAR QUIEN LO COMPRE, EN ESTOS LUGARES LA GENTE NO PAGA MUCHO POR ALGO QUE CUESTA DEMASIADO TRABAJO, DOÑA GLORIA BUSCA PERSONAS DE AFUERA DE OTROS ESTADOS O PAISES QUE  SÍ  ADMIREN SU TRABAJO Y PAGEN BIEN, ESTO ES LO DIFICIL PARA DOÑA GLORIA.

DOÑA GLORIA SE DEDICA AL BORDADO DESDE NIÑA, ES HERENCIA DE SU FAMILIA ENTRE LAS MUJERES COMO LO FUE SU MAMÁ Y ABUELA, TIENE AÑOS DE EXPERIENCIA EN ESTE OFICIO, EL BORDADO ES UN OFICIO QUE PUEDE LLEGAR A SER BIEN PAGADO Y UN NEGOCIO DE EXITO, HACE FALTA LA AYUDA PARA PODER LLEVAR BORDADOS COM0 LOS DE DOÑA GLORIA A UN LUGAR DE EXPOSICIONES EN DONDE GENTE DE AFURA LOS PUEDA VER Y PUEDA PAGAR MUY BIEN POR ESTOS BORDADOS. 

LA COMUNIDAD DE DOÑA GLORIA ES UNA COMUINIDAD DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y LA MAYORIA DE SU GENTE VIVE HUMILDEMENTE Y SE DEDICAN A CRIAR ANIMALES COMO BORREGOS Y VACAS Y AL  CULTIVO DE MAIZ, POCAS MUJERES YA EN LA ACTUALIDAD SABEN BORDAR Y SE DEDICAN A VENDERLO.

LOS INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO DE DOÑA GLORIA SON LOS SIGUIENTES:

CARLOTA P. F. DE 63 AÑOS DE EDAD

BEATRIZ ADRIANA G. M. DE 34 AÑOS

ANA KAREN P. V. DE 19 AÑOS

ARACELI FELIPA R. T. DE 26 AÑOS

CLAUDIA RAQUEL A. B.  DE 34 AÑOS

SARA F. ASUNSION DE 45 AÑOS

GLORIA A. B. DE 30 AÑOS

LILIANA SÁNCHEZ HERNÁNDEZ DE 22 AÑOS

LILIA R. DESIDERO DE 30 AÑOS

ESTE ES EL GRUPO DE MUJERES EXITOSAS QUE TIENE DOÑA GLORIA, Y ES UN GRUPO DE MUJERES MUY UNIDAS QUE SE AYUDAN ENTRE SI PARA NO TENER PROBLEMAS Y SI LOS HAY PARA SACARLOS ADELANTE. TAMBIEN SE LLEVAN MUY BIEN Y TIENEN MUCHOS AÑOS DE CONOCERSE.
texts.en:
Ms. Gloria is the woman wearing a pink sweater and a pink hat in this picture. The other women are also members of the group "Mujeres Exitosas" which translates to "Successful Women". They are pictured at Gloria's house. 

Gloria is a hardworking and active woman. The members of the group chose the name "Successful Women" for their group because they want to be successful at everything that they do. Gloria is the leader of the group. She lives in San Juan Tuxtepec in neighborhood 1 which belongs to the municipality Chapa de Mota in the state of Mexico. 

Gloria is 30 years old, is married and is the mother of 3 boys. Her first son is named Sergio de Jesus and is 12 years old. The second is named Luis Angel and is 10 years old and the third is named Jose Julian and is seven years old.  Gloria's husband is named Juan de Jesus. He is 36 years old and is an assistant mason. Her husband sometimes has to work in Mexico City for one to two months at a time without seeing his family. 

Gloria is a homemaker but also works in embroidery and sells her napkins to people in the community. On market days she has a stall where she shows her embroidery. The images she embroiders range from animals such as deer, geese and others to all types of flowers. The napkins Gloria embroiders are labor intensive. She has to sit for hours to embroider. Generally, it takes Gloria two days to embroider a small napkin and it takes two weeks for large items such as covers and blankets. It is difficult on occasions to find someone to purchase her embroidery. In her area people do not pay much for something that is so labor intensive. Gloria looks for people from other states or countries that admire her work and pay well. 

Gloria has dedicated herself to embroidery since she was a child. It was passed down in her family from women like her mother and grandmother. She has years of experience in this field.  Embroidery is something that can eventually pay well and be a successful business. She needs help to take her embroidery to places where people from other places can see her embroidery and pay well for it. 

Gloria's community has few resources and the majority of people live humbly and raise animals such as sheep and cattle or grow corn. Currently, few women know how to embroider and sell embroidery. 

The following women are the members of Gloria's group: Carlota P. F. who is 63 years old; Beatriz Adriana G. M. who is 34 years old; Ana Karen Perez V. who is 19 years old; Araceli Felilpa R. T. who is 26 years old; Claudia Raquel A. B. who is 34 years old; Sara F. Asunsion who is 45 years old; Gloria A. B. who is 30 years old; Liliana S. H. who is 22 yearls old and Lilia R. Desidero who is 30 years old. 

This is Gloria's group of successful women and it is a group of women that is united and that help each other. They get along well and have known each other for many years.

loans.use: Purchase thread in various colors and napkins to embroider.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro trabaja en la Policía Nacional de Bolivia; la esposa es artesana y confecciona mantas para las señoras de pollera. Tienen su casa propia y sus dos hijos de 3 y 12 años que dependen de la pareja. Viven en la zona Tahauantinsuyo de la ciudad de El Alto.
El crédito que solicita será utilizado para pagar el costo de refacción de su vivienda para tener una mayor comodidad.

Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y  vía Kiva.
texts.en: Pedro works for the National Police of Bolivia. His wife is an artisan who makes shawls for the Cholitas, or women who wear traditional pollera skirts. They have their own house and two sons, aged 3 and 12 years old, who depend on their parents. They live in the Tahauantinsuyo area of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to pay the cost of repairing their house and making it more comfortable. This is the first loan from IMPRO and from Kiva.

loans.use: To repair his house in order to make it more comfortable

loans.name: Rossie Gaudencia

texts.en:
Rossie is a twenty-five year old married lady with three children aged five, four, and two years old. All the children go to school and she has been able to pay the school fees from the profits she makes. She has been in the business of selling vegetables at the centre for three years now.

With this first loan she plans to buy vegetables and small fish commonly known as omena to sell to her customers. Her future plan is to own a shop at the centre to boost her income so that she can educate all her children in good schools.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of vegetables and small fish locally known as omena.

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana is a single mom raising a 5-year-old son. Oksana is a small entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. She sells sportswear, e.g. t-shirts, sweatsuits and athletic footwear in the central marketplace of her home town. She launched her enterprise 17 years ago. Currently, her monthly income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas.  

Oksana is requesting a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to purchase an assortment of winter sportswear to meet her clients’ demands. She is hoping to buy 50 pairs of sweats and 20 sports jackets,  thus diversifying her merchandise. Oksana admits she was forced to try her luck in business and launched her startup when she failed to find a job as a vet. One of her long-term plans is to open her own sportswear and footwear store some day. This business is her only source of income.

loans.use: To purchase winter sportswear for resale

loans.name: Heart Ggulwe Development Group-Mityana

texts.en:
M. Matia is a 37-year-old fisherman who resides in Ggulwe-Bagwe-Mityana. M. is a happily married father of two who has been a fisherman for the past ten years. He lives near the lakeside which helps keep his business expenses low. M. sells most of his fish to traders from Mityana town. He belongs to the Heart Ggulwe Development Group and also has side businesses selling cattle and poultry.

M. is diligent and he also has his own nets. However, his fishing nets are experiencing wear and tear that has been getting worse over the past year. M. is requesting a loan to purchase new nets. This will streamline his work as well as allowing him to expand his operation and sales.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two young children. He has been working in the domain of plumbing for 36 years, depending on customers' requests, offering them plumbing products and services. He is the only income source for his family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional tools and equipment so he can increase his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and equipments

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch Y. has spent much of her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from a grandparent when she was young. She was married, but she has been divorced from her husband for years. Touch Y. lives with her three children, and one of her daughters is employed as a sewing worker at the garment factory, and has a formal salary every month. She contributes her profit with Touch Y. in order to support the whole family. 

Touch Y. would like to plant watermelon on her farmland, but she doesn’t have enough capital to do it Y.. As a result, Touch Y. is requesting a loan to hire a plowing machine to plow her farmland and to buy a few sacks of fertilizers and seeds for planting.

loans.use: To hire a plowing machine and buy fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Kausachun, escasada, tiene 30 años y tres hijos de 9, 7, 1 año de edad.
Elena se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos en la comunidad de Compañía y los vende en su misma Comunidad. 
El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de ladrillos como: tierra, arcilla y leña.
Elena ingresó a Finca Perú por la invitación de su cuñada, le gusta porque le dan préstamos y puede ahorrar. Con sus ahorros pudo comprar algunos muebles para la comodidad de sus hijitos.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y poder dar una educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Kausachun communal bank.  She’s married, 30 years old and has three children whose ages are 9, 7 and 1.

Elena makes bricks in the community of Compañía that she sells in the same community.

She will use the requested loan to buy materials used to make bricks: dirt, clay and firewood.

Elena joined Finca Perú invited by a sister-in-law.  She likes it because they give her loans and she can save.  With her savings she was able to buy furniture for the comfort of her children.

Her dream is that the business grows and to be able to help provide an education for her children.

loans.use: To buy dirt, clay and firewood to make bricks.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia tiene 64 años D. edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes ella venD. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche también venD. otro tipo D. productos como gaseosas, fideos, golosinas y mas, la socia lleva años en este negocio y se siente feliz ya que mediante este negocio ella saca a su familia adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. mas productos para su tienda D. abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the community bank "Juntas y Unidas" [Together and United], located in the Cusco district in the province and department of Cusco.

Gregoria is 64 years old, married, and has four children.  She owns a grocery store.  She sells necessities like rice, sugar, and milk.  She also sells other types of products like drinks, pasta, candies, and more.  She has had this store for many years, and she feels happy that it has helped her family succeed.  

She is asking for this loan to purchase more products for her grocery store.

She is happy with the loan provided and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase more products for her grocery store

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia O. sells hair products, body creams and slippers at Abura, near Frami. Leticia has received senior high education. She is divorced and currently taking care of 3 children.  She has been in this trade for 8 years. Her income that is generated from her sales is used to take care of her family. A loan is going to help her buy more body creams and slippers for resale. She anticipates reinvesting her profit for further growth of her business. In the photograph, Leticia has her left hand placed on the slippers and the right hand placed on the hair products and body creams.

loans.use: A loan is going to help her buy more body creams and slippers for resale.

loans.name: Emprendedores Del Valle Triunfo Group

texts.es: Gumersinda  P. D. 40 años D. edad pertenece al grupo comunal Emprendedoras Del Valle Triunfo, un grupo conformado por 7 integrantes las cuales son todas mujeres con gran empeño por salir adelante y surgir hacia una economía más estable para ellas y sus familias, tal es así el caso D. la señora Gumersinda P. D. 40 años D. edad conviviente y madre D. 6 hijos D. los cuales 3 aun son menores D. edad, ella se dedica a la venta D. Remedios Naturales hace mas D. 16 años, y comienza en este trabajo por consejo D. una amiga. Con el esfuerzo D. sus trabajo a podido comprar muebles para la casa y darles una educación a sus hijos. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en incrementar el negocio en compras D. más productos naturales. En el futuro le gustaría poder ampliar su negocio para así generar mayores ingresos económicos para ella y el bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en:
Gumercinda P., 40, belongs to the Emprededoras Del Valle ("Entrepreneurs of the Valley") communal bank. This group is maD. up of seven members - all women - who share a strong commitment to getting ahead and striving towards a more stable economic situation for themselves and their families.

Such is the case with Ms. Gumercinda P.. She is 40 years old, in a common-law marriage, and the mother of six children, three of whom are still minors. She has been selling natural remedies for over 16 years and got started in this work based on a friend's advice. Thanks to her efforts at work, she has been able to buy furniture for her house and to proviD. her children with an education. She will use this loan to invest in growing her business by purchasing more natural products to sell. In the future, she would like to be able to expand her business in order to generate more income towards her and her family's wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es: El señor Braulio dedicado al servicio de transporte durante  varios años atrás gracias al sacrificio que realizo durante ese tiempo pudo comprarse su propio vehículo con el cual actualmente se encuentra trabajando y sosteniendo a su familia  con los ingresos que genera. El crédito que solicita el cliente es para comprar repuestos para su movilidad ya que presento algunos desperfectos. Pero una vez subsanados los daños de su vehículo se pondrá a trabajar nuevamente desde muy temprano hasta altas horas de la noche para así reunir dinero para comprarse otro vehículo y así poder tener mas ingresos, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Braulio has been providing a transport service for several years.  Thanks to his hard work, he was able to buy his own vehicle which he currently uses for his work.  He supports his family with the income that he makes.

Braulio is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle since it is experiencing some problems.  Once the problems with his vehicle have been repaired he will start working again from very early in the morning until very late at night in order to make money to buy another vehicle so that he can make more income.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Maria Leonilda

texts.es:
María, resiD. en San Francisco Gotera departamento D. Morazán, se dedica a la crianza D. cerdos y la venta D. especias, ella tiene 35 años D. edad, vive con su esposo y tienen ocho hijos D. las edades D. 17, 14, 11, 10, 7, 5, 3 y 1 año respectivamente, María se dedica desD. hace cinco años al negocio D. las especias, tiene un puesto en una calle muy transitada D. la ciudad, el horario D. venta es D. 7:00am a 1:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. especias y hiervas como: manzanilla, pimienta, canela entre otros, este préstamo le ayudara a incrementar el negocio y así mejorar la atención a los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones es ver a sus hijos crecer y poder tener una fuente D. ingreso que le permita darle una vida digna a sus hijos, ya que son muchos y debe esforzarse más para alcanzar a cubrir las necesidades primordiales.
texts.en:
María lives in San Francisco Gotera, in Morazán department.  Her business is raising pigs and selling spices.  She is 35 years old and lives with her husband.  They have eight children aged 17, 14, 11, 10, 7, 5, 3 and 1.  María has been selling spices for five years.  She has a sales location in a very busy street in the city.  She makes her sales from 7.00am to 1.00pm.

María is currently requesting a loan to buy spices and herbs including camomile, pepper and cinnamon.  This loan will help her to increase her business and thereby improve her customer service.

María's wish is to see her children grow up and to be able to have a source of income that allows her to proviD. her children with a decent life as there are a lot of them and she must work harder in order to cover their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy spices and herbs such as camomile, pepper, cinnamon, etc.

loans.name: Aku Justine

texts.fr: Epouse d’un inspecteur de douane, Justine est mère de deux enfants. Revendeuse de pagnes depuis 2008, elle fait ses provisions sur place et à Accra au GHANA. Elle est distributrice et vend à domicile. elle est âgée de 41 ans. Ce second crédit rentrera dans les besoins de son activité.
texts.en:
Justine is married to a customs inspector and is the mother of two children. She has been selling "pagnes" (colorful African cloth) since 2008 and obtains her supplies locally and in Accra, Ghana. She is a distributer and sells from her home. 

This second loan will be used for things she needs for her business.

loans.use: to buy "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Nehemiah

texts.en:
Nehemiah is 33 years old.  He is married and has 4 children between 2 and 9 years old. Three of his children are currently attending school.  

Nehemiah is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for 5 years. He employs one farmhand and sells his eggs, maize, beans and bananas to the local market. He also earns income from his motorcycle transport business.
 
Nehemiah has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo after he recently repaid his third loan of 70,000 Kes. He has requested a new loan of 70,000 Kes in order to buy additional stock of poultry and construct a poultry house. He says that this loan will help him expand his poultry farm, which will mean increased production of eggs and income. 

Nehemiah's biggest challenge in his business has been diseases, which causes massive poultry death.   He plans to expand his farming activities in the future and be able to dominate the local market with his supply of eggs.

loans.use: buy poultry and construct a poultry house

loans.name: Beatriz Adelina

texts.es:
Beatriz Adelina tiene 40 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama NUEVO HORIZONTE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Cachely Grande, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol gandul.

Beatriz se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,ademas a la crianza y engorde de pollos, las compras las realiza en Comercial "Hnos. Olivos" cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y abonos ademas de alimentacion para los pollos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es aumentar la produccion y construir un galpon.

Le gusta limpiar la casa y que este ordenada.
texts.en:
Beatriz Adelina is 40 years old and married. She lives with her husband and children in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

This Communal Bank is called “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) and located in the neighborhood of Recinto Cachely Grande, which is in the canton of Ventanas. The members of this Communal Bank are short-cycle farmers who grow corn, rice, and pigeon peas.

Beatriz is a farmer who specializes in growing corn. In addition, she raises chickens for fattening. She buys her supplies at the Olivos Brothers Shopping Center each month and then sells her goods at the fair in the same location.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, compost, as well as feed for her chickens. With the financial assistance provided through this loan, she will be able to acquire needed supplies. One of the challenges she faces is crop disease. Her dreams include increasing production and building a chicken coop.

Beatriz enjoys cleaning house and keeping it in order.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, and poultry feed.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is a married woman with 6 children. Her youngest child is 20 years old. Zenaida’s husband works as a farmer.

Zenaida is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She primarily grows rice to sell. According to Zenaida, she earns about 10000 PHP per month from farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase rice seeds, fertilizers and pay for labor.  In the future, Zenaida hopes to manage a bigger farm and earn a bigger profit for her family.

loans.use: purchase rice seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
Toufic, 21, is a single man who has been working in the mobile phone sector for five years. He started working early because he had to contribute to his family's income to cover part of their expenses, which he still does.

Toufic is requesting his third loan from Al Majmoua to use as capital for mobile phones and accessories for the summer season, since many tourists visit his region and he has to be ready for their needs. He has a good reputation and provides the best customer service, starting with the peaceful smile he draws on his customers faces from the moment they enter his shop.

Toufic is a good-standing borrower. He hopes to expand his business and open a new branch in the future.

loans.use: to capitalize his mobile phone business.

loans.name: Karla Ivon

texts.es: Karla tiene 30 años, su negocio es la venta de plata. Hace más de 3 años que tiene esta actividad, es una mujer muy responsable que disfruta de su medio de vida. A pesar de ser una actividad muy complicada ha logrado sobrellevar los contratiempos que ha tenido la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le solicitan variedad en prendas. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de anillos, aretes, cadenas, pulseras, gargantillas entre otros.
texts.en: Karla is 30. Her business is selling silver. She has been doing this for over three years. She is a very responsible woman  who benefits from this lifestyle. Despite this being a very complicated business, she has been able to endure all of the setbacks that she has experienced. The majority of her customers are always requesting a variety of items. The loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of rings, earrings, chains, bracelets, and chokers, among other items.

loans.use: to purchase rings, earrings, chains, bracelets, and chokers, among other items.

loans.name: Benkadi 4 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI 4 est constitué de dix femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans, 5 enfants et qui vivent majoritairement dans des familles polygame à Konfon, un des villages de la commune rurale de Banco, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce prêt, SITANI, la deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assises, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour et de sarclage pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du marché de Klè, de Banco et de N’Golobougou, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of Benkadi 4 Group ("harmony") are married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Konfon, one of the villages in the rural municipality of Banco, prefecture of Dioïla, region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of Mali). They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to deal more efficiently with their activities when the winter season begins. They grow, among other products, rice and groundnuts. This is their first loan with the institution.

Sitani, the second woman sitting at the right-hand side of the photo, intends to use her loan to buy agricultural supplies and tools and pay for plowing and weeding. She has around 0.5 hectares of farmland to grow rice and groundnuts. The harvested products will be sold at the markets in Klè, Banco and N'Golobougou to a clientele made up of men and women. The group members expect to make an average profit of around 40,000 CFA francs per season.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and weeding, and to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide and tools.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old and married with 2 children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marcelina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Marcelina has been raising pigs for 4 years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Delcker De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora Delker de Jesús,  es de un lugar donde la gente es muy unida ya que cuando hay alguna fiesta todos se organizan  para celébralo. Ella es casada con e l señor salvador  y con quien procreo  un hijo  que aun esta a su responsabilidad.

    Ella solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de  ropas para damas, caballeros, niño y niñas,  para luego  venderlo en las comunidades cercanas del pueblo, en donde lleva practicando dos años y ocho meses y comenta que le va bien ya que le ha dado un buen resultado.

   Lo que lo motivo  ha esta actividad fue su familia  para aportar también con los  ingresos d el casa y así mejorar su calidad de vida y sí está viendo un bien resultado.

   Lo que más desea es que con esta actividad  pueda ahorrara para   agrandar mas  su negocio que es lo que lo motiva  a seguir trabajando como también apoyar a su  hijo en su educación.
texts.en:
Delker de Jesus is from a place where the people are very united, because when there is a festival everyone helps to organize the celebration.  She is married to Salvador, and they have a dependent child.

Delker requests a loan to purchase clothing for women, men, boys and girls.  She will later sell this clothing in the communities close to her town.  She has been doing this work for 2 years and 8 months, and she comments that it is going well and is giving her good results.

She was motivated to start this business so that she could help out her family by contributing more income to the household.  This way she can improve their quality of life, and in fact, she is seeing this happen. 

What she most desires is that with this activity, she will be able to save to expand her business. This is what motivates her to keep on working so that she can support her child's education.

loans.use: to buy clothing to later sell

loans.name: C 2180 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Eric is 26 years old and he is single. He owns a business boutique, selling sugar, rice, milk, Irish potatoes and bananas.

Eric is the leader of this group, which is called "TUZAMURANE" in the local language. He is the second person on the right side. Eric has been in this business for about two years and his business is open from 6 am until 11 pm every day.

Eric and his team have requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to increase their inventory of goods to sell. Eric and his team will reinvest any profits into their businesses and save for their families' futures.

loans.use: to increase their business by buying more goods to sell.

loans.name: Zabib

texts.en: Zabib is a married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling charcoal in Hai Gwafa branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. Zabib requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to order more charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Josephina Tiwanac Group

texts.en:
Josephina is married and has five children. Josephina is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Josephina is a farmer and grows corn and rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase three sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

Josephina has been a member of PMPC for a month. 

Josephina is the leader of a five person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: To purchase 3 sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Annabelle has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and meats, such as chicken and pork adobo, a marinade dish, and caldereta, a stew. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy the raw ingredients needed to cook meats.

Annabelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for cooking meats.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 36-years-old, married and has four children.

Ghassan has been the owner of a food market since 2009. He sells soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products and household items. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he has a sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $1500 loan in order to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent and to add more foodstuffs.

loans.name: Raul Alejo

texts.es: El Señor Raul es una persona casada, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos, vive actualmente en el municipio de Colcapirhua,en la provincia de Quillacollo del departamento de Cochabamba, trabaja como albañil en las construcciones de casas y edificios, lamenteblemente hace un mes le robaron la mezcladora de cemento en el deposito de su trabajo. Estuvo por varias semanas trabajando sin mezcladora y haciendo este trabajo manualmente, pero gracias a unos afiches de publicidad que recibió de CIDRE, nuestra institución, pudo pedir un prestamo que es financiado por KIVA, con lo cual pudo comprar una nueva mezcladora para poder reanudar los trabajos pendientes que tenia. Hoy el Señor Raul agradece a los financiadores KIVA por el apoyo de estos microcreditos que otorgan en Bolivia en la cuidad de Cochabamba.
texts.en:
Raul is a married man. He lives with his wife and two children in the town of Colcapirhua, province of Quillacollo in the department of Cochabamba. He is a construction worker who builds houses and buildings. Unfortunately, one month ago his concrete mixer was stolen from the warehouse at his workplace. For several weeks he worked without a mixer and had to do his work with his bare hands. 

Raul received some marketing materials from CIDRE. Hence, he was able to request a KIVA-funded loan and bought a new mixer to catch up with his pending jobs. Today, Raul thanks KIVA loaners for the support they provide though micro-loans in Cochabamba, Bolivia.

loans.use: to purchase a concrete mixer for his work.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal “Candelaria” del distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior completo.

Vilma trabaja desde hace cinco años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

En la actualidad solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 nuevo soles, con este dinero comprará mercaderías como arroz, azúcar, harina, y gaseosas de todo tamaños.  La señora vende sus productos en las ferias de la zona.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener su casa propia, su carro y tener una empresa.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los cursos de capacitación, reflexión y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Vilma is member of the communal bank “Candelaria” which is in the district and province of Yunguyo, in the Puno department. She is 30 years old, single, and has one son. She has completed high school. 

Vilma has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 5 years. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, and she invested the money into her grocery business. She is now asking for a new loan of S/. 1,800.00 nuevo soles. She will buy merchandise line rice, sugar, flour, and sodas of all flavors with this money. She sells her goods in the local markets. Her dream for the future is to have her own home, a car, and a workshop. 

What she likes the most about her communal bank is the courses on finance, responsibility, and the themes for reflection.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, flour, soda, etc.

loans.name: Sabirakhan

texts.ru:
Сабирахан 53  года, вдова, имеет троих детей. Сабирахан работает библиотекарем в районной центральной библиотеке в с. Базаркоргон и известна  как ответственный и порядочный человек. После распада Союза, из-за маленькой заработной платы, Сабирахан не хватало средств, чтобы прокормить семью. По этой причине, она решила заняться животноводством и  перепродажей сельхозпродукции.  Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, в данный момент в хозяйстве Сабирахан имеется 2  коровы,  и хороший сарай для содержания скота. Также  Сабирахан возделывает поливную землю мерою в 0,50 га, где выращивает хлопчатник, помидоры и другие овощи, которые затем продает.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса в перепродаже сельхозпродукции , Сабирахан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом на увеличение оборотных средств и расширение ассортимента овощей за счет закупа у других фермеров. В будущем за счет полученных доходов Сабирахан планирует построить еще один сарай, в котором будет хранить сельхозпродукцию.
texts.en: Sabirakhan is 53 years old, widowed and has three children. Sabirakhan works as a librarian in the main regional library in Bazarkorgon village and is known as a responsible and civilized person. After the Soviet Union fell apart and prices rose dramatically, Sabirakhan's salary was no longer enough to support her family. To make ends meet she began raising livestock and growing produce. Due to her diligent work and perseverance her household now has two cows and a big warm barn for all her animals. Sabirakhan also has a 1.2 acre plot of irrigated land where she grows cotton, tomatoes and other produce for sale. To further grow her farming business Sabirakhan has turned to "Bai Tushum and partners" for a loan of 130,000 som which she will use to purchase produce from other farmers for resale at her market stand. In the future Sabirakhan is planning to use the profits from the loan to build a second barn where she will store her produce over the winter.

loans.use: to broaden the assortment of goods

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 53 years old and has five children. To earn a living, she sells clothes. She has been in this business for twenty years and has employed one person. She also does poultry farming for more income generation.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya her business has grown, thanks to Faulu Kenya's financial support.

Jane has requested 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Fausto Lenin

texts.es:
Fausto Lenin tiene 18 años es soltero, vive con los padres no tiene hijos.  Vive en el Recinto América  en el Cantón Ventanas.

La ventanilla UNIDOS VENCEREMOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto América, perteneciente al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Fausto  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz desde hace 3 años. Compra y vende los productos en Ventanas.

El crédito solicito para la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y  arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es  tener un terreno y un vehículo para transportar sus productos.
