Le gusta mucho ver televisión y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Fausto Lenin is 18 years old. He is single, and he lives with his parents. He does not have any children. He lives in Recinto America in the Canton of Ventanas.

The group UNIDOS VENCEREMOS ("Together we will Overcome") is located in Recinto America, in the Canton of Ventanas. The group works in the agricultural sector, specifically in the short-cycle harvest of corn and rice.

Fausto has been working growing corn for 3 years. He buys and sells his products in Ventanas.

He is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to sow his corn and rice. The loan will help him to increase his income to help his family and also to reinvest. His dream is to have property and a vehicle to transport his products.

Fausto likes to watch television and play sports.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for corn and rice crops.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 35-year-old man married to Naema, a 27-year-old lady. They have been blessed with three children: Melani, age 8, who is studying in the third grade of elementary school; Maichel, age 5, who is attending kindergarten and Pricilia, age 4. 

To cover their daily needs, Simon works as a fishmonger. He sells fish from one house to another. He used to work as a public minivan driver for 10 years but he then resigned from the job and decided to be a fishmonger three years ago. Simon usually wakes up at 4 am to buy fresh fish from the fisherman and then resells them to his customers.

Simon realizes that he cannot survive with his current business because sometimes in rainy season he has difficulties getting fish from the market. Therefore, Simon is thinking of trying another business: raising pigs and reselling them to the pork traders. Simon is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 4,500,000. He wants to spend the loan on two pigs to be fattened. He hopes that his loan application will be approved by TLM soon.

loans.use: to purchase two pigs

loans.name: Kotognontala I Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  membres du groupe KOTOGNONTALA I sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans et ont en moyenne 6 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fofanabougou, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAMOU,  deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,75 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 110.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The eight members of the group KOTOGNONTALA I are married women who average 46 years of age and six children each. They live mostly in polygamous families in Fofanabougou, a village in the region of Koulikoro. This is their 7th collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. They grow millet and groundnuts.

Mamou, standing second from the right, will use this new loan to purchase inputs and small farming tools, and to pay for the cost of plowing 0.75 hectare of millet and groundnuts. After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the city of Fana to a clientele composed of men and women.

Mamou expects to earn an average profit of 110,000 CFAF per season. This will allow her to repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and small farming tools, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Hector Cayo

texts.es:
Héctor es un hombre de 23 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Huaraz con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Héctor no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Héctor trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de frutas, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, él realiza sus ventas en diversos mercados y en algunas ocasiones en las ferias dominicales de su ciudad, Héctor cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Héctor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea construir la parte trasera de la casa de sus padres, de esta manera podrá brindarles mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Héctor seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran comerciante mayorista de frutas.
texts.en:
Héctor is 23 years old, single, and lives in the city of Huaraz with his parents and siblings. He is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who has a grand desire to overcome. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources and that he had to work since a young age, Héctor has not been able to study toward a professional career, but he would really like to. In his free moments, he likes to play soccer with his friends. 

By his own initiative, and with much effort and dedication, Héctor works in his small business selling fruit. He works every day for approximately 10 hours. He makes his sales in different markets and on some occasions at the Sunday fairs in his city. Héctor believes that it is going well for him due to the good prices and the kind manners that he has with customers. 

Héctor is very grateful toward the Kiva lenders: thanks to the help given, he will be able to improve his home, and he wishes to construct the rear part of his parents' house. In this way, he will be able to give them better security and well-being. Héctor will continue working and putting forth the effort in order to achieve his big dream of being a great salesman of wholesale fruits.

loans.use: to improve his home.

loans.name: Essie

texts.fr:
Essie, 44 ans, est mariée et mère de deux enfants, et habite dans le quartier d’Adidomé à Lomé. Elle  vendait du maïs et du charbon, mais a dû abandonner cette activité n’ayant pas assez de fonds. Elle  s’approvisionnait à crédit et à des prix peu avantageux. La rentabilité de son activité devenait de plus en plus faible, et ne lui permettait pas de faire face aux frais de scolarité de ses enfants. 
Depuis 2008, elle commercialise du pain. Elle s’approvisionne à crédit auprès d’un boulanger de la place. Mais cette activité ne lui permet que de survivre au jour le jour. Ce crédit lui permettra de reprendre son activité de vente de maïs et charbon afin de pouvoir financer l’éducation de ses enfants et épargner pour faire face aux imprévus.
texts.en:
Essie, age 44, is married and the mother of two children.  She lives in the Adidomé neighborhood of Lomé.  She used to sell maize and charcoal, but had to give up this activity, for lack of funds.  She was stocking up on credit and at prices which were far from attractive.  Her activity was becoming less and less profitable and did not allow her to pay for her children's school fees.

Since 2008, Essie has been selling bread.  She buys bread on credit from a local baker.  However, this activity merely allows her to survive, on a day-to-day basis.

The loan that she is taking will allow her to resume selling maize and charcoal in order to pay for her children's school fees.  It will also help her to save some money to be prepared for unexpected events.

loans.use: to buy one bag of maize and 45 yam tubers.

loans.name: Colleta

texts.en:
Meet an amazing, honest and charming woman by the name of Colleta. She is a small-holder farmer based in Ndalu village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Colleta has been practicing livestock farming for seven years. She has raised two cows on the farm. 

Colleta is seeking a loan to restock her cereals business. She plans to purchase and transport cereals in bulk to far markets where she will sell at prices high enough to cover all the expenses incurred while gaining a profit. Colleta is confident that she will be able to repay the loan in time because she is hard working and financially disciplined. Returns from the investment will change her life as she will use the additional income to raise her family's living standards.
Colleta just needs a little help that she can get from you; a loan that may change her life.
Support her with a loan so that she can keep her big smile!

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Muungano - Beach Group

texts.en:
Hermina, who is in late 30's is married with one schooling child. She had been into poultry firm raise and sell chicken for 3 years now. She works from 6 am to 11 pm daily and she's able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to add of the number of chicks she had and build chicken shades. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group which is now doing great. 

She used her profit to take care of her family, to repay loan, reinvest in business and pay school fees. She will use this loan To buy chicks and chicken feeds. She dreams of opening a butcher and build her own house outside town.

Hermina, will share this loan with her loan group ” Muungano” which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Beatrice would like to buy cereal, laundry detergent, soft drinks, fuel, and beverages for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Felicina would like to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima H. is 46 years old and she is married with three children. Her small business consists of a women’s clothing store in the Sabirabad central bazaar. She would like $1000 USD from Aqroinvest CU to improve her business and make it larger.

loans.use: Mrs. Huseynova would like to improve her business by enlarging her women's clothing store.

loans.name: Mehman

texts.en: Mehman A. is a 35-year-old married businessman. He runs his small shop in the southern Azerbaijan town of Imishli, where he was born and has lived for his entire life. He has 6 years of experience in his business. He opened his store in 2001 when he first borrowed $1,200 from Aqroinvest CU. He sells laundry detergent, shampoo, toothpaste and other items. These products are in high demand, and Mehman tries to be very polite with clients to gain return customers and attract new ones. Mehman is going to enlarge his store and begin to sell additional food products, for which he needs $1,200.

loans.use: To increase his product selection

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Sarorn has been married since 1987 and has 5 children: 4 sons and a daughter. She learned to weave from her mother in 1980, and started her silk production business that same year. Her husband is a construction contractor - he has been in the house-construction business since 1987. With their combined income, Mrs. K. and her husband can afford to send all of their children to school.  

Mrs. K. has borrowed money from MAXIMA already twice, and is now asking for a loan of US$200. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Remigia

texts.en:
Remigia Tilleria is a 38 year old single mother with one three year old child. She lives with her mother their humble community of Rincón Guazú, Paraguay.

In 2003 she opened a small convenience store with the help of her brother. He later moved to Argentina in search of a better job. He continues to work there but sends money to Remigia so that she will be able to buy merchandise and continue to grow her micro-enterprise. Today she already has a loyal client base which she established by paying close attention to what products she offers. For the care she gives her store she as seen as a unique establishment in the area.

Remigia is optimistic and wishes to convert her store into a mini-market. In this way she hopes to achieve a higher standard of living for her daughter and mother, whom she is already supporting

With the money she has borrowed Remigia will buy sugar, flour, and rice to continue to offer the best products possible.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, flour and rice

loans.name: Fela María

texts.en:
Fela is a very young entrepreneur who struggles to make a living and take care of her two children. She runs a beauty salon whichshe started just a few months ago. Her husband, also very young, works for a watch-making company.

Fela aims to offer more services in her salon so that she can attract new clients. She has requested a loan to buy an automatic hairdryer to replace a damaged one. She also plans to purchase other goods such as rinse, shampoo, face lotion and other beauty products. Given this loan, she will be in a condition to attract new customer to her salon, and will also be able to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new automatic hairdryer and other products for a beauty salon.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
In the Estación market of León, the sale of groceries is a very common business, there being various merchants that are dedicated to this business. Among them we find the lady Maria del Rosario C. who, in seeking a way to survive and to maintain their home, has been working in this business for 14 years.

Her three children and granddaughter depend on this business since it is the only income that provides for the nuclear family. Among the products that Mrs Maria offers are basic grains, ropes, sardines, instant coffee, brooms, etc. To improve the condition of her business, the lady Maria has completed loans with Ceprodel that have benefited her business greatly, increasing her sales due to the acquisition of more products. She has also managed to pay the expenses of her home and give a better appearance to her business. Her credit record includes 9 loans.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

En el mercado la Estación en León, la venta de abarrotes es un negocio muy común habiendo varios comerciantes que se dedican a este negocio. Entre ellos encontramos a la señora Maria del Rosario C. quien buscando la manera de sobrevivir y mantener su hogar se dedica a este negocio desde hace 14 años.

Sus tres hijos y una nieta dependen de este negocio ya que es el único ingreso que percibe el núcleo familiar. Entre los productos que doña Maria oferta se encuentran granos básicos, mecates, sardinas, café instantáneo, escobas, etc. Para mejorar la condición de su negocio, la señora Maria ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel que le han beneficiado grandemente ya que ha incrementado sus ventas debido a la adquisición de mas productos, también ha logrado pagar los gastos de su hogar y darle una mejor apariencia a su negocio. Su record crediticio es de 9 créditos.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale in her grocery, such as basic grains, ropes, sardines, instant coffee, brooms, etc.

loans.name: Magamaga Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Halima W.. She is currently in the business of chicken rearing and is requesting a loan to buy chicken feed. Halima is 36 years old and is divorced. She has 3 children ranging from age 12 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Halima makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and re-invest in the business. Halima has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Halima is joined in her small group by Alexa T. and Walube C.. Alexa T. has a business selling coffee and wants to add to the business. Walube C. is currently operating a business in chicken rearing and wants a loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed.

loans.use: To add to poultry business

loans.name: Munnaza's Group

texts.en:
I am Munnaza A., and I am the loan group leader. I live with my family in a four room brick house in the small town of Chichawatni in Pakistan. I have two girls and one boy, and they are studying in grades five, three and two. My husband lives abroad and his brother lives with me. I am borrowing for my brother-in-law who runs a milk shop.

There are a few other women who are also in need of loans. These women are: Ramzan Z., whose husband sells fruits and vegetables on commission; Nazira G., who wants to buy a dairy cow; Sughran Z., who will invest her share of the loan in her family’s furniture business; and Nazira A. D., who needs to buy a donkey cart. I want to help these women so that they can fight against poverty and secure good futures for their families.

loans.use: Expand milk sales

loans.name: Zainabu's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Zainabu is 41 years old and is married with two children, ages 21 and 17. Zainabu owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2000. She works there from 6am to 7pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $225.

In the past, Zainabu has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more items such as wigs, weaving and hair treatment for her salon. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, Fatuma and Rehema, who have restaurant and bar businesses.

loans.use: To buy more items such as wigs, weaving and hair treatment for her salon.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica D. sells farm chemicals including pesticides and fertilizers. She is married and has four children. Monica would like to use her loan to purchase additional inventory of her goods to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of farm chemicals for resale

loans.name: Nhean

texts.en:
Mr. Nhean S. is a subsistence farmer in Ping Pong Village in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. In addition to farming, he has a business collecting recyclable material. Her wife, Mrs. Phat Ny, is a grocer in the local market. Mrs Ny wants to expand her business, so Mr. Nhean S. has decided to as for a loan to buy more groceries for his wife's business.

Mr. Nhean S. is 30 years old and the father of a child who is too young to work or attend school. Previously, Mr. Nhean S. obtained a loan from AMK to start his wife's business. His wife appears on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for his wife's business.

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Saroeurn C. and his wife, Mrs. Im Thaong, are farmers in Snam Pok Village in Kampong Speu Province. Mr. Saroeurn C. now faces an obstacle because he does not have enough cows to plow his rice field. Thus, Mr. Saroeurn C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to plow the field.

Previously, Mr. Saroeurn C. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy an old cow and he has paid back this loan. Mr. Saroeurn C. is 57-years-old and the father of five children, four of whom are employed in different business activities. The remaining one is enrolled in school. Mr. Saroeurn C. and his wife are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow the field.

loans.name: Davlatmoh

texts.ru: Тоджиддинова Давлатмо проживает  в городе Нурек. Занимается бизнесом. Торгует тканями на центральном рынке. К осеннему сезону , к приходу холодов хочет получить кредит и уже завезти зимние ткани. Привозит она товар из города Душанбе . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 18 лет , с того момента как муж оставил их семью  и она осталась одна с шестью детьми на руках. Теперь она старается дать детям все по мере возможности. Старший сын должен поступать в ВУЗ , поэтому ей необходимо очень много работать. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Davlatmoh T. lives in Nurek. She runs a small business selling fabrics in the central market. She would like to get a loan to buy winter fabrics to prepare for the coming colder fall and winter seasons. Davlatmoh buys the fabrics in Dushanbe. She has been in this business for 18 years, after her husband left her alone with six children to support. Since then she has tried to give her children everything within her means. Her oldest son is about to start university and so she is working as hard as she can. She plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fall and winter fabrics

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is 34 years old, married, and has four children, 2 to 15 years old. She has been working as a clothes seller since 2006. Every day, Riziki works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. at her store and can earn a monthly profit of about US$70 from the sales.

Riziki now needs a loan to buy additional clothes for sale in order to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase of additional clothes for sale

loans.name: Zully Ruby

texts.es:
La señora Zully pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad”, ubicado en la Av. Nuevo Bolognesi Mz. F  Lt. 6, del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49  años y es madre de 3 hijos, solo 2 viven con ella y son independientes, es casada, su esposo es carpintero. Zully con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en un pequeño taller de costura.

En la actualidad ella cuenta con un negocio en casa “Taller de Costura” usualmente ella se levanta muy temprano para atender a su familia y luego dedicarse a la confección de sus prendas. 
  
Con este préstamo de S/. 1.200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses comprará: 12 metros de tela de Algodón, 15 kilos de tela Dacron, blondas, cierre y otros para implementar su negocio.
 
Zully día a día agradece a todas las personas que le apoyan, en especial  al Banco de Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Zully belongs to the Banco Comunal, "La Amistad," Av. Nuevo Bolognesi Mz. F Lt. 6, Callería district, Ucayali department. She is 49 and the mother of three, two of whom are adults still living with her and her husband, a carpenter. With her first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos, Zully decided to invest in a little garment shop. Now she works from her home-based garment business, getting up very early to take care of her family and then work on sewing her clothing. With this 1,200 sol loan, which she will pay back in five months, she will buy 12 metres of cotton cloth, 15 kilos of Dacron, lace, closures and other things to start up her business. Zully is grateful every day to everyone who supports her, especially the Manuela Ramos bank.

Translated from Spanish by ian harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wholesale materials

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is 49 years old and married with 7 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.  Florence sells bed sheets and shoes for children and adults.  She sells in an open area on the Ring road in Benin City.  She needs the loan amount of N102,000 to purchase more bed sheets and shoes to sell and also to rent a store.  She is grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To rent a store and purchase bed sheets and shoes for merchandise.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Mrs. Pov C. is a 48-year-old who lives in Trapaing Thnaut village in Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to request a loan to buy more pigs and pig food for her breeding business. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Kak Pan, is a construction worker. Mrs. Pov C. has three children, one of whom stays at home to do housework while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and pig food for her breeding business.

loans.name: Mrs. Arn Cheng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank (loan group), which consists of nine people, is located in Phum Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs. Arn C. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who cultivates both rice and vegetables. In vegetable farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy bean seeds to grow on the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy them. Mrs. Arn C. is a 59-year-old widow with two children who both help her on the plantation. Mrs. Bung Y. did not come to take her loan, but her husband did, so he takes her place in the photo.

All the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK (Kiva's Field Partner) has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bean seeds to grow on the field.

loans.name: Run

texts.en: Mrs. Run T. is a villager in Thmey Tom Lab village, Kampong Speu province, Cambodia. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Sam Yath, sells firewood. Even though they work hard, they do not earn enough income to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Run T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase their income and thereby improve their living conditions. She has five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Agé de 29 ans, Monsieur B. Koffi est marié et a 4 personnes à charge. Grâce à l’activité de conduite de taxi moto qu’il a entrepris depuis plus de 10 ans, il parvient à répondre aux besoins essentiels de ses enfants. Mais aujourd’hui face à l’augmentation sans cesse croissante des charges du ménage, il se trouve obligé d’accroître son revenu afin de continuer d’assurer les conditions de vie meilleures à ses enfants. Pour ce faire, il décide de s’acheter une nouvelle taxi moto et de confier l’ancienne à une autre personne. N’ayant pas de fonds propres pour réaliser son projet, il sollicite un crédit pour arriver à ses fins.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi B., age 29, is married and support four people. Thanks to his work driving a motorbike taxi that he undertook ten years ago, he has been able to respond to the essential needs of his children. But today, faced with the ever-growing rise in household expenses, he finds himself compelled to increase his income to continue to ensure the best living conditions for his children. To do so, he decided to buy a new moto taxi and to entrust the old one to someone else. Lacking the working capital to realize his project, he is requesting a loan to reach his goals.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es:
Concepción trabaja en la sub-alcaldía de Mecapaca y los fines de semana se dedica a la elaboración de planillas para partidos de fútbol de salón; es soltera e independiente ya que es la única que genera ingresos para poder solventar sus gastos de estudios, alimentación y otros gastos 
Vive en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de inversión ( instalación de una tienda para juegos en la red de Internet)..
Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Conception M. works at the mayor's office of Mecapaca and on the weekends she makes money keeping score sheets for indoor soccer games. She is single and she supports herself. She is the only one that makes money to pay her education, food and other expenses. She lives in Tembladerani in the city of La Paz, at her parent’s house. The loan will be used to invest in a new business, a store for people to play games on the Internet. This is the third time that she has received a loan and her record qualifies her as a trustworthy borrower.

(Translated by Edith of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The cost to install a a store for people to play games on the Internet

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Madame Amy D. a son propre entreprise ou elle vend de céréales locales depuis 5 ans.  Elle fait son activité à Diourbel, une petite ville rurale à 150 kilomètres de Dakar, la capitale du Sénégal.  Avec ce premier crédit, elle va acheter des céréales pour vendre et elle va utiliser les revenus pour aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille et de soutenir leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy D. has her own little business where she has been selling local cereals for 5 years. She works in Diourbel, a little rural town 150 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. With this first loan, she is going to buy cereals to re-sell and she plans to use the income to help her husband support the family and cover the expenses of their children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local cereals

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia M. is a 26-year-old mother of four children, aged 15, 14, 2 and 1 month. She is married to a driver and lives and works in the Nymasaria slum. She sells vegetables including tomatoes and onions to pay for her children's school fees. 

Sophia recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW, she will receive training from K-MET and begin visiting members of her community who suffer from various illnesses. 

Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

Sophia is taking a loan to buy more food stock for her kiosk, vegetables, tomatoes, onions -- purchased from Kibuye Market.

loans.use: To support her fruit and vegetable business.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en:
Mr. Luke C. owns a drug shop which has developed into a clinic. He will use this loan to purchase clinic equipment like an examination couch, hospital supplies, microscope, ultrasound machine and drugs (since he now has rights from the National Drug Authority). He is very proud of bringing clinical services nearer to his community. His dream is to have a 24 hour clinic, since his wife is a registered midwife, and also to have a decent house, car and good health.

Mr. C. is 38-years old and married with two kids in primary school: a girl, age 10, and a boy, age 9 years. He also cares for eight dependants. He is so hardworking, active and hopeful!

loans.use: To purchase clinic equipment and drugs

loans.name: Hatun Tarpuy Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Hatún Tarpuy son D. la comunidad D. Yaruca, distrito D. Vinchos, Provincia D. Huamanga, Departamento D. Ayacucho, la comunidad se ubica a 1 hora y 45 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería.
Adela es casada, tiene 6 hijos el mayor D. 16 años y el menor D. 1 año, Adela compra y venD. verduras en su comunidad y también en ferias, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos, con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar cerdos para engordarlos y también verduras, Adela esta ahorrando para comprar las cosas que necesita y sueña con mejorar su negocio, educar a sus hijos.
Celestina es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, Celestina comenzó con su negocio desD. muy joven, compra quesos D. su comunidad que luego comercializa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, también teje chompas a pedido, con el préstamo que obtendrá tiene proyectado comprar quesos y lana. Celestina sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
Paulina es casada y tiene 6 hijos, Paulina se dedica a la compra y venta D. animales menores en su misma comunidad, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus esposo e hijos, Paulina sueña con ahorrar lo suficiente para asegurar el futuro D. su familia y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank Hatún Tarpuy are from the community Yaruca, in the district of Vinchos, in the province of Huamanga, in the department of Ayachucho. The community is located one hour and 45 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock. Adela is married. She has 6 children, the eldest of whom is 16 and the youngest of whom is 1. Adela buys and sells vegetables in her community and also in markets. For this she has the help of her husband and children. With this loan she would begin a project buying pigs in order to fatten them, and also vegetables. Adela is saving to buy the things that she needs and she dreams of improving her business, educating her children. Celestina is a single mother, and she has 3 children. Celestina began with her business when she was very young, buying cheeses from her community which she later sells in the city of Ayacucho. Also she takes orders for jackets. She would use her loan for her project of buying cheese and wool. Celestina dreams that her children might become professionals, and to improve her business. Paulina is married and she has 6 children. Paulina works buying and selling small animals in her own community. She manages this work with the help of her husband and children. Paulina dreams of saving enough to assure the future of her family and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small animals, vegetables, grains, cheese, and wool.

loans.name: Agamahammad

texts.en:
Agamahammad M. is 48 years old, and a dedicated father who is responsible for his wife and three children.

Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Agamahammad has become a very successful businessman. He has a friendly family who always try to help each other. Thus his wife helps him with his business.

He works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle: cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now Agamahammad wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. With this goal in mind, Agamahammad is requesting a loan of 1200 USD that will serve as business capital. The profits he will make from this business will allow him to improve the living conditions of his household and also make some investments.

Agamahammad thanks all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase three baby calves

loans.name: Hodji

texts.ru: Ходжи женщина 48 лет. Замужем и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Ходжи откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Ходжи продает их на скотном рынке. Ходжи кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она успешно закончила два предыдущих займов, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Ходжи планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Ходжи очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Hodji is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. Together with her husband, she is involved in livestock feeding and sales. Hodji feeds the livestock at home, and once it is ready, Hodji’s husband sells the livestock at the livestock market. Hodji has been a client at our organization for 1 year. She successfully repaid two of her previous loans and now wants to obtain another one. Hodji plans to increase the quantity of her livestock and, subsequently, increase profit for her family. Hodji likes our financing terms, and she is happy that there are such organizations that support the public.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Hồ Thị

texts.en:
H. Hồ Thị (620041031) is a 53-year-old woman living in the town of Hưng Nguyên.  She is married and has five adult children.  To make a living, H. owns & operates a business providing furniture rental services to local community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 3000000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2004, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 10000000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business.  The loan will be the fifth loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Shu

texts.en: Married with two kids below the age of fifteen is G.. He is in his late thirties and he lives in Ntasen, Bamenda, Cameroon. G. was motivated to become a GHAPE member in 2003 when GHAPE extended its activities to his neighborhood in Ntasen. He saw this as an opportunity to make something out of his life. Since then he has taken and repaid four successive loans, each one higher than the previous. He even was and is able to cater for his family like in paying bills and planning for the future from the savings he made from his loan activities. G. has been through some difficulties in the thick and thin of life. He was and is still up to the task. He has resolved a lot of challenges in life such as the death of his mother and brother in 1982 and 2007 respectively. G. plans to invest his fourth loan in a bamboo business. More specifically he will buy bamboo in bulk and then retail it. He has a longstanding experience in this business. G. lives a few meters from the major market in the area. The profit from his business activities will be used for the education and welfare of his family members. His community stands to benefit from his activities in that they will not have to go as far or wait until market day to get what they want. He will also sell at a reasonable price because he prefers a quick turnover over a longer period of time rather than a higher profit margin. G. loves GHAPE because of the low interest rate and the social interactions among members. About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profit and loss, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia P. is a 53-year-old single mother living with her three children, the eldest of whom is in college. They live in Pangarap (Dream) Village, Caloocan City. Life was hard for Virginia when her husband passed away a few years back but she didn’t lose hope. She worked hard to sustain their basic daily needs so she decided to go into business. Nine years ago, she put up her small general store with a handful of items to sell until it grew to what it is now. Her daily sales are P500. Virginia joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2006 and has been active in inviting other women in her community to her group. She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative. Now on her 12th loan, she has applied for a new loan of P12,000 which she will use to expand her store's inventory. She dreams of having a larger grocery store someday. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Guadalupe Rogelia

texts.es:
Guadalupe es profesora y trabaja en un colegio de la Ciudad de El Alto de La Paz y es su única fuente de ingresos que tiene.
Vive en la zona de San Isidro Alto de la ciudad de La Paz en la casa de su suegra.
El crédito será destinado para el tratamiento medico ya que el seguro no le cubre para poder hacer el análisis de su vista.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro
texts.en:
Guadalupe is a teacher at a school in the city of El Alto de La Paz, and this is her only source of income. She lives in her mother-in-law’s home in the neighborhood of San Isidro Alto in the city of La Paz. The loan will be used for medical treatment, since she needs to take a vision test and her insurance does not cover it. This is the second time that Guadalupe has requested a loan from Kiva partner Impro.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical treatment

loans.name: Mediatrice

texts.en:
Mediatrice M. is 43 years old, is married, and she has six children aged between 24 and 14.

Mediatrice has owned a small shop since 2006 and she employs one person. She opens her shop from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. It is after realizing that her shop is too small to earn enough profit that Mediatrice is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her shop through purchasing more goods.

Through accessing this loan, Mediatrice hopes to earn enough profit and, with that profit, she will be able to help her husband buy a house and get more food for the family.

loans.use: To expand her shop by purchasing more merchandise

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 7 años y 5 meses en su casa propia. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de artículos variados para el hogar, los cuales lleva en camión a los pueblos de la zona rural, que es donde nació.  María adquiere su mercadería al por mayor y de esa manera la puede vender a precios al alcance de sus clientes, su esposo es quien viaja con mayor frecuencia, generalmente los días jueves de cada semana, y regresa los fines de semana para adquirir más mercadería de acuerdo a la situación y demanda. Es por ello que hace poco empezó a vender colchones, pues María está siempre alerta ante cualquier cambio que mejore su negocio.
Esta es la tercera oportunidad  en que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona muy responsable en sus pagos y muy participativa en todas las actividades programadas por su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la comprara más mercadería, en esta oportunidad en artefactos eléctricos pequeños, como planchas, licuadoras y radios.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Tejedoras2 Group

texts.es: El grupo de las tejedoras2 viendo sus necesidades acudieron a la asociaciòn ASDIR para ayudarles a incrementar sus capital ya que ellas tienen siete años a tras de estar realizando este tipo de compra y venta de ropa tipica  ya que ellas tambien las bordan a mano y se han unido para competir  ya que la competencia es fuerte y necesitan incrementar sus capitales y asi surtir màs sus mercaderia y ser competitivas y tener màs ventas para sostener sus hijos y de ellas misma ya que en el lugar que se encuentra es muy precario(pobre) y ellas tiene ese concepto ya que trabajando duro y teniendo ayuda ellas tendran mejor nivel de vida y de sus hijos para que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y superar.
texts.en:
Looking at their needs, the Tejedoras 2 Group came to the ASDIR Association to get help increasing their capital. They have seven years experience in this type of buying and selling of typical clothing. They also embroider by hand, and they have united to compete. The competition is strong, and they need to increase their capital to stock more merchandise and be more competitive. They need to have more sales to support their children and themselves. The place where they live is very poor. They believe that by working hard and with help they can have a better quality of life and that their children will be able to keep studying and be successful.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Dulce Esperanza” esta representado por la señora Evelin y conformada por 12 miembros residentes del barrio San Jerónimo por lo que se conocen y confían en cada uno D. ellos. Una mayoría D. los socios se dedican a la elaboración y venta D. pan, venta D. lácteos, servicio D. albañilería, venta D. comida rápida, abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio y al servicio D. cocina. Sus negocios se encuentran en diferentes lugares como alguno D. los puestos D. venta son ambulantes, por lo que no tienen mucha competencia en sus rubros caso contrario mueven su negocio a otro lugar mucho mas rentable. Los socios indican que invertirán en incrementar su capital D. trabajo con la coma D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas que coadyuven a generar un mejor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias. Las socias que se mantienen en el banco en este segundo ciclo  han demostrado responsabilidad y puntualidad en el pago D. sus cuotas. Según el reporte D. la  central D. riesgos  se pueD. ver que tienen buenos antecedentes crediticios en otras instituciones financieras también por lo que la fundación Agrocapital les brinda un nuevo apoyo económico para que los socios sigan trabajando juntos para salir adelante y poderle brinda una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Esperanza” (Sweet Hope) group consists of 12 members who all live in the San Jerónimo neighborhood and know and trust each other very much. They are represented by Evelin. Most of the members are involved in the making and selling of bread, the sale of dairy products, masonry services, fast food sales, grocery sales in neighborhood stores, and meal preparation. They are located in various sites. For example, some of the food sales take place from moving food stands which allows them to change location if competition is too strong in one place. The members state that they will use the financing to buy merchandise, raw materials and tools which will help them earn better profits with which to support their families. The members who remain in the bank for this second lending cycle have shown responsibility and punctuality in their repayments. According to the report from the credit bureau they have good credit histories in other financial institutions such that fundación Agrocapital offers them new financial support so that the members will continue to work together to get ahead and thus proviD. their families with better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Peaulele

texts.en:
Peaulele E. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Auala 2. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Peaulele owns and operates a bakery. The main source of income for the business comes from baking and selling cookies in the local community. Peaulele has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 200 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Peaulele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Peaulele is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase baking equipment. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Peaulele plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baking equipment

loans.name: Eak

texts.en: Eak P., 40, is married with two school-aged children. She resides in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, with her husband and children. To make a living, she is engaged in a business selling various kinds of groceries, earning an income of approximately US$4 per day. Her husband is a police officer in the city, earning an income of US$3 per day. Both sources of income from P. and her husband help cover the family expenses, especially the children’s education. P. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase more groceries to stock her store and to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en: Jeffrey G. is from the village of Barangay Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 24 years old, is married, and has one infant child. Jeffrey owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Jeffrey joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be his first from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
Nine people, who are all living in Preaek Khmaer village in Kandal province, make up this village bank loan. They will each use the loan for a different purpose.

Mr. Leang K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a village vice-chief. Aside from this job, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which he grows rice and other crops to support his living.

Mr. Leang K. now faces some problems because his rice field has infertile soil. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and to use the rest of the loan to buy pesticides and rice seed to increase his rice yield in the current year.

Mr. Leang K.’s wife, Mrs. Ros Soem, helps him with the farming. This couple has three children, two of whom are laborers in a garment factory while the other is attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and rice seed for his farm

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is a 26 years old married lady who has a son and a daughter. Her son is 3 years old and goes to school.  She sells clothes, shoes, handbags and bedding in her shop. She has been running the business for two years and has two employees. She also gets extra income from poultry keeping.  Faulu Kenya has helped her manage the loan she borrows more professionally through business foundation trainings.  She requested for Kes.80,000 so as to add to her stock of clothes.  Vivian hopes to own a world class business in the country and own many exhibitions in the future.  Vivian describes herself as hardworking, committed and visionary.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. W. is 33 years old, single, and has two children aged 7 and 14. She is a very hardworking, humble and down-to-earth lady. Jane has a salon from which she provides hair and beauty services to local women. Her business is located at Gatundu, in a very busy market in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for pineapple production. 
Jane says that her business is profitable and the only major challenge is that there are many other salons in the areas so her customers are spoilt for choice. However, she works very hard to make sure her business remains successful. Jane is using her loan of 45,000 KES to buy more hair weaves and chemicals to expand her business. In the future, Jane hopes to open her own hair and beauty college. She also hopes to achieve a customer base of 1,000 people.

loans.use: To purchase hair weaves and chemicals

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita L. is from barangay Poblacion, Panaon Municipality, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 64 years old. Florita is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Florita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting vegetables like squash for sale. Florita has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Florita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used as additional business capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Florita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Assa

texts.fr: Assa Diène Est une femme de 52 ans elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de THieckène depuis 5ans et y a reçu 10 prêts qu'elle a toujours bien gérés et remboursés à temps. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne et de contribuer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Assa Diène is a 52-year-old woman and the mother of six children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de Thieckène for five years and has received ten loans there that she always handled well and repaid on time.  Her goal is to boost her level of savings and to take part in improving her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Developing her income-generating work

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Elsa María Hernández Z.  ella se desempeña como vendedora de ropa usada y nueva tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad  once  años,  ella es casada actualmente. Ha tenido  tres créditos con CEPRODEL y este crédito él lo está solicitando para la compra de una paca de ropa usada y ropa nueva  y para ampliar y mejorar su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa Maria H. Z. is married and makes a living by selling new and used clothing, an activity which she has done for eleven years. She has had three loans with CEPRODEL, and this one will be used for the purchase of a package of used clothing and one of new clothing in order to expand and improve her business and her family life.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a package of used and new clothing

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Luren.
Luzmila es viuda, tiene 64 años y 8 hijos, Luzmila venD. helados D. la región llamado Muyuchi, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos en el parque principal D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Luzmila necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, esencia y coco.
Luzmila sueña con mejorar su casa y terminar D. cancelar el terreno que compró.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a member of the Communal Bank Señor D. Luren. She is a widow, 64 years old, and has 8 children. Luzmila sells ice cream in the Muyuchi region on Saturdays and Sundays in the main park in the city of Ayacucho. Luzmila needs a loan of 2000 soles that she will use to purchase sugar, flavorings, and coconut. She dreams of improving her home, and completing a fence around the piece of land that she purchased.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sugar, flavoring, and coconut

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo G. is from the city of Bagumbayan, Tuguegarao City. He is 51 years old. Eduardo is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Eduardo owns and operates a business making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling food and drinks to passengers in the bus terminal. Eduardo has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Eduardo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eduardo is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eduardo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Doña Olimpia es una mujer emprendedora, madres de tres hijos, desde hace varios años logro poner una pulpería que ha venido aumentando de capital como la captación de clientes. Para ella no ha sido fácil, ya que ante se dedicaba a la venta de tortilla, y que poco a poco ha logrado las mejoras con ayuda de la institución a través de los financiamientos, vende una variedad de productos de consumo diario, vende al contado, pero también da al crédito de quincena a clientes que conoce. Ya que muchas veces los clientes no pagan.
 En Tiempo de su pasado fue difícil por que no tenía la ayuda del padre de sus hijas y tenia que trabajar constante para poder alimentarlas. Hoy en día esta contenta por que la vida le ha cambiado gracias a su pequeña pulpería que como meta es agrandar cada día. Con este préstamo comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, golosinas, carne entre otros productos para ofrecer un buen servicio, a si como aumentar las ventas y obtener mejores utilidades. Y poder ir ahorrando para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa que va haciendo las mejoras poco a poco.
texts.en:
Olimpia is an enterprising woman and is mother of three children. For several years, she has been running a convenience store, increasing her income and growing her customer base in the process. This has not been easy for Olimpia, as previously she sold tortillas. However, little by little and with help from the organisation and previous loans, she has been able to expand her business. Olimpia sells a variety of products for daily use. People normally pay in cash but Olimpia also allows items to be purchased on fortnightly credit only for people she knows, as on many occasions, customers do not pay. Olimpia did not have the support of her children’s father and so had to constantly work in order to take care of them. However, these days, Olimpia is happy because her life has been transformed thanks to the small shop, which she wishes to continue expanding on a daily basis. With the loan money, Olimpia plans to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, soap, sweets, meat and other products in order to offer a good service to her customers, increase sales, garner better profits, and to be able to save to undertake home improvements bit-by-bit.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple grains, sweets, meat, etc., to increase both her inventory and sales.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Esperanza tiene 48 años, es casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en la ciudad de Anta y pertenece al banco comunal “Manuela Ramos de Iscucha Anta”.  

Al entrevistar a las socia de banco comunal ella nos manifestó. Yo cuento con un pequeño negocio el cual consiste en comprar en cantidades zapatos y después los vende para lo cual a un inicio se hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa, el cual nos brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pudimos muchos de nosotros empezar a si mejorar nuestro negocios. 
Desde ese momento nuestra vida comenzó a cambiar ya que contábamos con un capital, y en ese sentido nos pusimos a trabajar mi esposo y yo así como también mis hijos y desde entonces cambio todo para nosotros tanto en lo económico como en lo familiar, porque desde ese momento empezó a crecer mi negocio. 

Ahora que mi negocio va creciendo y así como también cuento con un capital y me va muy bien entonces  quiero aumentar más mercadería por lo cual necesito el crédito para comprar más zapatos.
texts.en:
Esperanza is 48 years old, married and has 4 children. She lives in the city of Anta and belongs to the communal bank Manuela Ramos de Iscucha Anta. Upon interviewing the members of the communal bank, she told us: "I have a small business which consists of buying large quantities of shoes and selling them. In the beginning, it was a little bit difficult because I did not have much capital. Then I was presented with the opportunity to belong to the communal bank of the Asociacion Arariwa, which offered us support with monetary loans. This way a number of us could start improving our own businesses. From that moment, our lives began to change because we had a source of capital. My husband, my children and I all started working, and since then everything changed for us, both economically and as a family, because at that moment my business started to grow. Now that my business is growing and I have a source of capital, it is going very well. Now I want to increase my supply of merchandise, so I need a loan to buy more shoes."

Translated from Spanish by Tania Mazumdar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more shoes (merchandise).

loans.name: Sixto  Arquímedes

texts.es:
En el barrio Las Colinas  de Somotillo el señor Sixto Arquímedes G. F.   se desempeña como contratista en el municipio de Somotillo brindando su servicio atados los pobladores del municipio y comarcas aledañas.
El nos dice que el crédito será Compra de materiales para la terminación de una obra como es cemento hierro arena piedra etc.
Este es el tercer crédito que nos solicita y nos dice que los primeros créditos la beneficio para empezar el acondicionamiento de su casa de habitación por lo cual esta muy agradecido con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Sr. Sixto Arquímedes G. F. works as a contractor in the neighborhood of Las Colinas, which is in the city of Somotillo. He provides his services to the local residents and those living in the surrounding areas.

Sixto says this loan will be used to buy materials such as cement, iron, sand, and stone to finish one of his jobs. This is the third loan he has requested. His first few loans were a benefit because he was able to begin remodeling his house. For this reason, he is extremely grateful to CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish one of his jobs

loans.name: Jenelyn Dabalos Group

texts.en: Jenelyn D. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Jenelyn is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC, a Kiva partner. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Jenelyn D. Group. Jenelyn is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Jenelyn raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jenelyn has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 1,200 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Jenelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Jenelyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Jenelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena Z. sells bags of maize, millet, and sorghum at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of simsim and groundnut to sell.  Madalena is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. She has three children, who are all in school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a store for her goods.

loans.use: Buy bags of simsim and groundnut

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor P. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 34 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Eleonor owns and operates a tailoring business providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Eleonor has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Eleonor joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. Eleonor is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Las Margaritas 2 Group

texts.es: Doña Isabel Martínez M., es casada, es  una persona analfabeta, tiene 6 hijos los cuales, 4 están casados y el resto  están a su cargo, ella se dedica a la Artesanía (elaboración de camisas) tiene 10 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario  se denomina Las Margaritas 2, El grupo cuenta con Seis  integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar,  Artesanía elaboración de Chumpas y pantalones,  y Agropecuario  crianza de animales domesticas,   El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de materia prima  para su negocio  y así incrementar el volumen de ventas. Una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital.
texts.en:
Doña Isabel Martínez M. is married, and cannot read and write. She has six children, four of whom are married, and the other two still live at home. For the past ten years she has earned her living by handcrafting shirts. She relates enthusiastically how some neighbours got together to form a group and seek a loan. The group is called Las Margaritas 2 (Daisies) and is comprised of six women who have a variety of jobs such as making sweaters and pants, and raising farm animals. Isabel will use her share of the loan to buy materials for her business and thus increase her sales. One of the problems of running a business has been the lack of capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rashidan's Group

texts.en:
Rashidan is a seamstress but at work she never forgets her family's needs. She starts sewing clothes after she finishes the household chores and cooking their meal. Her family loves her a lot and respects her caring nature. She makes beautiful looking clothes of the latest designs and sells them to different boutiques and ready-made garment shops in the market. Rashidan is a resident of the city called Borewala which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. Borewala is famous for its shrines. 

Rashidan is married to S. A., who sells construction supplies. He has a shop in the main market which faces a heavy crowd of people. The advantage of having a shop in the busy market is that people can easily approach the shopkeepers to buy items according to their need. 

Rashidan has applied for a loan from Asasah to help her husband expand his business. With the loan, he will buy construction supplies such as cement, sand and bricks. Rashidan is confident that her husband will be able to increase his income by investing money in his business. 

Note:  In the picture, the lady who holds a book (an Asasah passbook) in her hands is Rashidan.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.es:
Santos María J. I. es una mujer trabajadora, que vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con sus tres hijas en las edades de 19, 21 y 26 anos, que fueron la fuente de su inspiración cuando desde muy pequeñas, elaboro la ropa que vestían con sus propias manos imprimiéndole cariño y dedicación a lo que hoy es su negocio y fuente de ingreso familiar.  Su primera y permanente clientela fueron sus familiares y sus vecinos cercanos, que gradualmente la han ayudado a salir adelante recomendándole nuevos clientes porque reconocen localidad de sus prendas y sobre todo su amabilidad.
Este es su primer financiamiento y quiere con el comprar  materia prima e insumos, como telas, pellones, hilos para elaborar uniformes respondiendo a un contrato con colegios en la zona muy cercana a su negocio, Su meta a mediano plazo es comprar una nueva máquina y una fileteadora- bordadora, que ayude a dar buen acabado a sus prendas y a mejorara los tiempos de producción así como los gastos relacionados con la contratación de estos servicios que aun no tiene.
texts.en:
Santos Maria J. I. is a hard working woman. She lives in the city of Cartagena with her three daughters aged 19, 21, and 26 years of age. They are the source of her inspiration when they were little. She started out making clothes for them with her own hands, making them with care and dedication. This developed into her business and it is the source of income for the family. Her first and permanent client base has been her family and her nearby neighbors. They have gradually helped her improve, recommending new clients. They recognize the quality of her work, and above all, her kindness. This is the first loan she accesses and she will purchase materials, such as fabrics, lining, and threads to make uniforms, to honor contracts she has with schools in the region. Her short term goal is to purchase a new sewing and embroidery machine. She wants to give her products a better finish and improve the time to complete her projects. She also hopes to one day hire help.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchaes materials such as fabric, lining, and threads to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Flenda

texts.en:
Flenda M. is 48 years old, married to Josephat M., a 55-year-old mechanic. They have two children aged 14 and 10. Flenda has been operating a green grocery for 11 years with a monthly profit of Kshs.10, 500 

Flenda has no history with any other MFI, and is applying for her seventh loan of Kshs.20, 000 to buy more types of vegetables which will enable her to better serve her customers. During open-air market day the business does very well. People bring their agricultural products to the market, and Flenda can buy from farmers at a better price and later sell to her customers at a profit.

Flenda plans to use the anticipated profit to plough back into the business, to help it grow. She wants to see her children have a better education and realize their goals in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child not yet in school.  Mariam has a business of a salon, which she has had for 2 years. She also sells shoes  

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase braids for the hair and shoes. With the help of this loan, Mariam hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, Mariam hopes to buy a plot and build a house. Mariam is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: braids for the hair and shoes

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 43 años, tiene una pequeña papelería, vive en una zona periurbana ubicada a las afuera de Guayaquil llamada Duran y caracterizada por su ecología de disolución. 

Desde pequeño el comenzó a trabajar como obrero en construcciones para así tener su propio dinero y ayudar a sus padres. Poco a poco con algunos ahorros compro papelería y ubico su negocio en un local. En la actualidad el tiene su papelería con unas rejas muy gruesas para tener mas seguridad debido a la delincuencia del sector. Aunque tiene su negocio sigue trabajando como maestro constructor con ayuda de su esposa.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar papelería, cuadernos para surtir mas su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y hacer mas grande su negocio.
texts.en:
43-year old Manuel runs a small stationery store. He lives in the suburban area called Duran, which has a deteriorating ecosystem, located on the outskirts of Guayaquil.

As a young boy he started work as a labourer in the construction industry so he could have his own money and help his parents. Over time he saved enough money to buy stationery and set up a stall. Nowadays he has a store with very thick burglar bars for security as there is a lot of crime in the area. Although he has his business, he continues to work as a construction supervisor with help from his wife.

With the loan Manuel wants to buy more stock such as notebooks. His future plans include finishing building his house and expanding his business.

loans.use: to buy stationery, notebooks etc

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, su negocio es la compra y venta de chatarras y un taller de enderezado de pintura, él vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 11 y 8 años de edad; la compra y venta de chatarra la está haciendo desde hace 1 año y el taller lo tiene desde hace 5 años, está en proceso de la instalación de la energía eléctrica y compra de algunas herramientas para el taller,  motivo que lo lleva a solicitar un préstamo y de solventar la necesidad de la energía y de mejorar el taller.
Su proyección es administrar bien este préstamo realizar la inversión prevista, seguir trabajando de la mejor manera para contar con estos ingresos que le ayudan a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan resides in the Jiquilisco department in Usulután. His business is the buying and selling of scrap metal and an auto body shop (repairs and painting). He lives with his wife and 2 children, 11 and 8. He has been purchasing scrap metal for 1 year and has had the workshop for 5 years. Juan is in the process of installing electricity and purchasing some tools for his workshop, the reason for which he is seeking a loan to cover the costs of electricity and improve his workshop.
