Hi plan is to administer the loan well, making the anticipated investment, and to continue working in the best way possible with these earnings that help him and his family.

loans.use: Purchase tools for his workshop and install electricity

loans.name: Duo Solidario Siloe Group

texts.es:
DUO SOLIDARIO  SILOE
MARTA X. S..
De 51 años de edad tiene seis hijos tres casados y tres solteros que son los que la apoyan en su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de suéteres y blusas, su venta lo realiza en diferentes pueblos de ambulante, ella también elabora güipiles a mano pero su actividad principal es la venta de suéteres, ella tiene una visión de agrandar mas su negocio, y comprar mas mercadería para poder surtir mejor su producto, pero para que pueda hacerlo necesita su crédito. Para compra de ropa.
MARIA LIDIA X. S..
De 41 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos pequeños, tiene una hija mas grandecita que la ayuda a atender su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de bebe, su negocio lo tiene en Comalapa, ella también se dedica al alquiler de sillas y mesas, pero donde va a invertir su crédito  en su venta de ropa de bebe, ella quiere surtir su tienda con diferentes estilos y por esa razón  solicita su crédito para compra de ropa de bebe y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
SILOE GROUP
51-year old Marta X. S. has six children, three of whom are married and three single. The latter help her with her business selling sweaters and blouses in the streets of different towns. Marta also makes güipiles (traditional weavings) by hand, but her main work is selling sweaters. She would like to expand her business and buy more merchandise to sell, but for this she needs a loan to buy clothing.

41-year old Maria X. S. has four young children and one older daughter who helps her with her business selling baby clothes in the town of Comalapa. Maria also rents out chairs and tables, but she plans to use the loan to buy baby clothes. She wants to stock her store with different styles of baby outfits and thus increase her income.

loans.use: to buy baby clothing and sweaters

loans.name: Nicha

texts.fr:
Âgée de 24ans, mariée, mère  d’un enfant en bas âge, avec son niveau terminal, n’ayant pas reçu à son baccalauréat, elle se lance dans la vente des produits  cosmétiques et boissons importées. 

En 2007,elle  ouvre une boutique et s'approvisionne à Kinshasa et sur place dans les magasins de ventes des produits cosmétiques en gros.
Le prêt passé lui a permis de renouveler son stock en achetant plus les laits de beauté, les savons, les crèmes, les tubes éclaircis santes, les produits defrisants, et démêlants  et la boisson importée.

Avant le premier prêt, elle vendait en moyenne 15.000f par jour, maintenant , avec les enseignements reçus, elle a épargner et rembourser son prêt sans difficultés.
Le prochain prêt, sera là pour contribuer à ses projets, à savoir moderniser sa parfumerie en ajoutant les produits de marques, renforcer son stock.
Très motivée pour ce type de commerce, elle pense  sortir du pays, aller acheter a l'étranger pour être fournisseur des produits cosmétiques et a la longue ouvrir un grand magasin.
texts.en:
Nicha is 24 years old, the mother of a young child, and she did not complete her schooling. She has a business selling cosmetics and imported drinks. 

In 2007 she opened a boutique store. She makes her purchases in Kinshasa and in stores that sell cosmetics in wholesale.  The previous loan helped her to resupply her business with the purchase of beauty lotions, soaps, skin creams, hair treatment products, and conditioners, as well as imported drinks. 

Prior to her initial loan, her sales averaged 15.000f per day. But today with the training she has received, she has been able to save some money and pay back the loan without any problem. 

This next loan will be used towards her business. She will update her perfume store to include brand name products, and she will resupply her store. She is very motivated in her business. She is thinking about going out of the country to make her pruchases and become a supplier of comestics. She wants to have open a large store one day.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics, wigs, and impored drinks.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Eugenia La socia tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, la socia trabaja vendiendo gelatinas y comidas caseras en el mercado central de Urubamba; la socia también se dedica a la agricultura ella tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual ella siembra maíz y los vende cuando llega la época de cosecha. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar sus comidas y también empezará a elaborar chicha de maíz y vender en el mercado central para todo ello ella requiere el crédito para comprar insumos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos e insumos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eugenia is a member of the "NUEVO AMANECER DE URUBAMBA" (Urubamba's New Dawn) community bank which is located in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Eugenia is 32 years old.  She lives with her partner and has four children.  She works selling gelatin desserts and home-made meals in Urubamba's central market.  She also farms.  She has a small plot of land where she sells corn which she sells at harvest time.

Eugenia needs this loan to buy supplies for preparing her meals.  She will also start making 'chicha de maíz' (a traditional corn-based drink) that she will sell in the central market.  For all this, she requires a loan to buy supplies.  Eugenia is requesting her loan to buy products and supplies for her business.

Eugenia is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies for her business

loans.name: Gabael

texts.es:
El Joven Gabael de 21 años de edad, vive con su esposa Sara Maria Zamora con quien tiene un hijo de dos años, ella cuida de su hijo y le ayuda en los quehaceres del Hogar y la administracion del Negocio, habitan en El Barrio San Antonio de la Primera entrada 2 1/2 cuadras al este, en el Municipio de Juigalpa Chontales, Gabael tiene un Botiquin Veterinario establecido, el cual se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 3 años, de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales para los gastos del hogar y los compromisos de pago, es una parsona responsable, activa con sueños por delante, 

Solicita credito con la ayuda de Kiva para continuar en el mercado del Comercio para aumentar su inventario y de esta manera dar mayor cobertura a su clientela.  

Su mayor sueño es que su negocio crezca y no le falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Young Gabael is 21 and lives with his wife Sara Maria Zamora, with whom he has a two-year-old child. Sara takes care of the child and helps him with the household chores and running the business. They live in the San Antonio de la Primera Entrada neighbourhood, 2 1/2 blocks to the east, in the Juigalpa Chontales municipality. Gabael has an established veterinary store, which he has run for three years. This business provides him with a  monthly income to cover the household costs and his loan payments. He is a responsible and active person with dreams for the future.
He is requesting this loan with the help of Kiva to continue as a merchant and increase his inventory, in order to satisfy his clientele. 

His greatest dream is for his business to grow and to never lack his daily bread.

loans.use: the sale of veterinary products

loans.name: Moen

texts.en: Moen S. is a 28-year-old farmer who lives in Kompog Cham Province. Moen S. is married to Mr. Rin, age 30, who earns a living by selling cow. He always goes to buy cows in and around community from farmers and re-sells those cows to gain income. This couple has been married for years and has four children, and all of them are single, and living under her care. Moen S. sees that her husband’s business is profitable one for the whole family, and she hopes to sustain his business by accumulating a larger quantity of cows using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan tiene 32 años de edad , es originario de la comarca Mata Pali, Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí , es soltero, tiene un hijo, de oficio agricultor  se dedica  a la siembra de tabaco producto que es vendido y exportado hacia Cuba. Tuvo que trabajar a temprana edad para poder aportar en la alimentación de su familia razón por la cual no pudo seguir estudiando solo llego hasta sexto grado de primaria.
Juan comenzó sus actividades de siembra a los 16 años junto con su hermano, y que su papa se dedicaba de lleno a la siembra de tabaco en la comarca de Paso Hondo a 13 kilómetros de Pueblo Nuevo. Sus negocios anteriores fueron la siembra de granos básicos como frijol y maíz en época de primera y postrera. Actualmente su mayor ingreso económico lo obtiene de cultivo del tabaco y algunas hortalizas.
El solicita el crédito para poder pagar la mano de obra del cultivo de tabaco ya que dentro de esta producción el ocupa a 10 mujeres amas de casa para ayudarle procesar le tabaco hasta llevarlo a la etapa de producto terminado, y además para terminar de completar de pagar lo gastos que genera cosechar estos cultivos y sacar un mejor rendimiento en calidad que genere una buena  ganancia. Sus planes futuros son tener su propio mercado de cultivo, ser independiente económicamente, reparar su galera y tener buenas condiciones de siembra.
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old and a native of Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí, in the region of Pali Mata. He is single and has one child. Juan is a farmer who grows tobacco products that are sold and exported to Cuba. He had to work at an early age in order to feed his family, which is why he only completed school through the sixth grade.

Juan began planting with his brother when he was 16 years old. His father was a tobacco farmer in the region of Paso Hondo, which is thirteen kilometers from Pueblo Nuevo. His previous businesses included growing dry goods such as beans and corn during the spring and summer seasons. Now most of his income comes from growing tobacco and a few vegetables.

Juan is requesting a loan to pay for labor designated for processing his tobacco crop. He employs ten housewives to help process the tobacco into finished products. In addition, he will pay the expenses related to harvesting his crops so that he can achieve high quality products that generate good revenues. His future plans are to have his own market for his crops, become financially independent, repair his storehouse, and have good conditions for planting.

loans.use: Pay for labor to process tobacco products & finish paying expenses related to harvesting tobacco

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; la socia tiene 39 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; la socia se dedica  al negocio de turismo ella tiene ya hace varios años atrás su Agencia de Viajes el cual brinda el servicio de Turismo de Aventura brindando las siguientes rutas : Camino Inca, Salkantay, Choquequirao entre otras rutas más, la socia es una persona bien alegre y entusiasta, mediante su empresa la socia saca a su familia adelante y esto es algo que le hace sentir bien ya que su familia es el motivo que ella tiene para seguir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la renovación de nuevos equipos de aventura.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Juntas y Unidas” [Together and United] communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the the department of Cusco. 

The member is Luz Marina. She is 39 years old, is married, and has 3 children. She works in tourism and has had her own travel agency for several years. Her travel agency provides adventure tourism service on the following routes: the Inca Trail, Salkantay, and Choquequirao, among others. Luz Marina is very cheerful and enthusiastic. This business allows her to provide for her family, which makes her feel good because her family is her motivation. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase new adventure equipment. She is very pleased by the loan and she promises to make her repayments

loans.use: To purchase new adventure tourism equipment

loans.name: Riziel

texts.en:
Riziel is a married woman who lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a videoke business & selling food. Her husband Joerge, who is 42 years old, works as a mechanic to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have four children who are 6 to 15 years old. 

Riziel joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Riziel has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to repair and maintain the videoke machines she rents out and also use some of the money to buy ingredients for her food vending business, so that she can continue to save up for future home improvements & the education of her children. Riziel is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of videoke machines

loans.name: Crane Group

texts.en:
Sandary K., who is in her mid-forties, is married with five children. She has been operating a food vendor business for four years. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. (only seven hours) and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Sandary's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business and to pay school fees and bus fare for her children. She has repaid her loans successfully. Sandary hopes for a loan to open a small shop and to start selling wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, groundnuts and sugar. Her dream is to one day open a stationery shop.

Sandary will share this loan with her loan group "Crane", which consists of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in repaying their loans. In the photo, Sandary is in front in an orange dress.

loans.use: to open a small shop and start selling wheat flour, sweets, biscuits, groundnuts and sugar

loans.name: Rosa Etelvina

texts.es:
Rosa, reside en Usulután, se dedica a la venta de ropa al por mayor, vive en compañía de su madre y su hermano, tiene  casa propia, es soltera y cuenta con el apoyo de su madre para atender el negocio.
Ella necesita realizar una inversión en ropa nueva, para el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo e invertirlo en prendas de vestir de moda, cubriendo así la necesidad que como comerciante tiene, dando abasto a los pedidos de los clientes.
Su objetivo es recibir del negocio ganancias ya que a través de ellas ayuda a su madre y cubre todas las necesidades del hogar.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in Usulután, and she has a business selling clothing at wholesale.  She lives with her mother and her brother in her own home. She is single and relies on her mother for help with the business.

Rosa needs to make an investment in new clothing for her business.  For this reason, she requests a loan so that she can invest in fashionable clothing.  This way she can have a sufficient inventory for her business and be ready to fill her customer's orders.  

Her goal is to get earnings from her business, since with these earnings she helps her mother and covers the expenses for all of the household necessities.

loans.use: to buy clothing in different styles and colors

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, vive con esposo, tres hijos de 15 años, dos y medio y dos meses, tienen un negocio de fabricación de cocinas industriales,  residen en San Miguel, inicio el negocio por sus padres quienes se lo heredaron, no tiene un horario fijo para trabajar porque depende de la demanda.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar rines de carros, tubos de hierro, hierro, laminas, estos materiales son los que utiliza para elaborar las cocinas, por lo tanto espera con esta inversión aumentar la producción.
Su objetivo es tener siempre materiales para fabricar las cocinas, ya que este es el negocio que cubre con sus ingresos los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and three children aged fifteen, two and a half and two months.  They live in San Miguel and have a business making industrial stoves.  Ana inherited the business from her parents.  She doesn't work fixed hours because everything depends on demand.  She is requesting a loan to buy car wheel rims, iron tubes, iron and metal sheets.  These materials are what she uses to make her stoves.  She hopes that with this investment she will increase her production.

Ana's goal is to always have materials available to make stoves since this is the business that covers her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy car wheel rims, iron tubes, iron and metal sheets

loans.name: Monarcas Ii Group

texts.es:
La señora Leonarda es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora ella tiene varias actividades económicas dice que le gusta mucho sus trabajos y los disfruta ya que de ahí sale el dinero para sacar adelante sus tres pequeños hijos ya que es divorciada, ella se dedica hacer donas de azúcar y de chocolate para vender en su colonia y comenta que su ex esposo fue que le enseño hacer las donas y ella tiene vendiéndolas desde hace 4 años, también se dedica a vender por las noches hamburguesas fuera de su casa de lunes y sábado y ahorita ella esta pidiendo un crédito para la venta de bisutería de plata, dice que ira a surtirse a la cuidad de Taxco Guerrero que es donde dan la plata muy económica para que así ella tenga un poco mas de ganancias. Dice que desde muy pequeña sus papas le inculcaron el amor al trabajo por eso ella es muy trabajadora y responsable con sus hijos y su casa. Además hace poco junto un poco de dinero y compro dos terrenos y después los revendió y ahí tubo un poco mas de capital para comprar otro mas grande el cual esta por venderlo y con ese dinero seguir invirtiendo  en otros terrenos y con lo que saque de ganancias ella les hará una casa a sus hijos ya que donde viven es rentado. La meta que tiene para sus negocios de las hamburguesas es poner una senaduría estable en su casa para que sus clientes estén cómodos y para la venta de la bisutería quiere tener muchas clientas para poder vender pronto su mercancía y comprar más.
Las otras 10 integrantes se llaman Erika, Maria de los Ángeles, Araceli, Maria del Pilar, Marisela, Adriana, Raquel, Lucia, Marisela, Teresa ellas quieren el préstamo para invertirlo en tienda de abarrotes, venta de cosméticos por catalogo,  tienda de ropa para dama, panadería, lavado de autos, repostería y antojitos mexicanos.
texts.en:
Señora Leonarda is a very hard-working and entrepeneurial woman. She has various businesses and says that she really likes her work. She enjoys it because that is how she has been able to earn money to take care of her three small children since she got divorced. She works making sugar and chocolate donuts and selling them in her town. Her ex-husband is the one who first taught her how to make donuts and she has been doing it for 4 years. 

Leonarda also works selling hamburgers at night, from Monday to Saturday. Now she is requesting a loan in order to sell silver jewelry. She is planning to go to Taxco in Guerrero to stock up on jewelry, because that is where they sell silver at a very reasonable price. She would like to begin selling jewelry in order to increase her earnings. 

Leonarda says that since she was very young, her parents imbued her with a love of work and that is why she is so hard-working, as well as responsible with her children and her home. Also, she recently put together some money to buy two pieces of land which she then resold at a higher price. With the capital from the sale, she was able to buy another larger piece of land which she is about to sell. She will continue investing in property and eventually with her earnings she will build a house for herself and her children, because the place they currently live is a rental. 

Her goal for her hamburger business is to put a permanent restaurant in her home so her clients have a comfortable place to eat. With the jewelry sales, she would like to build her clientele and be able to sell her merchandise quickly in order to buy more. 

The other 10 members are Erika, Maria de los Ángeles, Araceli, Maria del Pilar, Marisela, Adriana, Raquel, Lucia, Marisela, Teresa. They want the loan in order to invest in their businesses: a grocery store, selling cosmetics by catalog, a ladies' clothing store, a bakery, a car wash, and selling Mexican pastries and snacks.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 19 years old and lives in Uganda. She is single and has no children. Jane has a business rearing and selling domestic animals, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more domestic animals for raising for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop.
Jane is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more domestic animals to raise for resale.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es: Ana Rosa tiene su negocio que es la venta de especies. Tiene más de 9 años con esta actividad, con mucho sacrificio ha logrado proporcionar a su familia el alimento diario. Ella se levanta temprano pues tiene que realizar los quehaceres del hogar y además arreglar las cosas para su negocio. Es por este motivo que solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsas, salsa de tomate, acido, salsa inglesa  y además candelas.
texts.en: Ana Rosa sells spices, an activity she has been engaged in for more than 9 years. She has succeeded in providing her family with their daily necessities through great sacrifices. She gets up early to take care of the housework and to arrange everything for her shop. The loan she is requesting will be invested in her activity: she will use it to buy bags, tomato sauce, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce and candles.

loans.use: To buy bags, tomato sauce, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce and candles

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is 54 years of age.  She is married and is blessed with 4 children. Milagros is engaged in a livestock business raising hogs.  Her net income is 5,500 PHP for every hog that she sells every three months.   She is asking a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase feed for her hogs. She hopes that KIVA lenders will continue assisting her in the business so that she can further improve it and support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: buy feed for her hogs

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité se inició gracias a la iniciativa de la señora Blanca, quien se animó a trabajar en grupo. Luego de conocer el programa de la Fundación logro animar a sus vecinas y amigas, de donde surgió el comité. El grupo se define como muy responsable y cumplidor con sus obligaciones. Todas las miembros son muy trabajadoras y solidarias entre si.
La Sra. Lilian se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, cuenta que su negocio le ha generado buenos ingresos, por lo cual le gustaría poder seguir con el. Por medio de este trabajo ha podido darse a conocer por todo el barrio.
Ella solicita el credito para la compra de mas variedades de cosméticos con lo que podra satisfacer la demanda que tiene, ya que al hacerse conocida por el barrio mas gente viene a hacerle pedidos.
texts.en:
This group was started thanks to the initiative of Blanca, who motivated them to work together as a group.  After learning about the program of the  Fundación, she encouraged her friends and neighbors to join, and thus this commercial bank was formed.  This group is characterized as being very responsible and effective in making its payments.  All of the members are very hardworking and support each other.

Lilian has a business selling cosmetics.  She says that her business has generated good income, and so she would like to continue with it.  Through this work she has become well-known in the neighborhood.

Lilian requests a loan to buy a greater variety of cosmetics so that she can satisfy the demand that she has, because as she has become well-known in the neighborhood, more people come to make orders with her.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to later sell

loans.name: Liliam Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 60 años de edad, ella es casada y tiene 05 hijos, vive en casa propia la misma que solo cuenta con solo los servicios básicos de agua y energía eléctrica, su casa se localiza en el distrito de Tambogrande. 

Mercedes cuenta con un establecimiento de venta de pollo a la braza en su polleria, ella ofrece esta comida desde hace más de 10 años, en  su propio domicilio, donde atiende todos los días de la semana a clientes conocidos. Cuenta con ambiente y material adecuado para su negocio, en el que desea . seguir creciendo. 

Mercedes esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería en insumos (pollo, arroz, etc) y  mejoras en local y por  ende seguir creciendo en sus  ventas diarias y en su actividad. 

Mercedes tiene muchas ganas d que sus negocio siga creciendo, para ello trabaja diariamente, ya que sus finalidad es poder ayudar a su esposo al sostenimiento de sus hogar , para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 60. She is married and has 5 children. She lives in her own home, which only has basic water and electricity services. Her home is in the Tambogrande district.

Mercedes sells grilled chicken. She has done this for over 10 years out of her home. She tends to her regulars every day of the week. Her business has a good atmosphere and is well-furnished. She wants her business to continue growing.

Mercedes is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of supplies (chicken, rice, etc) and for improvements to her place of business. Her goal is for her daily sales and her business to grow.

Mercedes has a great desire for her business to continue growing. With this in mind she works every day, since her goal is to be able to help her husband to maintain their household, in order to offer her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase chicken for preparing food.

loans.name: Mwatime

texts.en:
Mwatime is a widowed woman with four children, all of whom have graduated from school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent.

For the past three years, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to establish a permanent food stall in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase sacks of rice and coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and coconuts to sell

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Hai, who was born in 1979, lives in Nghia Lai, Uy No, Dong Anh with her husband and two sons. Her first son earns an income and her second son attends school. Hai's husband is a builder and Hai is a hairdresser. She has a salon where she helps people to become more beautiful. She has had this job for 6 years, earning a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. Hai has participated in SEDA since 2005 and has always repaid her loans punctually. She would now like to borrow 9,810,000 VND to repair her salon.

loans.use: to repair her salon

loans.name: Luis Ponciano

texts.es:
Luis Ponciano tiene 34 años de edad, vive en unión libre, vive con la esposa y los dos hijos de 12, 6 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 28 DE ENERO  se encuentra ubicada en el recinto El Retorno Puerto Pechiche perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Luis se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz . Compra sus productos en un Comercial en Puerto Pechiche y las Vende en la misma localidad y en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, abono y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno para hacerse una casa y no pagar arriendo.

En los Tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los hijos y practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Luis Ponciano is 34 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children (ages 12 and 6) in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The members of the January 28th Communal Bank meet in the neighborhood of El Retorno Puerto Pechiche, which is part of the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Luis is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys his supplies at a shopping center in Puerto Pechiche and sells his products in the same location and in Ventanas.

Luis is requesting a loan to buy seeds, supplies, compost, and fertilizers for his crops. With the financial support of this loan, he will be able to acquire what he needs. Among the challenges he faces are pests and diseases. His dream is to buy a plot of land so that he can build a house and not have to pay rent.

During his free time, Luis enjoys being with his children and practicing sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, compost, and fertilizers for his crops.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 47 years old and married to Ruth. Together they have six children aged six, eight, ten, thirteen, eighteen, and twenty years. He owns a farm in Kamoiwo and keeps livestock.  He has been in operation for the past twelve years, earning a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

This is James' third loan after successfully paying back his previous loans.  He hopes to use the loan to purchase two dairy cows and animal feed. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

He dreams of improving his livestock farming and educating his children to greater heights.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows and animal feed.

loans.name: 01.03.08 .đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Quyết has a service business tailoring clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair service.

Quyết is 42 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 08 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Quyết's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Quyết has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Quyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Quyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase machines to do tailor-made and clothing repair service.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Teresita has been in this business for 10 years.

Teresita requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell at her store. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell at her store

loans.name: Santos Evaristo

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, es casado, empleado de alcaldía Municipal, trabaja en la alcaldía desde hace 2 años realizando oficios variados.
El está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material para la reparación de la cerca de un terreno, postes de concreto, maya ciclon, esta compra le ayudara a tener mayor seguridad y protección en su terreno.
El sueño de Santos es mejorar su vida familiar y su seguridad ademas de ser un cliente con buena moral de pago para la institucion.
texts.en: Santos lives with his wife and three children.  He’s married and works for city hall.  He’s worked there doing various jobs for two years.  He’s asking for a loan to buy materials to repair a fence around a piece of land: concrete posts and cyclone fencing in order to have better security and protection on his land.  Santos’ dream is to improve family life and security in addition to being a client of the institution with good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy concrete posts and cylone fencing.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Provincia de Maputo, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos e todos ainda frenquentam a Escola. Fez 7ª classe  e nao continuou por falta de condicoes financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua sogra enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas de casa. 

É motorista numa empres  de transporte de mercadoria divesa ha mais de 2 anos e tem um salario de 5.250.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção da sua casa (pranchas, cimento, pedra, areia, barrotes, e outros).
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Francisco was born in the district of Boane, in the province of Maputo in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of two children who are still in school. He attended school through the seventh grade but had to drop out because of his parents' financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own and also supports his mother-in-law, sending her money to help her with her expenses.

He has been a driver for a transport company for more than two years and earns 5,250 meticals a month. He uses his salary to pay for household expenses and also saves some in his bank account.
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15,000 meticals, which he will use to purchase construction materials (boards, cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to build a house.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku to finish and furnish his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (boards, cement, stone, sand, beams, etc.) to build a house.

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova is 38 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 17 and 14. In 2001, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. 
 
She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Shova plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Pilar Amparito

texts.es:
La Señorita Pilar es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, este lugar es de clima frió, es una zona que se encuentra rodeada de montañas y vegetación, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos laboran en diferentes actividades en la ciudad, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita. Pilar tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soletera de una niña de 3 años de edad, vive con su mamá quien es comerciante de animales, la casa en la que viven es propia.

Ella es profesional en el estilismo, tiene un gabinete de belleza en el cual labora hace 3 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo. 

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su local como shampoo, gel, tintes y otros productos de belleza.
 
Su meta es agrandar su local.
texts.en:
Ms. Pilar is a member of the ‘Paradise’ Communal Bank she lives near Cumbe in Cuenca. This place is of a cold climate as it is in an area surrounded by mountains and vegetation, its population breeds animals and are in agriculture. Most of Cuenca’s populace work in different fields in the city and keep the culture and traditions of their native land.

Ms. Pilar is 25 years old and is a single mother to a 3 year old girl, she lives with her mother who sells animals. They live in Pilar’s own home.

She is a hairdresser and has a salon where she has worked for 3 years and works Sunday to Sunday with no set hours.

This is Pilar’s second loan through this communal bank and she will use it to buy merchandize for her salon like shampoo, gel, dyes and other beauty products.

Pilar’s goal is to expand her salon.

loans.use: buy shampoo, gel, dyes and other beauty products.

loans.name: Kambarage Group

texts.en:
Naima, who is in her late fifties, is a widow with five children, some of whom are still going to school. She has been running a clothes business for ten years now. She works from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her business stock and has successfully paid back her loan. She wants a loan to collect more clothes from Zanzibar and sell them upcountry. Her dream is to one day be able to have an international clothes shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kambarage", which has a total of 22 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to collect more clothes and sell them upcountry

loans.name: Mesalimu

texts.en:
Mesalimu is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school, while one is still young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, she has operated a dressmaking business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. 

During festive season, the month of December, the demand for dresses is very high compared to other months when demand is low. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer demand in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of cloth materials for dressmaking business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of cloth materials for dressmaking business.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la fundación, el grupo se encuentra en el tercer ciclo, opera con la Fundación desde este año. Ellas son mujeres que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en equipo.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Felipa, ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de termos forrados en cuero y también hace trabajos de manicura a domicilio. Ella nos cuenta que gracias a su sacrificio, sumado a su trabajo y a la ayuda de su grupo puede salir adelante y generar los ingresos que necesita para aportar en su casa. Su meta es crecer como comerciante y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.  
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de termos para ser forrados y también cuero. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que se le está dando.
texts.en:
This group arose from a contact between one of the members and the Fundación.  The group is in its third cycle and operates with the Fundación since this year.  They are women who strive to the maximum to help their families through their teamwork.

One of the members of the group is Felipa.  She makes and sells leather covered thermoses and also provides in-home manicure services.  She tells us that thanks to her sacrifice added to her work and the help from the group she’s able to get ahead and generate income she needs to contribute to her household.  Her goal is to grow as a merchant and continue to help her family this way.

She’s asking for the loan to buy thermoses to be covered and also to buy leather.  She is grateful for the opportunity she’s being given.

loans.use: to buy thermoses and leather.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a 29-year-old, hardworking lady with 4 children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are educating her children and building a permanent house. She has been selling charcoal for the last 4 years. She started with capital of 100,000 UGX and now has over 1,000,000 UGX as working capital. Her major hardship is customers not paying on time. However, she has a vision of hiring employees to help expand her business. The purpose of the loan is to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.es: La socia Esther continua con su negocio, ella sigue adminitrando y atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes y tambien sigue vendiendo cosméticos. En esta oportunidad la socia necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas, leche, aceite y otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en: Esther still runs her general store and she also continues to sell cosmetics. At this time, our member needs the loan to purchase products like rice, sugar, noodles, flour, milk, cooking oil, and other basic need items.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, noodles, flour, milk, cooking oil, and other basic need items.

loans.name: Benkadi Iv Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du BENKADI IV sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans les familles polygames à Madoudiarrabougou, un des villages de la commune de Guegneka,  préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur quatrième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, MAMOU, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1,75 hectares  d’arachide.
La production est vendue au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 280.000F CFA environs par campagne. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes
texts.en:
The 10 members of BENKADI IV are married women. They are 28 years old on average, and they have an average of 3 children.  Most of them live in polygamous families in Madoudiarrabougou, one of the villages in the Guegneka district in the Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (2nd administrative region of Mali). 

They are working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their business at the beginning of the off-season. They grow millet and peanuts. This is their fourth loan with the institution. 

With this new loan, MAMOU, the person in the center of the front row, would like to pay for farm inputs, equipment, and plowing fees to maintain 1.75 hectares of peanuts.

They sell their crops after the harvest to men and women in the city of Fana. She would like to earn an average income of 280,000 FCFA per farming season. This income will let her repay her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing, and equipment.

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.en:
Gulmurod was born in 1978 year. He is a farmer who has a plantation. He has been in agricultural business since 1999 year. He sells his agriculture products at the local market. He has a lot of clients who prefer his good because he grows vegetables with good quality. He hopes that during some future years he will develop business and to do more income. He also has additional income from animal husbandry. 

Gulmurod has acquired a loan of 900 USD to buy mineral fertilizers and crops. He awaits your support and believes that your supporting will make his living condition better.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and crops

loans.name: Sadaqat

texts.en: Sadaqat , is 45 years old, married woman. She is running business selling garments to provide for her family. She purchases variety of children garments from the market at low prices and then sell it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. The garment selling business has allowed Nusrat to help earn money for the household thus easing the expenses and improving the standard of living for the family. For the improvement of her business, Sadaqat  has requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase winter collection of garments to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase winter collection of garments to meet customers’ demand consistently

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Mrs. Christine E. is the mother of four (04) children. She has lived for some twenty years with her two (02) sisters in the house she shares with her husband. A blacksmith by trade, her husband has difficulty meeting the family’s needs. This is why Mrs. E. covers more than 70% of the household expenses using the income from her business of selling generic products. She has been in this business for 5 years and has completely mastered it. During the day, Mrs. E. walks from neighborhood to neighborhood with her products before displaying them on the side of the road in the evening. Dynamic and honest, Mrs. E. has proven herself to be a capable manager and a trustworthy woman by receiving and successfully paying back her first two credits of $100 and $200 respectively without any incidents. In order to expand her selection and increase her business, Christine is asking for a new credit of $750, which will allow her to buy medicines directly from wholesalers. This will make it possible for her to increase her revenue and better take care of her family.

Translated from French by Lisa Molle, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame E. Christine est mère de quatre (04) enfants. Elle vit depuis une vingtaine d’année avec ses deux (02) sœurs au domicile conjugal. Forgeron de métier, son mari subvient difficilement aux besoins de la famille. Aussi, intervient-elle à plus de 70% dans les charges du foyer à travers les revenus issus de ses activités de vente des produits génériques. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 5 ans et en a une maîtrise totale. Pendant la journée, Madame E. Christine se promène de quartier en quartier avant de les exposer le soir au bord de la route. Dynamique et honnête, Madame E. Christine fait preuve d’une bonne gestionnaire et d’une femme de confiance à travers ses deux premiers crédits respectifs de $100 et $200 obtenus et régulièrement remboursés sans incident. Pour élargir son étalage et accroître son activité, Christine sollicite un nouveau crédit de $750 qui lui permettra d’acheter les médicaments directement chez les grossistes. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaires afin de mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: Buying and selling generic medicines

loans.name: Aghayeva

texts.en: N. is a resident of Beylagan town. She is 27 years old and started her business two years ago. She rents a shop in the center of town where she sells different food stuff. In the beginning of her business she borrowed first $300 then $500 for increasing the stock of goods. Thus she developed her business and now she needs $600 to buy a refrigerator to store diary, meat and other products.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her inn Business

loans.name: Achu Moses

texts.en: Moses is married and has six children. His ambition in life is to raise and own his own capital, and to see all his children become responsible citizens tomorrow.  As small steps towards these goals, he joined GHAPE and requested $40 as take-off capital. With previous loans he started a pig farm. Gardeners in his community have benefited from his  manure. Given a loan of $500, Moses plans to restructure his piggery and buy piglets, 160kg of feed and vaccines. He plans to repay the loan during the loan term.

loans.use: Reconstruction of pig sty and buying of piglets

loans.name: Macarena

texts.es:
Macarena is a married woman with four children: two sons, 15 and 7 years old respectively, and two grown daughters who are married and no longer live with her. Macarena’s husband works as a carpenter but his earnings are not sufficient to maintain the family. For that reason Macarena decided to begin her own business in order to bring income to her family and above all education to her young sons. She began to sell women’s undergarments by catalogue to her neighbors, friends and family. Little by little, her sales have increased. The business has been in operation between 6 and 7 years, and Macarena wants to continue with it.

Macarena is asking for a $925 loan in order to buy merchandise and to be able to offer better products. She is offering to repay the loan in 5 months. She and her family thank you for your support in helping her business continue to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Macarena es una mujer casada y tiene cuatro hijos, dos hijos de 15 y de 7 años respectivamente, y dos hijas mayores que ya son casadas y no viven con ella, su esposo trabaja como carpintero y los ingresos que él tiene no eran suficientes para mantener la economía de su hogar, fue por ello que ella tomó la decisión de empezar con su negocio para poder aportar ingresos a su hogar y sobre todo la educación de sus hijos que son pequeños. Ella empezó a vender ropa interior de dama por catálogo entre sus vecinos, amistades y familiares y poco a poco han ido creciendo con sus ventas, teniendo ya entre 6 a 7 años con su negocio y desea continuar con el mismo.

Macarena está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para comprar mercancía y poder ofrecer mejor sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 5 meses. Ella y su familia agradecen tu apoyo para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es:
Ruth Maria has been selling kids', men's and women's clothing such as shirts, trousers, shorts, socks and towels etc for 14 years. She started by investing her savings of many years of $2,000, and with this she started to travel to the capital (Managua) to buy merchandise in bulk.

She started as a wandering merchant, walking through the streets of Leon with a suitcase full of clothes, through the markets looking for clients. She had a huge desire to overcome her circumstances and decided to receive credit so that she could establish her business, and she rented a stall in Leon's central market.

Ruth has received 5 loans and has now been working with our organization for 14 months, and her testimony follows:

"Thanks to the great advice about managing my loans I have been able to move forward. My husband has not found a job so it is up to me to support our family and I do all I can so that my son can have a good education - he is the youngest but I hope he will overcome and become a professional. Each loan that I have received I have invested in increasing my merchandise with seasonal clothing."

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Ruth María tiene 14 años desempeñando este trabajo, vende ropa interior para niños, damas y caballeros, blusas, pantalones, camisas, short, calcetines, toallas...etc. Inició invirtiendo sus ahorros de muchos años U$2,000 (dos mil dolares), con esto ella comenzó a viajar a la capital(Managua) para coprar la mercaderia al por mayor.

Ella al inicio como comerciante ambulante, caminaba con la maleta de ropa por toda la ciudad de León y los mercados buscando clientela, pero con los buenos deseos de superarse decidió adquirir los créditos para poder establecer su negocio, alquilando un módulo en el mercado Central de León.

Doña Ruth ha recibido 5 créditos y actualmente está cumpliendo 14 meses de trabajar con nuestra organización, su testimonio es el siguiente:

"Gracias a los buenos consejos para saber administrar mi crédito he logrado salir adelante, mi esposo no ha encontrado trabajo, así que por el momento es a mi a quien me toca mantener a la familia y hago todo mi esfuerzo para que mi hijito logre tener una buena educación, el es menor de edad pero deseo que se supere y sea un buen profesional. Cada crédito que recibo lo invierto en la compra de mercadería para surtir el negocio con ropa de la temporada".

loans.use: To buy merchandise (Children's, women's and men's clothes) / Compra de Mercadería (Ropa para niños, damas y caballeros)

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Mrs. Dy K. C., 35, works making wine and raising pigs, earning around $10 per day of income. Her husband is a farmer who grows crops and collects palm juice to produce palm sugar. He makes about $4.80 a day in revenue.

Mrs. Dy K. C. has three children. Two are students and the third is too young to attend school.

Recently, she has applied for a loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more rice and adding more piglets in order to increase her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to produce wine and also buy more piglets for her livestock.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in León for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. Rodrigo R. has been selling fruits and vegetables in León for the past 27 years. He began his own stall with his hard earned savings as he had allways wanted to be an entrepeneur.

Rodrigo began selling in La Estación market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall

Currently his stall is his pride and joy with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor. Rodrigo is a father of four young children that are in school. Ceprodel has provided 27 microloans over the past three years to Rodrigo and he has paid back these loans. He needs another loan to expand the business and to help provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.<

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fayzullo

texts.ru:
Fayzullo Hafirov lives in the region of Khuroson. He is 55 years old, married and has no children. He has secondary education. He is in the agriculture and sowing of wheat. This business is the main source of income for Fayzullo and helps him support his family. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for growing of wheat. He has three years of experience in this field. The development of agriculture allows to provide wheat and flour to the local residents. Fayzullo plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хафизов файзулло житель района Хуросон. 55 лет ,женат, детей не имеет.Образование среднее. Занимается сельским хозяйством, посевом пшеницы.Этот бизнес позволяет обеспечить свою семью, т.к этот он является основным источником дохода. Кредит планирует использовать на покупку зерна и удобрений для посева пшеницы.Опыт работы в данном бизнесе 3 года.Развитие сельского хозяйства позволяет обеспечить население пшеницей и мукой.Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Kamuli Rd Village A(V) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Zaina K.. She is currently in the business of poultry farming and is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry birds. Zaina is 42 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 7 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Zaina makes approximately UGX 120000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to meet her basic needs like food and shelter. Zaina has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 1200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Zaina is joined in her small group by Harriet A., Rehema A. and Zaina M.. Harriet A. has a business milling maize and wants to stock more maize. Rehema A. is currently operating a business selling raw food and wants a loan to add capital. Zaina M. operates a poultry farming business and sells clothes and wants to construct a poultry house.

loans.use: To boost and expand poultry business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 37 years old. She is married woman with two children, ages 12 and 8. She and her husband also take care of another child, age five.

Mariam is a charcoal and food seller, a business she started in 2000. She works from 6am to 9pm each day and can earn a monthly profit of about $47 from her sales.

In the past, Mariam has taken out a successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and food items for her business.

loans.name: Siti

texts.id:
Siti Z. sells young coconut ice everyday. The distance from her home to her business is not that far as she can still walk. She usually goes by motorbike, but the motorbike is often used by her husband who works as a construction worker. Her business is quite promising although the profit is just decent. She plans to use the loan to build a pushcart. In addition the loan is going to be used for more working capital to buy more young coconut from the nearby market. She lives with her husband and two children at Jl.Mertasari Denpasar.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Arliadi Mahadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Usaha sehari-hari Siti Z. adalah sebagai penjual es kelapa muda. Jarak tempat usahanya dari rumah tidak terlalu, masih bisa dijangkau dengan berjalan kaki. Sarana yang dipergunakan biasanya sebuah sepeda motor, tetapi lebih sering dipakai suaminya yang bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan. Usahanya saat ini cukup menjanjikan, meskipun keuntungan tidak terlalu besar. Rencananya pinjaman yang didapat kali ini akan dipakai untuk membuat rombong sebagai sarana berjualan. Selain itu juga, sisanya akan dipakai sebagai modal membeli kelapa muda dari pasar terdekat. Bersama suami dan kedua anaknya, saat ini mereka tinggal di Jl.Mertasari Denpasar.

loans.use: to build a pushcart and add more working capital

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Vu, 31 years old, has been participating in the Fund for 9 years. Before joining the Fund she worked in the fields like many other women in the region. In 1999, she started planning with her husband to join the Fund for seed money to go into business and improve their family’s finances. Everyday her husband uses the money borrowed to go buy baby pigs in town and surrounding areas to sell to retailers with freezers. Mrs. Vu buys wheat from farmers and resell it to processors who grind the wheat. In the first few funding rounds, since they were new to their respective businesses, the couple only borrowed a small amount. After some time the couple became familiar with their businesses and bravely increased their loan amounts. The businesses have increased the family’s income day by day; currently the family’s income ranges from 3,500,000 VND to 4,500,000 VND per month. Thanks to this improvement the children are better off in their daily lives and their schooling. Mrs. Vu would like to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy more stock for her business without having to pay a high interest rate with credit.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Tuyết năm nay 31 tuổi và đã tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương được 9 năm.Trước khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương chị chỉ làm ruộng như bao người phụ nữ khác tại địa phương. Năm 1999 chị đã bàn bạc với chồng tham gia vào quỹ tình thương vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Hàng ngày chồng chị đã sử dụng vốn để đi mua lợn con trong xã và các vùng lân cận về bán cho các nhà máy đông lạnh, chị Tuyết đi thu mua lúa của nhân dân về bán cho các đại lý say sát gạo .Những vòng vốn đầu do mới làm quen với công việc buôn bán nên anh chị chỉ dám vay mức vốn nhỏ. Sau một thời gian anh chị thấy công việc buôn bán đã quen dần và thấy cách hoàn trả theo tuần của Quỹ rất phù hợp vì thế anh chị đã mạnh dạn vay mức vốn lớn hơn.Với công việc buôn bán hàng ngày thu nhập của gia đình chị đã tăng dần, hiện nay thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt từ 3500000 đến 4500000 đ/ tháng. Nhờ đó các con của chị đã được đầu tư hơn trong cuộc sống và học tập. Chị Tuyết mong muốn được vay 10 triệu đồng để đầu tư thêm vốn để đi mua hàng không phải mua chịu với giá cao.

loans.use: Business, Resale

loans.name: Ngoc Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ngoc Thi T. is a 37 year old woman. She has 2 children, who are going to school. She participated in TYM program in 2004 and used the first loan to raise pigs, but was not successful. As she could see that cow raising was more beneficial, the next loans were invested in breeding cows. At the moment, in family’s stable, there are 4 cows. In order to improve the family budget and support their children’s education, her husband works as a motorcycle taxi driver. The family’s income is 2,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to borrow the next loan of 8,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy more cows and food for them

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc T., Kiva Volunteer.

Chị TrầnThị Ngọc năm nay 37 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 2 con đang tuổi đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Vòng vvốn đầu tiên chị sử dụng để chăn nuôi lợn nhưng nhận thấy công việc chăn nuôi bò thịt tại địa phương đang phát triển và cho thu nhập cao hơn nên các vòng vốn sau chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bà thịt. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang nuôi 4 con bò. Để tăng thêm thu nhập cho gia đình và có điều kiện đầu tư cho con cái ăn học, hàng ngày chồng chị đi làm nghề xe ôm. Thunhập hiện nay của gia đình chị đạt 2.500.000đ/ tháng. Để có vốn mua thêm bò và thức ăn phục vụ chăn nuôi vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 8.000.000đ

loans.use: Buy cow and invest in raising

loans.name: Tojinisso

texts.ru:
Tojinisso Colieva is a citizen of the area of Vahdat. She is married and has eight children. She owns a small store in the Vahdat area in which she trades food products. This trade is the only source of income for her large family, because her children do not work yet since the are in school. In the current moment Tojinisso wants to increase the assortment of her goods, for which she needs to receive a loan, which she plans to repay within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Солиева Тоджиниссо жительница района Вахдат. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Клиентка имеет небольшой магазин в районе.Торгует она продуктами питания . Торговля является единственным источником дохода ее большой семьи. Дети Тоджиниссо еще не работают.Так как учатся в средней школе. В данный момент клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент товара. Для чего ей нужны деньги и она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Salama's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Salama is 32 years old, married, and has a child, age 7. Since last year, Salama has been earning income selling clothes. Every day, she works from 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m., earning a monthly profit of about US$60 from the sales.

Salama is now looking for a loan to buy more clothes and thereby improve her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, who have businesses dealing with food and bites sales.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes for sale

loans.name: Wuilman Antonio

texts.es: Don Wuilman tiene 42 años de edad, habita en un bario que se llama Laureles Norte, casado y con dos hijos mayores de edad, de 23 y 25 años, que ya son independientes, su esposa es comerciante, por la mañana se levanta a preparar el desayuno a su esposo ya que desde horas muy tempranas esta listo para salir a trabajar, ya que su trabajo es de taxista y tiene que chequear el carro ante de salir, ya tiene catorce años en este negocio que abecés le resulta cansado por que la situación esta mala y lo clientes no quieren pagar lo que vale la carrera, pero también hay días buenos, pues el inicio con recursos propios cuando compro su carro. Con la solicitud del préstamo es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción como arena, cemento, hierro. Zinc, para un anexo en la parte de atrás de la casa. A largo plazo es poder tener otro taxi para dar mejores servicios y obtener más ingresos.
texts.en:
Wuilman is 42 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. He is married and has two children ages 23 and 25 both of whom are independent. His wife is a merchant and she gets up in the mornings to prepare breakfast for her husband who has to get ready for work early as he works as a taxi driver and needs to check his car before leaving. He has been in this business for fourteen years and the job can sometimes be tiring because the situation is bad and clients do not want to pay what the trips are worth. However, there are good days. He started his business by buying his car with his own funds. He is asking for this loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, iron, and zinc to build an addition to the back of his home. In the long run, he hopes to have another taxi to be able to offer a better service and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to build addition to  home.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel has a restaurant at Uselu Motor Park. He is standing next to his wife in the picture. He sells cooked foods like rice, beans, yam, eba, etc. He also sells drinks in his restaurant. His restaurant is always busy with his customers. Travelers always stop by his restaurant to buy cooked foods. He manages the restaurant with his wife. They buy drinks from distributors in Benin City.

Gabriel needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to his customers. He is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He and his family live in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. He says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Sinignèsigui Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sinignèsigui ( 7 femmes,  6 mariées et 1 célibataire) vivent dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 5 enfants et  42 ans dans le  village de Bougoula Hameau situé à environ 3 km de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elles exercent le petit commerce d’articles divers notamment les condiments alimentaires, le bois de chauffe, les chaussures et les céréales. 
Se faisant mutuellement confiance et dans le soucis de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec lequel le groupe est à son 2 ème  du prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce deuxième prêt, elles comptent acheter 10 sacs de tomate, 10 sacs de piment, 10 sacs d’oignon, 10 sacs d’aubergine, 10 paquets de maggie, 10 boîtes de concentré tomate, etc. Les marchandises sont achetées au grand marché de Sikasso et vendues vendues au comptant et à crédit au marché du quartier et à la maison à une clientèle locale feminine. 
Elles envisagent augmenter subtentiellement leur profit en réalisant chacune un bénéfice moyen de 10.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir  aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités respectives.
texts.en:
The members of the Sinignèsigui group ( 7 women: 6 married and 1 single) live in polygamous families with, on average, 5 children and an average age of 42, in the village of Bougoula Hameau, situated 3 km from the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They retail various small items, notably condiments, firewood, shoes, and cereals. Trusting each other and hoping to better satisfy their ever-growing clientele, they decided to join the credit program of Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their second group loan (solidarity loan). The previous loan was correctly reimbursed.

With this second loan, they intend to buy 10 sacks of tomatoes, 10 sacks of hot peppers, 10 sacks of onions, 10 sacks of eggplant, 10 packets of Maggi, 10 boxes of tomato concentrate, etc. The merchandise is bought in the big open-air market of Sikasso and sold, for cash or credit, in the neighborhood market and out of their homes, to a local clientele consisting of women.

They expect to substantially increase their profit, each of them making an average profit of 10,000 F CFA per month which will be used to make repayments on the loan and cover family expenses, with the remainder invested back into their respective businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments, rice, shoes, and firewood

loans.name: Srey Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey Mao H. was born in 1982, and she now lives in Por Steang village in Kampong Cham. She is a duck breeder. Her ducks are getting bigger and bigger, and she does not have enough money to buy duck food to feed them. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Srey Mao H. decided to ask for a loan buy duck food.

Her husband, Mr. Chaom Cheng Ly, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Srey Mao H. has three children, one of whom is attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are only one and four years old. Her husband is presented next to her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy duck food for her duck breeding business.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Eleven years ago, Nodira started her clothing business. Experienced and talented in the business, Nodira has expanded her business into a successful trade, supporting her family. Throughout the last four years, IMON International has provided ongoing assistance to Nodira’s business through microfinance loans. Committed to growth and successful entrepreneurship, Nodira has used each loan wisely and has repaid each with a perfect credit history. Currently, she is seeking a loan of 4000 Somoni to purchase more clothing for selling. With the rotation of supplies in her business, she plans to repay the loan within 6 months. The well being of Nodira’s family and her business are in your hands. Nodira and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new clothing for increasing the range of goods.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy started her business selling provisions, drinks and foodstuffs in 2000. She hopes to increase her profits as the demand for her goods is increasing. Joy has applied for a loan in the amount of N100,000 to purchase more merchandise. She is 38 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a police officer. She would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Жена Рустама раньше являлась активной клиенткой Микроинвест несколько лет. Сам Рустам ранее был на заработках в России, после приезда стал помогать жене по бизнесу. Жена Рустама занималась куплей продажей сухофруктов, затем стала продавать рис. Посоветовавшись супруги решили арендовать маленький киоск посреди рынка и включили в ассортимент растительное масло, макароны, рис и чай. Теперь торговля пошла лучше и стало много постоянных клиентов. Сейчас Рустам планирует получить новый займ и прибрести оптом рис, так как цена на него сейчас приемлема.
texts.en:
Rustam's wife was an active Microinvest client for several years. He himself previously traveled to Russia for work, but after his return, he began helping his wife with the business. She worked in dry fruit sales, and later switched to selling rice. After some discussion, the couple decided to rent a small stall in the market and expand their inventory to include oil, noodles, rice, and tea. Now sales have improved and there are many regular customers. Rustam plans to obtain another loan and buy rice wholesale, since the price is currently fair.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wholesale purchase of rice

loans.name: Lissassi

texts.fr: Résidente du quartier d’agoè minamadou, adjavou lissassi exerce la restauration, sa spécialité est le plat de riz, il y a des écoles primaires dans son quartier, à la pause les élèves viennent acheter chez elle, aussi les jeunes célibataires de son quartier ont pris l’habitude d’aller déjeuner chez elle. Son stock de riz mou est épuisé, cliente de WAGES, elle s’adresse à l’institution pour obtenir un crédit et acheter 08 sacs de riz. Adjavou est mariée et à 05 personnes à charges
texts.en:
A resident of the Aagoè Minamadou district, Ms. Adjavou Lissassi works in the restaurant business. Her speciality is rice plates. There is a primary school in her district. During breaks, the students come to buy from her. Also, young unmarried people in the area have gotten into the habit of having lunch at her place. Her stock of (soft) rice is exhausted. A client of WAGES, she's inquiring with that institution to obtain a loan to buy eight sacks of rice. Adjavou is married and has five people to support.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice for catering

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Fatuma M. from Dar es Salaam. She is single. Fatuma has been running a women's handbags and clothes business since 2001. She works at the business for 1-4 hours per day, 7 days per week. Fatuma currently earns about 120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy more clothes and handbags for her business. In the future, she plans to establish the same business in another place. Fatuma thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and handbags for her business

loans.name: Felipe De Jesus

texts.es:
Felipe de Jesús V. C. no aparece en la imagen pero su esposa la señora Maria Magdalena Vargas Rojo es a la persona que se le tomo ya que le señor trabaja y no se encontró.
 Felipe y su esposa quieren construir un cuarto en la parte de enfrente para tener mas espacio y vivir cómodamente. Sus hijos ya están creciendo pero en un futuro querrán tener su propio espacio, la casa es muy pequeña es de interés social por lo que el señor piensa en comprar el material para comenzar su proyecto.
texts.en:
Felipe de Jesús V. C. does not appear in the photo but his wife, Señora Maria Magdalena Vargas Rojo is the person that we have photographed as Señor Felipe is at work and we couldn’t meet him. Felipe and his wife want to build a room on the front part of their home, in order to have more space and to live comfortably. Their children are already raised, but in the future they want to have their own space. The case is very small as it is public housing, so Señor Felipe thought to buy the materials to begin his project.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Nelly
