texts.es: Nelly tienen 20 años, es una joven madre muy tranquila, vive con su pareja en una casa alquilada, es madre de una niña de 3 años, que es el motivo de su esfuerzo. La compra, crianza y venta de cuyes es el negocio que realiza diariamente, la carne de sus cuyes es muy solicitada en las ferias dominicales, ya que se encarga de alimentarlos bien y se preocupan de que desarrollen un buen tamaño; por ello, todos los días se levanta muy temprano  para cortar el pasto fresco para que se alimenten y no consuman las avenas ni alfalfa almacenada para los meses de sequía. Nelly cuida con mucho cariño a sus animalitos, ya que sabe que gracias a ellos captará el dinero para cubrir sus necesidades. Los 2 años que lleva en este negocio le enseñaron a criar y desparasitar a sus roedores oportunamente para ofrecer carne sana y saludable a todos sus clientes. Para más adelante, Nelly espera incrementar la cantidad de cuyes que posee, asimismo construir unas jaulas adecuadas, considera que lo más difícil de su trabajo es escoger la mala hierba de entre el pasto con que los alimenta, porque si no lo hace significaría la muerte de los cuyes que la coman. Nelly muy orgullosa, nos muestra a sus cuyes en la foto. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y en este crédito hace compromisos de cumplir sus pagos en las fechas programadas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para mandar a construir jaulas para sus numerosos cuyes, y de ese modo seleccionarlos de acuerdo el tamaño, también comprará alimentos concentrados para el desarrollo y engorde de sus animalitos.
texts.en:
Nelly is 20 years old, and is a very tranquil young mother. She lives with her partner in a rented home. She is the mother of a 3 year old girl, who is the motivation for her efforts. Her business is the purchase, care and sale of guinea pigs. The meat from her guinea pigs is in high demand at Sunday fairs because she feeds them well and ensures they grow to a good size. To do this, she gets up very early each day to cut grass to feed them. She prevents them from eating oats and alfalfa which is stored for months when there is drought. Nelly cares for her little animals with a lot of love, as she knows that it is thanks to them that she brings in money to meet her needs. The two years she has spent in this business have taught her to care for her animals and keep them parasite free in order to offer healthy meat to all her customers. In the future, Nelly hopes to increase the number of guinea pigs that she has, and to build appropriate cages for them. She finds that the most difficult part of her work is to root out bad weeds in the grass that she uses to feed the animals, because if she doesn't the guinea pigs that eat them will die. Nelly proudly shows us her guinea pigs in this photo. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she is committed to making payments on the dates scheduled by her loan advisor. The money that she is requesting will be used to have cages built for her many guinea pigs. With this she will be able to select them according to size. She will also purchase concentrated feed for the development and fattening up of her little animals.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed and construction of cages

loans.name: Huyen's Group

texts.en:
Huyền Thị Nguyễn was born in 1952 (no. 010102080014). She has 4 children. She sells clothes in the market. Her husband raises pigs and grows vegetables at home. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She wants to expand her business. She needs 4,142,000 VND (235 USD) to buy more clothes to sell in the market. Besides Huyền, Ms. Thuận Thị Nguyễn also attends this group.

Thuận Thị Nguyễn was born in 1970 (no. 010102080015).  She has 2 children. She is a dressmaker. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND. She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (235 USD) to buy material to make clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell in the market.

loans.name: Richard's Group

texts.en:
Richard A. is the leader of Buramba Tewtungye, a group in Bushenyi. He is a determined and dedicated 46-year-old man, who is married with three children aged 12 – 18 years. He also helps to care for two orphans. All of the children are in school. 

Richard has a bakery business that he inherited from his father 20 years ago. His market area is in the Ishaka suburbs,  with Mitooma secondary school and the University nearby. His main challenge has been the constant increase in price of the raw materials, such as flour and oil. He uses his motorcycle to supply the products to his customers and this makes his work a bit easier. 

His kind of products include doughnuts, cookies, brown bread, pancakes, kebab and chapattis and luckily he has customers for all his products. Richard had a dream of opening up a store in the suburban town with a van to expand in the market, as well as have all his children educated up to the university level. He needs a loan to help with buying firewood and flour for baking purposes.

loans.use: Buying firewood and flour for baking purposes.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
Hăng Nguyễn Thị (1816071341) is a 30-year-old woman living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has a school-aged child.

Hăng owns and operates a food stall, selling poultry products in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,800,000 VND a month.

In 2007, Hăng joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

Hăng is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tamidayo

texts.en: Tamidayo sells drinks, sachet water and palm oil in her house. She has been in business for the past ten years. Tamidayo lives in Lagos and she is very happy with lapo and Kiva for their financial support. She is 47 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more drinks and palm oil to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and palm oil to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence sells fruit and canned juices, water and drinks. She even sells rechargeable cards. The majority of her sales are to retailers who in turn sell to final consumers. Those who sell along the highways also buy from her because her shop is close to a major road. Buying in large quantity enables her to get a better price and increases her profit on each sale, so she is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and juice to sell.	Florence lives in Lagos with her family. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and juice to sell

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto vive en Villa San Antonio Bajo de la ciudad de La paz con sus hijos, percibe una renta de jubilación que le permite cubrir sus necesidades de alimentación, el crédito que solicita es para la refacción de su vivienda que esta un poco deteriorada por la antigüedad además que sus hijos necesitan mayor comodidad. 

Es cliente de Impro y pago muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Humberto lives with his sons in Villa San Antonio Bajo in the city of La Paz. He receives a retirement payment that allows him to pay for their food costs. He is asking for a loan for the refurbishment of his house, which is a little deteriorated due to old age. Furthermore, his sons need more comfort. He is a member of Impro and repays very well, therefore he can ask for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: House refurbishment

loans.name: Yeliboya Group

texts.en:
This is Hawa C., Emma K. and Kadiatu S.. They call their group Yeliboya. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva Lenders. Previous loans have helped these entrepreneurs’ businesses and personal lives a great deal.  Having completed repaying their last loan successfully, they are again asking for a new loan of Le 1,000,000 for each to help them further strengthen their businesses. 

Hawa C. on the right is the leader of this group. Hawa was born in Freetown about fifty-five years ago. She now lives in Magburaka town, where she is married together with her five children. Two of Hawa’s children are already grown-ups, one is in college and two are in secondary schools. Hawa sells dried fish which she buys from a village called Yeliboya. She has been in the dried fish business for over eighteen years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery tiene 23 años, vive con su pareja y padre de su hija, en su casa propia. Cuando la visitamos la encontramos en los ajetreos de tapar apresuradamente la pachamanca (plato típico que consiste en la cocción de los alimentos en un horno bajo tierra). Esta actividad suele realizar en cada cosecha de papas para compartir con sus peones y asimismo celebrar la buena producción de sus chacras. Rosmery se siente feliz de su actividad agrícola, ya que desde niña realiza tal labor, por ello no le parece pesado, su dificultad es cuando hay lluvia excesiva, pues este clima atrae a las plagas y a los gusanos, que con mucha facilidad perjudican sus sembrios. En el caso de los gusanos los contrarresta con la compra de fungicidas, pero hay plagas que no puede controlar y eso la apena muchísimo porque pierde sus cosechas.
Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, ella ha venido cumpliendo la labor de secretaria de su banco comunal eficientemente, por lo que los demás integrantes le tienen mucho cariño. El dinero que ahora solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su próxima siembra.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Leang M., a 47-year-old married woman with two children, lives with her family in Phnom Penh. She works in a grocery store, where she typically earns approximately US$5 per day. Her husband, Ouk Sovan, meanwhile, is a construction worker (he builds houses), which normally allows him to earn approximately US$4 per day.

Leang is now seeking a loan in the amount of US$1,100 to reinvest in her grocery business.

loans.use: To expand and improve her grocery business

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana R. es una dama que muy esforzadamente se dedica a laborar para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así proporcionarle a su familia buenas condiciones para su desarrollo.

La señora Juana atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su vivienda y para ello ha solicitado el crédito ya que lo invertirá directamente en la compra de materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo la obra de reconstrucción de su casa porque es de mucha necesidad para ella y al recibir el crédito e invertirlo en esta obra logrará hacer realidad su sueño de ver su vivienda en perfectas condiciones.
texts.en:
Juana R. is a woman who works strenuously to bring home enough money to support her family and provide good conditions for their development. Juana needs to invest in her home. For this reason she is requesting a loan that will be invested directly in construction materials to remodel her house, because there is a great need for it. To receive this loan and carry out this work would make her dream of having a house in perfect condition become a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Logo

texts.en:
Logo N. is a 47-year-old woman living in the town of Falelima. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Logo is starting a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Logo has just started operating this business and earns approximately 150 WST a month from these activities.

In 2009, Logo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Logo is now requesting a loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by the borrower from SPBD. Logo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD:

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ester

texts.en: Ester S. is from the village of Gud. She is 32 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Ester owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In 2009, Ester joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is from the village of San Manuel, Naguilian, Isabela. She is 45 years old, married, and has adult-aged children.

Rosemarie owns and operates a business venture into raising pigs for sale. During the selling season, she earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 


About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene B., 57, is married and lives in Prk Pag-asa, Brgy Zone 1, Cadiz City, Negros Occidental in the Philippines. She earns her living by operating a general store.

Irene’s husband, Rodrigo B., is  61 years old and works as carpenter and welder, and earns about 5,000 PHP per month. They have four children, who are between 32 and 38 years old, and six grandchildren. Three of the children have their own families, but still help their parents with some of the household expenses. The remaining single child also works and helps with the household expenses.

Irene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002, in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve their family's quality of life. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase the family's income by operating a general store and fruit vending. Now, she earns an average monthly income of 4,000 PHP from her business activities.

Irene is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 14th loan, the amount of 16,000 PHP, which she intends to use for her general store and fruit vending business. Irene is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Carita De Angel Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “CARITA D. ANGEL” esta ubicado en la Pampa todas son del mismo Barrio, las socias son responsables, es un grupo muy organizado, es su 1º ciclo son personas dedicadas a trabajar para engrandecer su negocio, Rosa  es la Presidenta es una persona muy responsable ella se dedica a la venta D. puertas y ventanas, Karina es la Secretaria, y Josefina es la Tesorera. Todas las socias del Banco Comunal tienen negocio, como ser: Venta D. Comida, Venta D. ropa, Venta D. Cosméticos, Venta D. empanada y joyas. Específicamente cada socia se desempeña en las siguientes actividades: Rosa gloria  como mencionamos anteriormente es la presidenta y venD. puertas desD. hace 8 años atrás, Lusmila se dedica a la venta D. hamburguesa recién desD. hace 1 año, Harry tiene un puesto donD. venD. ropa americana (ropa usada) esto lo hace desD. hace 6 años, Pura leny se dedica a la venta D. joyas plata esto desD. hace 1 año, Maria elena es costurera y su especialidad es la costura D. sabanas desD. hace 2 años, Jorge se dedica a la venta D. pan tiene experiencia en el negocio D. 2 años, Ana consuelo tiene un puesto D. venta donD. ofrece chips D. teléfono celular D. una compañía D. comunicaciones esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 2 años atrás, Irma se dedica a la venta D. comida desD. hace 1 año, Karina es promotora desD. hace 1 año, Josefina se dedica a la carpintería desD. hace 15 años atrás y por último la socia Elsa se dedica a la venta D. dulces y tiene una antigüedad D. 2 años en el negocio. Las socias indican D. que si tienen mucha competencia pero ellas siguen adelante con su trabajo debido al esmero que pone cada una en que su negocio crezca poco a poco. El crédito por lo general lo utilizan para hacer crecer su negocio, aumentar su capital. Y comprar más cosas para el mismo. En su mayoría trabajan con otras Instituciones financieras y nuestra Instrucción pero ellas muestran un antecedente crediticio bueno, además que son responsables con sus pagos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “CARITA D. ANGEL” is located in La Pampa. All the members are from the same neighborhood. They are very responsible and very organized. This is their first application. They are dedicated to working to increase their business. Rosa is the president, she is a very responsible person. She sells doors and windows. Karina is the secretary and Josefina is treasurer. All the members of the communal bank have businesses such as: selling meals, selling clothing, selling cosmetics, selling pastries, and jewelry. Specifically, the various members engage in the following activities: Rosa Gloria, as we mentioned previously, is president and has been selling doors for 8 years; Lusmila has been selling hamburger for one year; Harry has a stall selling used American clothing, which he has done for 6 years; Pura Leny has been selling silver jewelry for 1 year; Maria Elena is a seamstress, her specialty for 2 years has been sewing bedsheets; Jorge has sold bread for 2 years; Ana Consuelo has a stall selling cellular telephone chips, which she has been doing for 2 years; Irma has been selling prepared meals for 1 year; Karina has been a promoter for 1 year; Josefina has been doing carpentry for 15 years; and lastly Elsa has been selling sweets for 2 years. The members state that they have a great deal of talent, but that they get ahead in their work due to the care and dedication given by every member to see their business grow little by little. The loan will be used, in general, to increase their businesses and their business capital, and to buy more things for the business. Most have worked with other financial institutions as well as ours, and they have good credit history and have repaid responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
J. Simon sells bread and tea in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to purchase crates of beer and soda to sell. Simon is 40 years old and is divorced. She has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to live.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer and soda to sell

loans.name: Sovannary's Group

texts.en: Six people are made a group loan who all live in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sovannary K. is a group leader who has been selected by all the members they will use a loan in different purpose. She is house wife and her husband, Mr. Vo Nhean, is a laborer construction. This couple has seven children, one of whom is employed in garment factory, another is a sewer, another is in mobile phone repair, and the others are attending a local public school. However this family tries to work hard, so they can earn more income. Thus, in order to improve condition family living, Mrs. Sovannary K. decided to ask for a loan to buy telephones to re-sell for starting her new business.

loans.use: To buy telephones to re-sell for starting her new business.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María del Carmen es una madre de familia de 52 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Chepito Alto, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicada a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la confección de pantalones desde hace mas de cuatro años. Ella nos comenta que se animó a empezar este negocio debido su esposo trabajaba como agricultor y los ingresos que percibía no eran permanentes. María del Carmen se contactó con un comerciante mayorista que le hace diversos pedidos de acuerdo a la campaña del año (actualmente se encuentra confeccionando pantalones escolares), el va a recoger la mercadería para luego manufacturarla y venderla en diversas zonas de la serranía del país.

Adicionalmente ella ha empezado un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, ella piensa valerse de este negocio para seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. El negocio está teniendo muy buena acogida entre sus clientes y vecinos debido a que la zona en donde vive queda alejada del pueblo y no tienen acceso a productos de consumo diario. María del Carmen desea ampliar este negocio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de abarrotes.

Ella es una mujer bastante conocida y respetada en la comunidad donde vive. Su mayor anhelo es seguir haciendo crecer su bodega para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is a 52-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the Chepito Alto settlement, a rural area in the Mórrope district of the Lambayeque province, located some 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been making pants for a living for over four years. She states that she decided to launch this business because her husband works in agriculture and does not have a steady income. María del Carmen got in touch with a wholesaler who fills special orders depending on the season (they are currently making school uniform pants). He picks up the merchandise and sells it throughout the different areas of the country's mountainous region.

She has also started her own small general store. She plans on using this business to help her family get ahead in life. This business has welcomed many customers and neighbors due to the fact that they live in a rural area that is far from town, so they do not have access to the products that they consume on a daily basis. María del Carmen would like to expand this business, which is why she needs to request a 1,000.00 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the very first time. She will invest this money in purchasing goods for her general store.

She is a well-known and respected person in her community. Her greatest wish is to keep making her general store grow so that she can continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods for in-home general store

loans.name: Salinah

texts.en:
Salinah S., 45, is married to Benjamin Ossen who is 54yrs old and an employee of Kuda (Kerio Valley Development Authority). They live in Kaptimbor Village and have four children who are aged between 7 and 27.

Salinah sells groceries in Kabarnet Market. Her clients are residents of Kabarnet. She started this business four years ago and normally makes a profit of Kshs 4,000 per month. 

Salina was introduced to Kadet Limited by an existing client. She has a credit history with another microfinance institution. She has applied for a loan of Kshs 20,000 which she will use to purchase sugar and other goods for sale and to purchase second-hand clothes for sale. If this loan boosts her business, she will use the extra profit to open a wholesale shop. 

She hopes to open a self selection shop in future and she describes herself as hardworking

loans.use: to purchase groceries and second-hand clothes for sale

loans.name: No Mistake Group

texts.en:
Zainab K., pictured on the right, is the leader of this group called “No Mistake group”. The 38-year-old woman lives in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone, with her husband and two children. Her children attend primary school. Zainab has been a businesswoman for many years now. She sells groundnuts/peanuts. 

Zainab has requested a loan of SLL 500,000 from Kiva field partner SMT, in order to expand her business by buying bags of groundnuts to add to her stock. This is the first loan members of the “No Mistake group” have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia de 59 años, vive en el Guasmo (es parte del suburbio, habitada por comerciantes minoristas) de Guayaquil, es viuda y todos sus hijos están casados, cuando su esposo murió ella invirtió sus ahorros con arroz, azúcar y bebidas para poder sustentar su hogar. 

Poco a poco con unos cuantos víveres en su casa y vendiendo a sus conocidos ella logro readecuar su casa para construir un local en la sala de su casa, ahora ella trabaja desde las 06h30 hasta las 19h00pm todos los días en compañía de sus nietos(aparece uno en la foto). 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mesa, arroz, bebidas para su tienda. En el futuro quiere que su negocio aumente.
texts.en:
59-year old Alicia lives in Guasmo (part of the Guayaquil suburb in which small business owners live). She is a widow and all her children are married. When her husband died, she used their savings to buy rice, sugar, and drinks so she could earn enough money to live on. Over time by earning money selling these items to her acquaintances, she managed to alter her house, turning her living-room into a store. Now she works from 6:30 am to 7:00 pm every day with her grandchildren alongside (one of them appears in the photo). Alicia plans to use the loan to buy a table, rice, and drinks for the store. Her hope for the future is that her business will grow.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a table and products for her store

loans.name: Genith Deidania

texts.es:
Genith de 42 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares ella construyo en una parte de su casa un local para tener una papelería. 

Comenzó a vender cuadernos y papeles en su pequeño local, poco a poco fue incrementando su papelería y también vendiendo dulces para los niños que iban con sus padres, ahora trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta las 22:00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar caramelos, carpetas y plumas para su papelería. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su papelería y así asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Genith, age 42, lives in Primavera de Duran (an urban landscape that was originally more varied, with hills, streams and lakes that still appears as the remains of a dissolving ecology). In order to help her family with the household expenses, she built up a part of her house as a paper goods shop. She began to sell notebooks and paper in her small shop; little by little her paper store grew, and she also sold sweets for the children that came along with their parents. Now, she works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. every day. With this loan, she plans to buy candies, folders and pens for her paper shop. In the future, she wants to stock her shop more and in that way have security in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candies, folders, and pens

loans.name: Beloy

texts.en:
Beloy L. is from the village of  San Juan, Gingoog City. He is 42 and married with five school-aged children. To make a living, Beloy provides a motorcycle service to transport passengers. Beloy has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Beloy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beloy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. He is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Beloy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Nancy Cabaros Group

texts.en:
Nancy C. is from the village of Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old, married, and has one infant child. She is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nancy C. Group. 

To make a living, she owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $100 a month. 

In 2008, Nancy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle

loans.name: St. Gozanga Women's A, Mubende Group

texts.en:
N. Rose has been selling new garments from Mubende trading centre for ten years.  She also sells clothes in monthly and weekly markets in the area.

From her clothes sales, Rose earns 400,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis.  This has even inspired her to invest more into the business. Having had a dream to own a clothes business, it is for this reason that she wants to get this loan to improve her financial prospects by restocking her business with attractive materials.

By her own account, the future of her business is promising and this will see her earn more revenue as she manages to maintain her customers by doing timely shopping for them. With the loan, she wants to purchase more garments to give her business a new lease of life, which will improve her sales revenue and enable her to take care of her family.

Rose belongs to a group of members who hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase of bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita N. is from the village of Mother Katutungan, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 42 years old. Nenita is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nenita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Poderosa Luz

texts.es:
Poderosa de 52 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil. ella es vendedora de ropa y bebidas (en la foto aparece en la ventana de su casa donde vede bebidas). 

Una amiga la inscribió para que vendiera ropa por catalogo, poco a poco con la motivación de mantener a su hijo comenzó a vender también bebidas para tener otro ingresos adicional, con esto se estabilizo económicamente ya que no esta casada. Trabaja en horarios rotativos en la mañana vende ropa y en el resto del dia vende las bebidas.  

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para que en un futuro pueda tener su tienda de ropa y tambien bebidas para un ingreso extra. En el futuro quiere tener un local.
texts.en:
Poderosa, who is 52, lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil. She sells clothing and beverages (in the photo, she appears in the window of her house, where she sells beverages). A friend signed her up to sell clothing through catalog sales, and little by little, with the motivation of supporting her son, she began to also sell drinks. With this activity she became economically stable even though she is not married. She splits her work day: in the morning she sells clothing, and for the rest of the day she sells beverages. With the loan, she wants to buy clothing so that in the future she can have her own shop with clothing and beverages as a source of extra income. In the future, she wants to have her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth M. is a 42 year old married mother of seven children. She runs a retail shop in Jomvu that has been in operation for two years. It is doing well.

This loan marks Elizabeth's first borrowing from KADET LTD, and she plans to purchase cereals, margarine, soaps and a variety of sweets. Her clients are the area residents, who enable her shop to reap a profit of Ksh. 15,000 a month.

She hopes to expand her business greatly in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, margarine, soaps and a variety of sweets

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza D. is a married woman who lives in Labogon, Bgry. 1, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: fish vending and food vending. Her husband, Lemuel, who is 42 years old, works as a carpenter and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have six children who are 8 to 19 years old. Liza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,500, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 14000, which she intends to use to as revolving capital for her fish-vending activities. She plans to continue to save for future home repairs and the education of her children. Liza D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund fish-vending business

loans.name: Dorethy

texts.en: Dorethy A. is married and lives together with her husband and two children. She has received junior high education. She cooks rice for sale at Abura. She helps her husband in feeding, clothing and educating her children. Dorothy will use the loan to purchase a bag of rice and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale.  She plans on using the new profit to buy a shop to be able to sell in.

loans.use: purchase a bag of rice and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia N. is 21 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda.  Scovia has a business of selling food and charcoal, which she has had for one year.  

To help expand her business, Scovia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more food and charcoal.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Scovia hopes to generate greater profits allowing her to pay school fees.  In the future, Scovia hopes to expand her business.   Scovia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to be careful with her business.

loans.use: To purchase food and charcoal.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador”, ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con dos hijos y con grado de instrucción de educación secundaria completa.
Mary Luz se dedica a la artesanía, tejido a mano de chompas, chalecos y miniaturas en general. Ella viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/.500. 00 nuevos soles, el cual le sirvió para comprar lanas para  tejer.
La señora solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 1500.00 nuevos soles, préstamo que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio. 
Su sueño  es tener una pequeña empresa de tejidos.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal es todo tipo de actividades realizadas en las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mary Luz is a member of the communal bank “San Salvador”, located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department.  She is 25, married, with two children and she completed secondary school.

Mary Luz works in arts and crafts, knitting sweaters by hand, jackets and miniatures in general.  She has been with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past two years.  Her first loan was for 500 news sols which she used to buy wool for weaving.
The lady is asking for a  loan of 1500 new sols.  This loan will allow her to increase her working capital.
Her dream is to have a small knitting business.
What she likes about the communal bank is all the different activities that take place in the meetings.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Edith Marielita

texts.es:
Edith es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo en el sector La Huaca del distrito de Olmos, una zona rural que se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y comercio.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos de consumo diario con un trato amable. Debido al tiempo que lleva en el negocio su negocio cuenta con una clientela fija y se vale de el para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a la economía diaria.

Edtih desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1300 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Edith es una mujer bastante tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Las persona que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
texts.en:
Edith is 32 and a mother who lives with her husband in La Huaca section of  Olmos district, a rural area of mostly agriculture and business.
She sells general merchandise and groceries from a store in her house.  She sells everyday products to her neighbors in a friendly manner.  Since she has had the business for a while, she has regular customers and she depends on them to help her and her husband  get ahead with their daily expenses.  Edith would like to expand her business with the purchase of more products so that she can fulfill her customers’ needs.  That is why she is requesting a loan of 1300 new soles form Edpyme Alternativa to help achieve her goal.

Edith is a calm and responsible woman and her main objective is to continue growing as an entrepreneur so that she can offer her family a better quality of life.  The people who know her show her great respect and esteem.

loans.use: To buy general merchandise and groceries to expand the products in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: B. Ruth is an individual client from Mubende. She is 44 years old and married with six children. She has had a boutique that sells clothes from Kyenda for 10 years and is able to make enough sales in a week to live on. Now she needs a loan to buy more clothes to stock for the Christmas festive season. Ruth was inspired to start her business by the demand in the area and she does not regret it.

loans.use: Buy clothes to stock for the Christmas festive season.

loans.name: Ana Karen

texts.es:
Ana Karen P. García es originaria del  poblado de Moyotepec municipio de Cd. Ayala en el estado de Morelos, México. Tiene 21 años de edad, ella concluyó la educación básica, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos se llaman Leyla de 4 años de edad esta e preescolar, Iker de un año tres meses de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo y va a utilizar su préstamo para comprar zapato para niño y niña y zapatos para dama y caballero. Inicio en los préstamos por una amiga que la invitó a invertir en un negocio a través de un préstamo. Ella inicio su negocio hace 5 meses la invito la prima de su esposo con las ventas por catalogo con las ganancias fue comprando zapatos y los pone en exhibición, Le prestan una vitrina en una farmacia de la localidad para mostrar sus productos.
Su negocio es importante por las ganancias que obtiene, que principalmente destina para comprar más mercancía y para los gastos de su casa. La parte que más le gusta de su negocio es salir cada día a ofrecer sus productos y que le encarguen pedidos de calzado. En promedio visita de cinco a ocho personas por día. Su negocio enfrenta los desafíos de las inclemencias del tiempo, sobre todo cuando llueve, además de que enfrenta la competencia de personas que también venden por catálogo en su localidad. Las ganancias de su negocio las destina en mayor parte a comprar más zapatos. Tiene como meta a corto plazo meter productos diferentes como bolsas de dama, blusas y esto lo va lograr con el préstamo primero y después con las ganancias de la invierte. Su negocio es muy importante porque le va a ayudar a sacar adelante a su familia económicamente y además de que en el futuro hacer mejoras a su vivienda como ponerle puerta a su casa, ventanas, echarle el piso de cemento y los vidrios. A ella le gustaría desarrollarse más en el campo de las ventas y crecer más profesionalmente. Con respecto al préstamo se siente contenta porque va a poder invertir más en su negocio. La señora Ana Karen quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias por apoyarnos con estos préstamos para crecer más en los negocios”.
texts.en:
Ana Karen P. García is from the town of Moyotepec, a municipality in Ciudad Ayala, Morelos state, México.  She is 21 years old and finished basic education.  She‘s married and has two children: Leyla, 4, who is in preschool and Iker, who is a year and 3 months old.  Her business is catalogue based shoe sales for boys, girls, women and men.  She will use the loan to buy shoes for boys, girls, women and men.  A friend of hers invited her to join the loans to invest in a business through the loans.  She started the business five months ago.  Her husband’s cousin invited her to join the catalogue shoe sales.  She has used profits to buy shoes to display.  They lend her a display case in a local pharmacy to display her products.

Her business is important thanks to the profits it earns which she used primarily to buy more merchandise and to meet household expenses.  The part she likes best about her business is going out daily to offer her products and receive orders for footwear.  On average, she sees between 5-8 customers daily.  Her business faces challenges like the inclemency of the weather, especially when it rains besides facing competition from people in her community who are also into catalogue sales.

She uses profits from the business primarily to reinvest in more shoes.  Her short term goal is to add other items to her inventory like ladies’ purses and blouses.  She hopes to accomplish this first with the loan and then with profits from the investment.

Her business is very important to her because it will help her support her family economically as well as make improvements to her house in the future like installing a door, window frames, cement flooring and glass windows.

She would like to develop further in sales and grow professionally.  With respect to the loan, she feels happy because she will be able to invest more in her business.  Ana Karen would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “Thanks for supporting us with these loans so that we can grow more in our businesses.”

loans.use: To buy shoes for boys, girls and women.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter, and they live in Abura. Esi uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Esi sells Fante kenkey [kenkey is a fermented maize dough. The Fante people typically sell their kenkey wrapped in banana leaves]. The loan she is requesting will be used to expand her kenkey business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to educate her children.

In the photo, Esi’s hand is holding a sample of Fante kenkey. The pot on the ground in front of her is full of the maize she uses for the production of kenkey.

loans.use: To expand her kenkey business

loans.name: Lucero Liliana

texts.es:
Lucero es una madre de familia, tiene de 34 años de edad, reside junto familia en el caserío  sector Vallecito el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, ella los cría en el corral de su domicilio. Ella se encarga de alimentarlos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

Lucero desea ampliar negocio con la compra de más animales de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y seguir incrementando sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Ella es una persona  y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Lucero is a 34 year old mother.  She lives with her family in the rural community of Vallecito.  It is an agricultural district in Tambogrande, which is in the Piura region.  It is over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She raises sheep in a pen at her house.  She takes care of feeding them.   When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them to the general public and to the businessmen who usually visit the area.  With the income from this business activity she helps to financially support her family.

Lucero wishes to expand her business by purchasing more animals.  That way she will be able to satisfy her customer demand and continue to increase her sales.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan of 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativea.

She is a person with a great desire to get ahead.

loans.use: To get animals in order to increase her sales

loans.name: Lazar's Group

texts.en:
Lazar is a hardworking lady and operates a dairy business at her home. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. For this purpose, she has a buffalo at her home. Her clients trust her for her good quality milk  They give her a good number of orders, which helps her to earn a good profit. 
She is 35 years old, married to J. B., and has 4 children.  All of the children are enrolled in a nearby school and getting their education. 
Her husband started an animal sales business 5 years ago. He buys animals at an early age, raises them, and sells to butchers for a profit. 
Lazar has applied for a loan from Kiva partner,  Asasah, to help her husband in expanding his business. With the loan, he will buy goats to sell at a good profit.  
Lazar is very confident that, after the loan investment, her husband’s business will grow further and make him more profits than before. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah.  This is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: To buy animals (goats) for animal sales business

loans.name: Amparo Del Carmen

texts.es:
Amparo madre soltera, sus hijos ya son mayores de edad y le ayudan con los gastos del hogar, ella vela por que sus hijos salgan adelante. Mujer trabajadora, responsable y honesta inicio su propio negocio de ventas por catálogos y encargos fue con ahorros propios por tal compro pequeñas cantidades y poco variedad.  Por falta de financiamientos no invertía más en su negocio siendo unas de las dificultades. Sus planes son aumentar su inventarios e incrementar sus venta mediante la compra de mayores cantidades y ingresar otros productos, con el préstamo comprara: bisutería, perfumes de dama, caballero y niños, también blusas, pantalones, talco, cremas, entre otras mercadería.
Agradece a la financiera por la oportunidad de ingresar en el mundo del crédito obteniendo ganancias para ser invertido.
texts.en:
Amparo is a single mother although her children are grown and they help her with the household expenses. She prays that her children will find success. She is a hardworking woman, responsible and honest. She started her own business with her own savings selling by catalogue and taking orders. She was only able to buy in small quantities and in limited variety. Her plan is to increase her sales through the purchase of greater quantities of products and to introduce new products, including pants, talc, skin creams, and other merchandise.

She is thankful to the financial organization for the opportunity to take part in the world of personal credit in order to obtain earnings to reinvest.

loans.use: to purchase personal care products for resale

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en: Nemia is a married woman who lives in Victorias, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fishing/fish vending business. Her husband Rodolfo, who is 53 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living.  They have four children who are 23 to 29 years old. Nemia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nemia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 to purchase a fishing net so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family and to expand her fishing activities. Nemia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net

loans.name: God Bless Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “God Bless” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs seeking a loan of SLL 500,000.00 each to invest in their business. 

Aminata K. is the leader of this group. Aminata is 36 years old, and married with two children who both attend primary school. Aminata sells slippers, rubber bowls, dishes, and other items. She has been running this business for fifteen years. With the help of this loan, Aminata will buy items in bulk in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy slippers, rubber bowls, dishes, and other items in bulk

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive en compañía de su esposa y tres hijos de 10, 9 y 7 años de edad, él trabaja desde hace 15 años en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, aprendió con su padre todo el proceso de la agricultura.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes agrícolas, este préstamo le ayudara a que cuente con lo necesario para realizar las labores agrícolas y pueda realizar la siembra de este año, sus riesgos son la intensidad del invierno que puede afectar el crecimiento del maíz. 
Él quiere sacar adelante a su familia, educarlos y puedan tener una carrera universitaria con la cual puedan defenderse en el futuro.
texts.en:
José lives in San Rafael Oriente, in the San Miguel department, with his wife and three children ages 10, 9 and 7. He has worked for 15 years in the cultivation of corn and beans. He learned the entire agricultural process from his father.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of manure and agricultural fertilizers. This loan will help him to have everything necessary for agricultural labour and to sow this season. The intensity of winter poses a risk that could affect his corn crop.

He wants to get his family ahead and educate them so that they can have a university career with which to provide for themselves in the future.

loans.use: to purchase manure and agricultural fertilizers.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 48 años y es madre D. familia D. tres niños que tiene a cargo en su pequeño hogar, ubicado en la zona urbana D. La Victoria, distrito D. la provincia D. Chiclayo. 

DesD. hace 5 años el patio trasero D. la casa D. Norma se ha convertido en un corral, donD. Norma se dedica a criar patos y pequines (raza D. patos) para comercializarlos.

Norma desea ampliar su negocio con la compra D. más patos para criar y así  darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos y esto lo conseguirá  expandiendo sus ventas  hacia mercados mayoristas y  restaurantes. Es por ello que solicita un préstamo D.  500 nuevos soles  a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Norma, 48, is a mother of three children that she cares for in her small house located in the La Victoria urban zone, a district in Chiclayo Province.

Since about five years ago Norma’s back yard has become a corral where Norma raises ducks and “Pequines” (a breed of ducks) to sell.

Norma wants to expand the business with the purchase of more ducks to raise in order to proviD. her children with improved quality of life.  She will attain this expanding her sales into wholesale markets and restaurants.  Because of this she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy more ducks to raise.

loans.name: Alvaro Eliecer

texts.es: Álvaro Eliecer, tiene la edad de 46 años, está casado  y vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposa que son sus prioridades. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos necesarios para la  asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con la propiedad y la experiencia en este cultivo y lo que hará es asistirlo para así en la próxima cosecha que está por venir tener un alza en la producción y en la calidad. El lo que pretende es generar ganancias para seguir adelante con su café y también así ofrecerles a sus hijos y su esposa una mejor calidad de vida en el futuro. Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Álvaro Eliecer is 46 married and lives with his 4 children and wife. With this credit, he plans to buy fertilizer and other products to care for his coffee plantation. He has both the property and the necessary experience in raising coffee, and will use the needed products to increase his crop yield.  With better profits, he hopes to provide for his family's needs and assure a better quality of life in the future.  This is the second credit Alvaro has received from FUDECOSUR. Rather than seek credit from state-owned banks, he feels that FUDECOSUR offers him better terms of credit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee plantation

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 18 years old and lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children. Annet has a salon business, which she has run for five years.
To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hair braids for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Annet hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to build a house of her own.
Annet is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hair braids for resale.

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married with an 18-year-old daughter. Yuliya lives in Energodar and sells seeds, agricultural chemicals and other farming products in the central market of her hom town. She owns a big vending location and is an experienced vendor who offers a reasonable pricing policy to her customers. She has learned many tricks of her trade in the past eight years.

Currently, Yuliya has already invested 80,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her turnover amounts to 30,000 Grivnyas. Net profit is about 8,000 Grivnyas a month. Yuliya has big potential and is full of business ideas and projects. She is hoping to generate sufficient income to reinvest it in further expansion of the range of items she offers for sale, e.g., irrigation units and sprayers.

Yuliya is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to purchase fertilizers, seeds and sprayers. She can quickly respond to different new trends in her business which, in addition to high demand on these types of products, has benefited her venture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and sprayers.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok is married to Mr. Sun, 53, who works as a military policeman in the Ministry of the Interior in Battambang Province. They are blessed with four children, all of whom are still attending public school. 

Mrs. Sok, 42, is a fresh fish seller.  She has been selling fresh fish in the local busy market for five years. She sells fish that she gets from her wholesale supplier and from fishermen. 

Mrs. Sok is running her fish business well, as she has skills in communication which she uses with her customers. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Mrs. Sok is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell.

loans.use: buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Alpha Group

texts.en: Mavis, 43, is a widow with three children aged between 15 and 24, one of whom attends school. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Mandini in South Africa. In the photo, she is pictured raising her hand. She has been in this business for three years, selling red meet and spices. She also receives income from the government via a child support grant. She requested this loan from WDB and Kiva to buy red meat and chicken heads and feet. Mavis says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house for her family and to send her child to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy red meat and chicken heads and feet for resale.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.en:
Fernando is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 1 child. 

Fernando has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages, snacks & rice per kilogram. He has had this business for 5 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & rice.

Fernando is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & rice.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es:
Cirilo, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, es casado, administra una tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, este negocio surgió por iniciativa de él, no tiene horario fijo atiende el negocio de tiempo completo.
El está solicitando un préstamo el cual le ayudara en la compra de granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, sal, azucar, jabón, refrescos y más mercadería que es demandada por sus clientes, esta compra le permitirá ampliar su negocio y tener más mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos se casen y ampliar su negocio, para mejorar las ganancias.
texts.en:
Cirilo lives with his wife and two children.  He is married, and runs a shop  that provides every day items.  This business came about on his initiative.  He has no fixed schedule, and serves in the business full time.

He is requesting a loan which will help in the purchase of basic grains, rice, beans, salt, sugar, soap, soft drinks and other merchandise that is in demand by his customers. This acquisition will allow him to expand his business and have more merchandise to offer his customers.

His biggest dream is that his children marry, and that he expands his business to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, salt, sugar, soap for his business.

loans.name: 3.9.71 Thiệu Hóa Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phúc works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

Phúc is 60 years old and she is married with two children. Phúc is the group leader of the 3.9.71 Thiệu Hóa  solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

This is Phúc's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Phúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phúc faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts.

 Phúc hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her children to find a good job, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby  cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients to make chocolate.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through senior high school.

Esi sells charcoal at Abura and has done so for 4 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in taking care of the home. Esi will use the loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Esi plans to plow back her new increase in income.

loans.use: to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She operates a restaurant at the market on a retail basis. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy serving plates, rice, maize flour and bunches of bananas. Her major challenge includes the ever increasing prices of foodstuffs and transportation. 

Mary's goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked restaurant, to build rental houses and also build her own restaurant. She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy bananas, rice, serving plates and maize flour

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.  Rebecca has been in this business for four years.  Rebecca also earns income from motorcycle transport.  Rebecca has been sustaining her business activities with the help of the loans from NWTF.  Her dream is to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Renefe

texts.en:
Renefe is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with one child. 

Renefe has a shop that sells clothing like shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of clothing like shirts & blouses. 

Renefe has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Renefe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing like shirts & blouses

loans.name: Kulziya

texts.en:
Kulzya is a widowed woman who lives with her three children in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. Her eldest son is an entrepreneur and the younger two are college students. 

She started her craft business in 2000 by making small accessories like purses, wallets, and small bags. 

In recent years, the tourists are increasing therefore her demand for her products is increasing. She is a sharp and diligent woman who says "I will not rest until my kids get educated". She is requesting 800,000 to buy more materials.

loans.use: To purchase more materials

loans.name: Charlo

texts.en:
Charlo is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Charlo is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy tools for maintenance and pay for the gasoline.

Charlo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Charlo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance and pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Juan Benito

texts.es:
Don Juan, de 54 años de edad, originario de San Juan de Limay municipio de Estelí, de oficio comerciante, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad ambos están estudiando. 
El se dedica a la compra, venta y almacenamiento de granos básicos como el maíz y frijol, lleva 15 años dedicándose a esta actividad ya que en su experiencia anterior fue como jefe de brigadas de enfermedades transmisibles por mosquitos pero vio quela comercialización de granos básicos se le ganaba mejor y se dedico a vender y almacenar maíz y frijoles.
El requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos. Ya que el crédito le brindara la oportunidad de poder adquirir granos básicos al por mayor y a buen precio para comercializar fue de Estelí e ir a comarcas fuera de su pueblo que necesitan abastecerse de este producto. Entre sus expectativas primordiales esta los estudios de sus hijos, cancelar su crédito, incorporar la venta de sorgo que un producto que se vender y poder comprar un vehículo para transportar su producto.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 54 years old and originally from San Juan de Limay in the town of Estelí. He is married and has two children, ages 18 and 15, who are both studying. Juan is a merchant who buys, sells, and stores dry goods such as corn and beans. He has been in business for 15 years. His previous job involved directing public health teams that prevented communicable diseases transmitted by mosquitoes. Juan discovered that he could make a better living by selling dry goods, so he decided to sell and store corn and beans.

He is requesting a loan to buy dry goods. The loan that will be granted to him will provide the opportunity to acquire products in bulk and at a good price. He will sell his products in Estelí and in the regions outside of the city that are in need of these items. His main expectations are to provide for his children’s education, repay his loan, add sorghum to his inventory of products to sell, and buy a vehicle for transporting his goods.

loans.use: to buy dry goods (corn and beans).

loans.name: Victor

texts.ru:
Виктор женат, у него взрослые сыновья. Виктор живет и работает в Приветном. Он, как и многие его односельчане, занимается выращиванием ранних сельхозкультур: кабачков, помидор, перца, капусты и баклажанов. На 144 сотках Виктор выращивает 10 000 кустов помидор, 7 000 кабачков, 15 000 перца, 12 000 капусты и 12 000 баклажанов. Выращиванием овощей Виктор занимается уже 21 год. На данный момент в хозяйство уже вложено 160 000 гривен.  

Виктор планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 20 000 гривен в закупку удобрений, пленки, семян и химикатов для следующего сельскохозяйственного сезона. Виктор надеется удовлетворить спрос покупателей, эффективно реализовав свою продукцию и получив дополнительный доход от реализации овощей. Виктор планирует и в дальнейшем развивать свое дело, так как это не только дает ему возможность содержать семью, но и приносит массу удовольствия.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Victor is married and has grown-up sons. Victor lives and works in Privetnoye. He, like many of his fellow villagers, grows early crops such as zucchini, tomatoes, peppers, cabbage and eggplant. On the 144 acres Victor grows 10,000 tomato bushes, 7,000 zucchini, 15,000 peppers, 12,000 cabbages and 12,000 eggplants. Victor has been growing vegetables for 21 years. At this point he has 160,000 hryvna invested in his business.

Victor plans to invest the 20,000 hryvna Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, film, chemicals and seeds for the next agricultural season. Victor hopes to meet the demand of buyers, effectively sell his products and generate additional revenue from the sale of vegetables. He plans to further develop his business as it not only allows him to support his family, but also gives his enormous gratification.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, film, seeds, and chemicals for the upcoming agricultural season.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie  is 44 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is  single and  has seven children from 4 to 27 years old. Two are in school and live at home, while the oldest ones are in school and living on their own.

For the past thirty-two years, she has been selling red oil (palm oil)  in the market,  She enjoys the independence her income gives her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil (palm oil) for her business. Her plan is to build a house for herself and her children.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil (palm oil) for her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa nació en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo (Sitio arqueológico incaico, capital del Distrito de Ollantaytambo (Provincia de Urubamba), situado al sur del Perú, a unos 90 km al noroeste de la ciudad del Cuzco.). 

Elsa tiene 71 años edad y es soltera, ella es jubilada y trabaja brindando servicio de hospedaje y alimentación a extranjeros que viene  al Perú para hacer voluntariado. Ya son varios años que brinda el servicio y le va muy bien.  Elsa también ayuda a su sobrina que tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de comida a pedido del cliente. En esta oportunidad Elsa requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de la casa y para comprar cosas que faltan como por ejemplo toallas y otras cosas más. . 

Elsa es integrante del grupo “Siempre Adelante” lo conforman 12 socios que viven en la ciudad de Ollantaytambo y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
Elsa was born in the city of Ollantaytambo ( an archeological Inca site, capital of the Ollantaytambo district (Urubamba province), located in the southern part of Peru, about 90km northeast of the city of Cuzco).

Elsa is 71 years old and single.  She is retired and works at providing lodging for foreigners that come to Peru to volunteer.  She has been providing this service for various years and is doing well.  She also helps her niece who has a small business of selling food made to order.  At this time, Elsa needs the loan to be able to do maintenance on her house and buy items that she needs such as towels and other items.

She is a member of the "Siempre Adelante" (Always Ahead) group, which is made up of 12 members that live in the city of Ollantaytambo and perform their financial activities there.

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house and purchase supplies.

loans.name: Maria Andrea

texts.es:
Doña Maria continua trabajando como conserje, dando el apoyo a sus hijos es los estudios, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo economico de su ex esposo, para ella, no es facil ya que todo esta altos costos, pero sigue trabajando para poder cubrir sus necesidades.
Es atraves del financiamiento que hara mejoras a su casa, comenzando un cuarto, el cual solo tiene el aranque y desea levantar de concreto, en la parte de alado de su terreno. Para esto comprara materiales de construccion y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
María continues working as a caretaker supporting her children’s schooling since she gets no support from her ex-husband.  For her, it’s not easy because everything is so expensive but she continues working to be able to cover her needs.

Through the loan she’ll do some home improvement starting with a room which currently has only started; she wants to erect concrete on the side of her lot and to do so will buy building materials and supplies and start the project.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Uman

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 36-year-old Uman from Masuba, Northern area, in Sierra Leone. He is married with one child aged 3 years. He started this business to improve his standard of living. 

Uman runs a general stock business. He sells soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 2000.
