He works at the business 12 hours per day and six days per week. Uman says that the main challenge to his is business is slow sales during Ramadan month.

Uman has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes. The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful businessman and improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap and cigarettes.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en: Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging Riaz  to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan. Riaz  is 46 years old married woman and a mother of 6 children. In order to support her husband( also shown in the photo) in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: María Agustina

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Agustina started selling cosmetics to have an income as she was widowed 16 years ago. She also provides house cleaning and little by little, with her efforts as her foundation, she started increasing her cosmetic sales. Her strongest motivation has been the great love she feels for her four children. Despite the difficult times she face when her husband passed away, she aged to keep going and fought for the sake of her family.

Now Maria Agustina requires a loan of $475 that she will use to purchase a display cabinet for her products. You can become a fundamental part of her effots and those of her family. Do not hesitate, remember that they need you and they thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. María Agustina empezó a vender cosméticos por la necesidad de tener un ingreso ya que enviudó hace 16 años. Ella también se dedica a hacer limpieza en casas particulares y poco a poco con base a su esfuerzo ha logrado incrementar sus ingresos con su venta de cosméticos. El principal impulso de ella ha sido el gran amor que le tiene a sus cuatro hijos. A pesar de los difíciles momentos que enfrentó cuando su esposo falleció ella supo seguir y luchar por su familia.

Ahora María Agustina requiere de un préstamo de $ 475 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de una vidriera de exhibición para la presentación de sus productos. Tú puedes convertirte en parte fundamental de los logros de ella y su familia, no lo sudes más, recuerda que ellos te necesitan y te lo agradecen.

loans.use: purchase cabinet

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Angela would like to buy 7 young steers for her new business

loans.name: Jafar

texts.en: Jafar is an IDP from Agdam district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He is married and has three children. He started his business in 1995, and borrowed three Normicro loans from Baku branch  totaling $700. Now he would like to borrow  an additional $500.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 36 years old has a small bakery in the Kirkuk market. He has a big family with a poor income. He is applying to get $1200 to purchase a new oven for his bakery. He wants to increase his income and develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new oven

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is 38 years old and is a mother of 2 young boys that are still in school. When she realized that her husband's income as a taxi driver was not covering the basic necessities of her home, she decided to support him, and started to prepare and sell ice cream. In order to excel in this endeavor, she repurposed a space in her humble home and at first only catered to her neighbors using a small wheelbarrow that her husband built for her business. Today, after having dedicated endless hours of work and much effort, she has obtained a small ice cream cart. The small business she has built has also allowed her to offer employment to three young people in her city.

Her hopes are to better the quality and variety of the products she offers, with the purpose of increasing customer preference and satisfaction. In order to fulfill this goal, she is asking for a loan of $500 that she will use to acquire a freezer to preserve the quality and taste of her delicious ice cream. Lets contribute to this young woman's effort.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva volunteer.

Elena tiene 38 años de edad y es madre de 2 pequeños niños que se encuentran aún en etapa escolar, al observar que el ingreso económico que obtenía su esposo con su labor de mototaxista no cubría las necesidades básicas de su hogar, decidió apoyarlo e inició su incursión en la preparación y venta de helados, para el buen desempeño de su actividad habilitó un espacio de su humilde morada y en principio sólo los ofrecía a sus vecinos en una carretita que elaboró su esposo para este trabajo. Ahora, después de haberle dedicado interminables horas de trabajo y esfuerzo ya cuenta con una pequeña distribuidora de helados; con esta microempresa que consolidó también puede ofrecerle empleo a tres jóvenes de su ciudad. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad y variedad de los productos que ofrece con el propósito de incrementar la preferencia y satisfacción de sus clientes y para llevar a cabo este proyecto esta solicitando un préstamo de 500 dólares, dinero que utilizará para adquirir una congeladora donde podrá preservar la calidad y sabor de sus deliciosos helados.Colaboremos con el propósito de esta joven madre.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Lilia Merlinda

texts.es:
Mrs. Lilia is twenty-nine years old and has completed her primary education. She has no children, lives in Caserío Canchachugo, a town in the Usquil district of the department of La Libertad, and is a member of the communal bank, “Canchachugo.” Mrs. Lilia runs her business out of her home where she sells groceries, drinks, motor oil, grains, and so on, but she also travels to sell her products at nearby markets. She began her business with an initial credit of S/.300 ( approx. $100) that she obtained in her communal bank. With this loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.2,000.00, which will be paid back in four months, she will purchase rice, sugar, preserves, candles, and more to stock her store, and also grains wholesale to sell in markets. Mrs. Lilia dreams of going to live on the coast of Trujillo and opening a large business there, where there are more opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Lilia tiene 29 años, su grado de instrucción es primaria completa, aún no tiene hijos; ella vive en el Caserío Canchachugo en el Distrito de Usquil departamento de La Libertad, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Canchachugo”. La señora Lilia tiene su negocio en su propia casa vende abarrotes, lubricantes para motos, bebidas, cereales, etc, pero además viaja a vender sus productos en las ferias cercanas a su comunidad. Ella inició su negocio con su primer crédito de S/. 300 ($ 100) que obtuvo en su bancos comunal. Con el reciente crédito recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000.00 ($ 664) el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, compró arroz, azúcar, conservas, velas, etc. Para surtir su bodega y además compró cereales al por mayor para llevar a vender en las ferias. La señora Lilia sueño con ir a vivir en la costa (Trujillo) y poner allí un gran negocio considera que en esa ciudad se tiene mayores oportunidades.

loans.use: Purchase highly needed goods, including preserves, wholesale grains, and other groceries.

loans.name: Malae Tiumalu

texts.en: Malae is 53 years old and married with 8 children. Every week, she works on the plantation and sells her taro pancakes. She is a very hardworking mother, which she believes is the key to long life. Through years of hard work, she managed to start with her pancake business and to be able to sell every day from her home. She is earning good money and is developing some of the things in her home. She is very thankful for SPBD's support which allows her to develop her business and support her family.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancake business and plantation

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru:
Abdusalom V., 20, is single and has no children. He sells winter clothing and sweaters for men at one of the central markets of Qurgan-Tube, Tajikistan. Abdusalom has been in this business for 2 years. He plans to use this loan to purchase an inventory of winter clothing. Local residents would then be able to purchase warm clothing from Abdusalom without the need to travel 100 km to the nearest clothing market. Abdusalom plans to repay this loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вахобов Абдусалом, возраст – 20 лет, образование среднее, неженат, детей не имеет. Абдусалом занимается торговлей на одном из центральных рынков города Курган-Тюбе. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. В настоящее время основным его товаром являются мужские зимние вещи, а именно мужские свитера. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать для увелечение товарооборота, а именно приобретение нового товара и увелечение ассортимента продаваемого зимнего товара. Данный кредит даст возможность жителям города Курган-Тюбе и прилегающим к нему районам приобретать необходимые им зимние вещи, так как близлежащий вещевой рынок находится на расстояние 100 км. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase sales volume

loans.name: Lukoto East E Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Scovia G.. She is currently in the business of charcoal selling and is requesting a loan to construct a charcoal store and increase stock. Scovia is 25 years old and is married to her husband who is a commercial motorcyclist. She has 3 children ranging from age 9 to 15 and her children go to school. Each week, Scovia makes approximately UGX 18000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost her business. Scovia has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Scovia is joined in her small group by Jesca N. and Mariam N.. Jesca N. has a business selling vegetables and wants to add more working capital. Mariam N. is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to purchase more hotel equipment like food, furniture and soft drinks.

loans.use: To expand charcoal business and make more profits

loans.name: Sanobarhon

texts.ru:
Sanobarhon A.lives in the village of Bohtar. She is 54, married, and has 2 children. Sanobarhon A.is a house wife and she maintains a small cattle farm. Sanobarhon A.plans to use this loan to purchase a milk cow to sell milk and thus improve her family’s financial standing. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдукодирова Санобархон проживает в районе Бохтар. Возраст 54 года. Замужем , имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка. имеет небольшое хозяйство, где имеются бычки. Хочет приобрести дойную корову ,для того чтобы получаемое молоко продавать и улучшить финансовое положение в семье.Кроме того у населения всегда пользуется спросом молочная продукция , поэтому продавать молоко всегда выгодно. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Jafari

texts.en: Jafari S. is thirty-five years old, a father of two, and a resident of Mbagala. He has been in business for the past six years. Jafari owns a welding and fabrication workshop. He welds door and window frames and other special items. He also runs a grocery store. He is in need of a loan to help expand him both his businesses.

loans.use: To expand his welding shop and grocery store

loans.name: Mansata

texts.en: Mansata Baldé resides in Velingara, Senegal.  She is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children and 5 nieces and nephews under her care.  She has been a member of Centre II village bank for 3 years.  She is requesting a loan to purchase "Thioub" fabric in Senegal which she plans to export in the region.  This loan is for a duration of 6 months and will be repaid with a single, bulk payment at the end of 6 months.

loans.use: To buy special tinted fabric for resale.

loans.name: Vu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Vu Thi D. is 47 years old. Before, she and her husband took building materials to other areas to sell. However, this activity required them to be away from home, making it difficult to take care of their children who were still going to school. In 2005, she joined the TYM Fund. She sold her boat and combined the profit with the borrowed money to sell coals to local people. Because of her experience in selling building materials, she uses the borrowed money effectively. Every day, Mrs. D. and her husband buy coals from wholesale people, then sell it to local people. Her income from this activity is approximately 200 USD/ month. She wants to borrow 550 USD to invest more in her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Duyên năm nay 47 tuổi. Trước đây hai vợ chồng chị làm nghề chở vật liệu bán nhưng công việc này luôn phải đi xa nhà dài ngày ảnh hưởng đến công việc chăm sóc, dạy dỗ con cái đang tuổi đi học. Năm 2005 chị tham gia vào quỹ Tình thương, chị đã bàn bạc với chồng bán thuyền và vay thêm vốn của Quỹ để buôn than phục vụ nhân dân. Do đã có nhiều kinh nghiệm trong công việc buôn bán vật liệu xây dựng trước đây nên gia đình chị đã sử dụng vốn rất hiệu quả. Hàng ngày anh chị thu mua than từ các thuyền sau dó bán lại cho nhân dân . Thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán than của gia đình chị đạt 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Trong thời gian tới gia đình chị muốn có thêm vốn để đầu tư vào công việc buôn bán than vì vậy anh chị đã bàn bạc và quyết định vay mức vốn 9 triệu đồng.

loans.use: coal business

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia baji is the wife of Z. A., a daily wage laborer, and has lived in Raiwind, Pakistan for the last 25 years. The mother of three sons, Razia baji has a milk business. She successfully completed three previous loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) and is now applying for a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by four other members: Irshad baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business; Najma baji wants to buy more material for her grocery shop; Haleem baji wants to repair her auto-rickshaw (local three-wheeled vehicle), while Bashiran baji wants a loan to purchase animals to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans, so that if one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Bùi Thị Tâm 39 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2004 trước đây chủ yếu gia đình chị làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, cá nhưng phát triển chậm. Để tăng thu nhập gia đình đã quyết định thuê địa điểm buôn bán kinh doanh thu gom phế liệu  hiện nay đang làm ăn tốt. Số vốn vay lần đầu gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi kết quả cho thu nhập tuy nhiên là không cao. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán kinh doanh thu mua phế liệu. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị diễn ra thuận lợi. Thu nhập bình quân 200.000đ/ ngày . Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào kinh doanh thu mua phế liệu.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bui Thi T., aged 39, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2004. Back then, her family’s main source of income came from farming, breeding pigs and fishes, but they didn’t generate a lot of income. Consequentially, Mrs. T. decided to rent a place to start buying and selling wastes. Mrs. T. used the loan of the first round to invest in poultries, but she didn’t make much profit. Learning the mistake, Mrs. T. since then has invested the loans from TYM in her business, from which she earns about 200000 VND per day. The business has aided her family financially a great deal. In the next round of loan, Mrs. T. would like to ask for 9.000.000 VND ($550) to expand her business. Her family’s monthly income is about 6.000.000 VND.


Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary M. sells fish, which she buys from the fishermen. She processes them by smoking (a form of preserving the fish) and then later sends the fish to the market for sale at Elmina. Mary has received no formal education. She is a widow and has 7 dependents. Mary has been selling fish sale since 2002. She is responsible for paying for food, utility bills and her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to meet the demand of her costumers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to put up a house for her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish to meet the demand of her costumers.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Hace más de 4 años, Fabian trabaja como agricultor en una hacienda, donde también vive con su familia, los dueños de esta hacienda les otorgan a sus trabajadores  una vivienda.  Junto a otras personas, pasa todo el día dedicado a la producción de los terrenos asignados, como también seleccionan los productos y los embarcan en los camiones  rumbo a la capital y diversas ciudades del país.  Sin embargo los deseos y ambiciones de Fabián es empezar su propia producción, gracias a su trabajo lograron  obtener un terreno donde cosechar, y a la par de su trabajo en la hacienda, don Fabián  con ayuda de su pareja trabajan en la producción de papa.  Ellos requieren de un préstamo para la compra de abonos y semillas, para así incrementar su producción  y poco a poco independizarse y trabajar  en sus propios terrenos, con ello aumentará las expectativas de  crecimiento y desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
For more than 4 years, Fabian has been working as a farmer on a ranch, where he lives with his family. The owners of the ranch provide their workers with housing. He, along with other people, spend all day cultivating their assigned fields, as well as picking crops and loading them on to trucks headed to the capital and to different cities in the country. Nevertheless, Fabian aspires to start his own crop business. Thanks to his work, he was able to obtain a plot of land for cultivation. In addition to his job at the ranch, Mr. Fabian, with the help of his spouse, works growing potatoes. They need a loan in order to purchase seeds and fertilizer so that they can increase production and become independent little by little. Thus, they can work their own fields, and their family’s growth and development can increase.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes

loans.name: Neng

texts.en: Mrs. Neng T. lives in Ba Khong Khang Kiet Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to make a living. A 46- year old widow, her only child helps support the family by selling chickens. Even though they both have jobs, they do not earn enough income to support themselves. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Neng T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a breeding cow. She hopes to increase their income by selling bred cows in addition to rice.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Parveen Nazir Masih Group

texts.en:
Parveen baji is a 34-year-old lady and resides in a city named Vehari, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 25 years. She has one son who is 12 years old and reads in 4th standard. Parveen baji’s husband's name is N. M., and he works in a factory. Parveen baji is involved in a livestock business. She buys animals specifically (goats and sheep) from Lahore and sells in her native city of Vehari. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more animals (goat and sheep) to expand her animal selling business. 

She is a group leader of a few more members. Safia baji wants a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread and sketches) for her decorative embroidery business. Farida baji wants a loan to buy animals (goats) for her animal selling business. Shamim baji and Suraiya baji each want a loan to buy seasonal fruits for their fruit selling businesses. Parveen baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy animals for animal selling business

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is divorced with two children. She sells various decorations at the market in Ordzhonikidze city. Her monthly gross income is 26,000 UAH, and her profit is about 3,000 UAH (1 UAH =~0.124 USD).

Nataliya has been in this business for 15 years. She enjoys selling decoration articles. She treats her clients well and always offers them a large variety of products. She has many repeat clients, which makes her business very sustainable.

Nataliya would like to receive a loan to increase her inventory. She hopes to increase her sales during the holiday season and make more money for her family. Nataliya's business goal is to open her own little store.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Khasanboy

texts.en:
Khasanboy B. lives in the B.Gafurov region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Khasanboy, from his early years, has been engaged in livestock raising; he helped his father to take care of their animals. Today Khasanboy has a livestock business where his wife and children help him. He has a milk cow and 4 sheep.

Khasanboy has special skills; he knows animals' specialities and the way of taking care of them. Khasanboy is asking KIVA for financial help: a business development loan of 4000 STJ for 10 months for purchasing pedigreed sheep. He wants to start up a serious business raising sheep to increase his business turnover and to have a big livestock farm in future.

loans.use: purchasing pedigreed sheep

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Alicia es socia del Banco Comunal “Ciudad Blanca” centro poblado de Chijichaya, distrito de Ilave, Provincia Del Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 30 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 01 hijo y posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Ella es socia nueva del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su negocio es la transformación de la papa en tunta; para lo cual requiere un préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que se compromete a pagar en 3 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir materia prima (papas) para trasformarlo en tunta y venderlo en las ferias de Puno y Arequipa. 
Ella agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the community bank "Ciudad Blanca" in Chijichaya, district of Ilave, in the province of Del Collao, department of Puno. She is 30 years old, married, and has one son. She completed elementary school. She is a new member of Movimiento Manuela Ramos; she dehydrates potatoes. She needs a loan of 500 soles which she will repay in three months. She will use the loan to buy raw materials - potatoes - and transform them into "tunta" [dehydrated potato] and sell them at the markets of Puno and Arequipa. She thanks Movimiento Manuela Ramos for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes to dehydrate and then sell at market

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Mary S. from Mwanza. She is married with two children between the ages of 1 and 9 years old. Mary S. has been running a beauty salon since 1999. Her business is Beauty Salon, a place where you can buy hair extensions in different styles--long, short, curly, straight, red, blue--and have it woven, cut, or braided. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Mary currently earns about 200USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to purchase weaving tools, long hair extensions, clothes, and shoes. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Mary thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase weaving tools, long hair extensions, clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Tenning

texts.fr: Madame Tenning  D. est une vendeuse ambulent de bissap et du mil ; elle habite à Bambey dans la région de Diourbel ; elle est mariée et a 6 ans d’expérience sur le métier. Avec ce prêt elle veut renforcer son activité  surtout pour le bissap qu’elle compte revendre à Dakar la ville capital. Et elle soutient beaucoup son mari  qui n’a pas de moyen avec les revenues qu’elle gagne sur son petit commerce .
texts.en:
Ms. Tenning D. is an itinerant vendor of bissap (dried hibiscus flowers) and millet. She lives in Bambey, in the Diourbel region. She is married and has six years of experience in this trade. With this loan, she wants to bolster her business, especially in bissap, which she plans to resell in Dakar, the capital city. And she does a lot to support her husband, who lacks funds, through the revenues she earns from her little business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To bolster her business

loans.name: Galina

texts.en: Galina owns a grocery store in the city of Chisinau. Her store carries a lot of food items, such as milk, meat, grain, sweets, vegetables, fruit, and many other products needed daily for human nutrition. There are no other stores in the region, so business goes quite well. Galina has borrowed a loan from Microinvest to supplement the stock of goods, and needs an additional loan to continue to expand.

loans.use: To increase the stock of grocery-store goods.

loans.name: Muhammad Qasam Group

texts.en:
Muhammad Qasam is the leader of the Muhammad Qasam group. There are two members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan to expand their businesses. Muhammad Qasam wants to take a loan for his general store. Pare Gul wants to take a loan for her husband's general store.

They want to take a loan for 28000 Afghanis for the term of eight months. They are very happy to have this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand his general store.

loans.name: Silvia Melany

texts.es: Silvia Melany A. D. A. resiD. en Zaragoza departamento D. La libertad, vive junto a sus dos hijos y su esposo el cual trabaja como carpintero desD. ya hace siete años. Ella posee una venta D. verduras en las calles D. Zaragoza, su negocio se encuentra en un lugar muy estratégico ya que mucha gente transita por el lugar. Silvia solicita un préstamo para que D. esta manera obtenga el dinero necesario para comprar más verduras y así poder mejorar sus ventas y al mismo tiempo su condición económica ya que gran parte D. los gastos del hogar se suplen gracias a las ganancias D. dicho negocio.
texts.en:
Silvia Melany A. D. A. lives in Zaragoza, La Libertad. She lives together with her two children and her husband, a carpenter with 7 years' experience. She sells vegetables in the streets of Zaragoza. Her stand is located in a very strategic place having many people come through there. Silvia requests a loan to obtain more vegetables and to improve her sales. She will enhance her financial status because a large part of the household expenses are covered thanks to her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Samaddin

texts.en:
Samaddin A. is a hardworking business owner from Agsu, Azerbaijan, who has a business selling men’s clothes. He has been running his business already for eighteen years and has gained much experience. Samaddin is married and has two sons. His business has become the main source of income for his family.

Samaddin has requested a loan of $1,500 to add to his working capital. His business is growing and the financial assistance will help him to continue operating successfully and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal clothes to sell

loans.name: Equator Mutabazi Jane Group

texts.en: M. Jane is a married businesswoman, age 48, blessed with eight children in school and looking after three more children going to school. She has been rearing poultry for two months. She is using this loan to purchase chicks, chicken feed, etc. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to open up a shop in Kasese town.

loans.use: To purchase chicks, chicken feed, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her shop.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La señora Gabriela vive en alquiler en la calle 4 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, convive con su pareja el cual trabaja en una imprenta; ella trabaja como ayudante de cocina y los ingresos que perciben son muy bajos por lo tanto iniciaron un negocio de venta de víveres (arroz, azucar, harina, etc.), y el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y continuar con el negocio y hacerlo mas estable.

No fue un cliente de Impro anteriormente, pero por la actividad y el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Sra. Gabriela lives in a rental property on May 4 Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí in the city of La Paz. She lives with her common law partner, who works in a print shop. Sra. Gabriela works as a kitchen assistant. Since her income is not sufficient, she decided to start a business selling food (rice, sugar, flour, etc.). The loan she is requesting will be used augment her capital and continue her business so that it remains stable. She had not worked with IMPRO previously, but her business activity and character enabled her to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food products for her retail store

loans.name: Amanda Magdalena

texts.es: Amanda Magdalena C. D. R. resiD. en el municipio D. Colon del departamento D. La Paz. Amanda vive con su esposo quien es empleado D. una fábrica y su hija Lisseth D. 7 años D. edad estudiante D. básica.  Con 35 años D. edad Amanda ya es administradora D. su propio negocio  posee una tienda ubicada en su casa con la que obtiene ganancias para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, pero Amanda como toda mujer salvadoreña emprendedora también se dedica a la venta D. productos por catalogo donD. genera ingresos extras. El destino del crédito que Amanda solicita es para surtir su negocio y así seguir ampliando con mayor variedad D. productos  para ofertar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amanda Magdalena C. D. R. lives in the Colon municipality of the department of La Paz. She lives with her husband, who works in a factory, and her 7-year-old daughter Lisseth, who attends elementary school. At 35 years of age, Amanda now has her own business. She has an in-home general store with which she earns an income to help her husband with the family expenses. However, Amanda—like all Salvadoran enterprising women—also sells products by catalog, thus earning an extra income. Amanda will use this loan to re-stock her shop and expand it with a greater variety of products to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Kuka

texts.en:
Kuka T., a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Faga, is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Kuka raises crops, mainly vegetables. Kuka has been in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month.

In 2009, Kuka (01025002-05) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Kuka is requesting for the first time a loan from SPBD. Her previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  

Kuka is now requesting a new loan of 2000 WST. This loan will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be Kuka's third loan from SPBD. Kuka plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding an agricultural business

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Kokouvi A. est un homme âgé de 40 ans, marié et père de 8 enfants. Il habite à Womé, un village situé à 12 kilomètres de Kpalimé. C’est un revendeur de café et cacao. Son activité consiste à acheter du café et cacao auprès des agriculteurs et les revendre aux exportateurs internationaux. Avec ce prêt, Kokouvi voudrait augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant beaucoup de café et cacao afin de satisfaire sa clientèle. Avec ces bénéfices, il espérait bien s’occuper de la santé et de la scolarisation  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kokouvi A. is 40 years old, married and father of eight children. He lives in Womé, a village located about 12 kilometers from Kpalimé. He sells coffee and cocoa. His business activity involves buying coffee and cocoa from farmers and reselling it to international exporters. Mr A. would like to use this loan to increase his trading capacity by purchasing large amounts of coffee and cocoa to satisfy his clientele. He hopes to use the profit to pay for health care and schooling for his children.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his trading capacity

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen C., 27, lives with her husband and young child in Takeo province, Cambodia. Her husband is a farmer who is able to make less than US$1 each day. Pen was not available for the photo and so her husband is shown instead.

Pen is a professional who decorates women’s dresses. Since 2003, she has been using beads and other materials to make flower designs on women’s clothes to earn a living and typically make US$3 each day. Decorated dresses are a kind of Khmer traditional dress and people wear them during Water Festival, P’chum Ben or Khmer New Year.

It takes around 7-10 days to complete each dress and so they are expensive. Most of the people prefer hand-made rather than machine made designs. Pen said she learned how to decorate from her mother and she has operated her business since before she was married.

To earn an additional profit, Pen has requested a loan of US$500 to raise ducks for eggs.

loans.use: To raise ducks for eggs

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is from the village of San Juan in Gingoog City. She is 42 years old, married, and has one adult-age child. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a business venture in the "services" sector. More specifically, she provides manicure and pedicure services to local community members. In addition, she operates a food vending business. Elvira has been engaged in her business ventures for over a year, and she earns approximately 1,000 PHP per month from these activities.

In 2009, Elvira joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services and to thereby improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. Notably, Elvira has already successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125) from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Elvira is now requesting another loan through HSPFI, also in the amount of 5,000 PHP ($125), which will be used to invest in expanding her businesses. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the businesses as a result of the loan to supplement the income of her family and to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City, and it reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business ventures

location.town: San Juan, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Janina De Los Angeles

texts.es: La joven Janina de 25 años de edad, es soltera y  vive junto con sus padres el cual ayuda con los gastos de luz, agua y alimentación, por pocos recursos dejo de estudiar la universidad es uno de sus anhelo el poder concluir su carrera universitaria para lograr un mejor futuro, comenzó trabajando en una bodega en un mercado el mas visitado por los Nicaragüenses por ser el mas barato y donde se encuentran todos productos. Por gracias de Dios le ofrecieron otro trabajo donde gana mejor y lleva dos años laborando ya. Ahora que tiene mas recursos económico desea construir su cuarto propio para una mejor privacidad es por eso opta por el crédito para comprar: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc y comenzar hacer el arranque para tener un inicio y poder terminarlo poco a poco que gracias al apoyo de la institución hará posible. Estoy estudiando ingles ya que es una puerta grande hablar el idioma y así poder ir escalando y poder ganar mejor y poder terminar sus estudios, a si como ayudar a sus padres a que no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Janina is 25 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She helps them pay their electricity, water and grocery bills, which leaves her with little left over for university. Janina wants very much to finish her studies and improve her future, so she started working in a market frequented by Nicaraguans, where products are cheap and plentiful. Thankfully she found a new job with better pay, and she has been working there for two years. Now that she has a better income, Janina wants to build her own room so that she can have more privacy. She needs credit for building materials like stone, sand, cement, iron and zinc. This loan will allow her to begin her project and finish it gradually. Janina says she is studying English because language opens doors that will allow her to improve her station in life, earn a better living, and help her parents so that they'll want for nothing.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials (stone, cement, sand, iron)

loans.name: Vedith

texts.es:
La señora Vedith, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Sargento Lores”, Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años y es madre de 03 hijos,  02 que aun depende de ella y está estudiando.

Vedith, se dedica a la venta de pollos a la brasa, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicada en su misma casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados, donde sus principales clientes son moradores, vecinos y amigos. Ya es muy conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad, continúa con el mismo negocio y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, realiza sus ventas a partir de las 6:30 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como pollos en javas; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida, bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vedith belongs to the Sargento Lores Communal Bank in the Morales district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 44, married, and has three children. Two are still dependent upon her and go to school. Vedith sells grilled chicken in a well equipped place, which is in her own house. She tells us that she has very good daily sales because of the delicious seasoning she gives to her prepared food. Her primary customers are residents, neighbors, and friends. She is very well known, and she is very well received. She currently continues in the same business. She is very happy with the work that she does day to day. She starts selling at 6:30 p.m. She personally takes care of her customers with her characteristic charisma. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy food preparation supplies like crates of chicken, gallons of oil, sacks of potatoes, vegetables, and also some utensils for her business to give her customers better service. She feels full of life with the desire to get ahead. She has lots of dreams and goals in her life. She is well equipped. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy crates of chicken and sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Oddo's Group

texts.en:
K. Oddo is the leader of his lending group in Kihihi. He is 38 years old and married with 4 children, all in primary school, as he takes care of his elderly parents. He has been a farmer in Kifunjo parish for 7 years and it is from this that he is able to support his family and expand his business.

Currently, Oddo has a challenge of shortage of farmland plus the diseases that attack his crops although he still wants to expand. He works hard to educate his children for a better future. Oddo needs a loan to help expand his business by buying farming equipment like hoes and 'panga's plus seeds and pesticides and others.

loans.use: Buying farming equipment like hoes, 'panga's, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Vorn S. M., 34, is a widow and lives with her four children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. To make a living, she sews and designs clothes for new and existing customers. She has been in business since 2002 and earns $4 per day.  Vorn and her family seek to improve their standard of living and want to generate a better income.  S. M. is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike for her family's transportation.  She thinks this loan will reduce public transportation expenses.  This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI.  She hopes to improve her business.  She wants her children to finish high school and build a good house for her family.

loans.use: Buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou S. est une jeune femme de 33ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle veut renforcer son capital de commerce de carburant et de denrée alimentaires. Son objectif est  de subvenir aux différents besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Aïssatou S. is a young woman, who is 33 years old and married with four children. She would like to strengthen the capital of her fuel and foodstuffs business. Her aim is to provide for diverse family needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of fuel and diverse foodstuffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothes and bags

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
Simeona B., age 59, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Danilo B., a businessman, and they are blessed with five offspring who already have families of their own. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own ornamental plant business for quite some time.

Simeona has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow 5 times from CCT’s cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her plant business.     

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business. She will use the loan funds to buy raw materials needed to produce her wares.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mr. Ros T. and his wife, Mrs. Men Meach (pictured together), were married in 1984 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Ros raises ducks at home and his wife has been selling fish and eggs for more than 20 years. He wants to buy a cow to raise so he will get extra income from selling cows when they grow big enough. 

Ros is asking for a loan of $700 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Miguel es uno de nuestros clientes mas antiguos con los que contamos en esta agencia, es una persona muy trabajadora, Vive en el Barrio Bolivia tiene casa propia y vive con su esposa y sus hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el solo mantiene el hogar por lo que tiene que trabajar duro, es una persona responsable y dinamica.

La actividad a la que se dedica es la de mototaxista  y la actividad de motosierrista, con la primera actividad hace unos tres años que trabaja y con la segunda ya viene trabajando hace unos 5 años.

El sr. Esta muy agradecido con la institución por que gracias a Emprender, el actualmente cuenta con sus herramientas de trabajo. El dinero del credito es para la compra de repuestos y arreglo de su motocicleta.
texts.en:
Miguel is a very hard-working person and one of this agency's most longstanding clients. He lives in his own house in the Bolivia neighborhood, together with his wife and his children who are of school age. He supports the household by himself, so he has to work hard. He is a responsible and dynamic person. His work is driving a moto-taxi and also operating a chain saw. He has pursued the first activity for some three years and the second for around five years. Miguel is very grateful to the institution, because thanks to Emprender, he has been able to acquire the tools he uses in his work. The funds from the loan will be used to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying spare parts and repairing his motorcycle

loans.name: Roseta

texts.en:
Roseta L. is 39 and married with 4 children (ages 5 - 16).  She is starting a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Roseta needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Roseta joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Roseta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Pro Mujer Huayocari Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “PRO- MUJER HUAYOCCARI” está representado por Soledad que es la presidente,  Celia que es la secretaria, Natalia que es la tesorera y Mauro que es el fiscal. Los socios se reúnen cada treinta días en la comunidad D. Huayocari del distrito D. Huayllbamba D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, el banco comunal se encuentra en el VII ciclo y está conformado por 12 personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

En la comunidad D. Huayocari los pobladores se dedican exclusivamente a la agricultura y ganadería, Huayocari es zona D. tierra fértil y forma parte del valle sagrado D. los Incas donD. se cultiva productos como por ejemplo maíz, zapallo, zanahoria y habas. Las actividades económicas D. algunos D. los socios es por ejemplo; venta D. verduras y maíz, venta D. hortalizas, crianza D. animales D. menores y venta D. flores. 

Aydee Florencia es casada, tiene tres hijos y su actividad principal es la venta D. hortalizas y flores y su actividad complementaria es la crianza D. animales menores, ella venD. en el mercado modelo D. la ciudad D. Urubamba las verduras. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone a su trabajo, ella requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes.  

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Pro-Mujer Huayocari” is led by Soledad who serves as president, Celia who serves as secretary, Natalia who serves as treasurer, and Mauro who serves as auditor. The members meet every thirty days at the microfinance offices of Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco. The Communal Bank is currently in its seventh loan cycle and consists of 12 hardworking and enterprising individuals who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead and proviD. their children with a better future.

In the community of Huayocari, the inhabitants engage exclusively in farming and raising livestock. Huayocari is an area that has fertile soil and is part of the Sacred Valley of the Incas where various crops are grown such as corn, squash, carrots, and beans. Some examples of the businesses the members are engaged in incluD. selling vegetables and corn, selling potted plants, raising small animals, and selling flowers.

Aydee Florencia is married and has three children. Her main business activity is selling potted plants and flowers, but she also has a siD. business selling small animals. She sells the vegetable seedlings at the market in Urubamba. Aydee Florencia has been in this business for several years and has done very well as a result of her commitment to her work. She needs a loan to increase her business capital for buying small animals, such as guinea pigs.

The members value and appreciate the loan that has been provided to them and promise to make their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en: Maria Fe is 56 years old and has four children. She is a rice farmer and her farm is situated in her town in Agusan Del Sur, Philippines. Maria Fe wants to have the best possible rice to sell. She is happy that her farm provides both food for her family and for their other needs. She wants to continue farming and hopefully increase her harvest. Maria Fe applied to Kiva partner, CEVI, and is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Marlon

texts.es: Marlon tiene 26 años, vive junto a su esposa Victoria de 25 años y su pequeña hija en su casa propia, ubicado en la ciudad de Pichanaki, además de tener un establecimiento alquilado. El ser una persona humana, hizo que Marlon estudie la especialidad de técnico de enfermería, es entonces que desde hace 6 años ayuda a los pobladores de su comunidad, trabajando en el área asistencial del puesto de salud de la localidad “Las Palmas”, paralelamente a esta actividad tiene un bazar de perfumería en el centro de su ciudad, que es atendido por una joven que contrato. Asimismo su esposa labora en la municipalidad distrital de Pichanaki.  Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es atender las emergencias que se suscitan en la zona  a cualquier hora del día y aunque no es del todo rentable le alcanza para vivir sin apuros, además con la ganancias que obtiene del bazar compensa para cubrir sus gastos, es por eso que cuanto antes espera vender CD´s y DVD´s para aumentar sus ganancias. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y está agradecido por la confianza que le dieron, además  le gusta laborar con sus compañeros de su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará diversidad de música en CD, películas en DVD para vender en su local.
texts.en:
Marlon, 26, lives with his wife, Victoria, 25, and his little daughter in his own home located in Pichanaki; he also has a rented locale. Being a humane person motivated Marlon to study nursing and for the last 6 years he has provided assistance to residents of his community working at the “Las Palmas” health center. In addition, he has a perfume sales stall downtown that an employee of his tends to. Also, his wife is employed by the city of Pichanaki. What he enjoys the most about his work is taking care of emergencies that arise in his area at all hours and, although not very profitable, it is enough for him to live care-free. Besides, his profits from sales help cover expenses. For this reason, he wants to start selling CDs and DVDs to increase profits. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he’s grateful for the trust that was placed in him. He also enjoys working with his fellow communal bank members. He will use the requested funds to buy an assortment of music CDs and movies on DVD to sell in his stand.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy music CDs and DVDs to add to his stock inventory.

loans.name: Paola

texts.es:
Paola vende en las ferias ropa de mujer y de niños; está separada de su esposos y su única fuente de ingresos es su puesto de venta.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona villa san Antonio Bajo  de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa alquilada.
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de mercadería, ropa de niños y de mujer).
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro,  con este crédito podrá aumentar su capital y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Paola sells clothes for women and children at the markets. She is separated from her husband and her only income source is her sales stand. She lives in a rented house in the zone of "Villa san Antonio Bajo" of the town of La Paz. The loan will be invested as work capital (purchase of merchandise, garments for children and women). It is the first time she requests a loan with Impro. With this loan she will be able to increase her capital and her income.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for children and women.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo R. is from the village of Talon Gingoog City. He is 42 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living Gerardo runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop where he sells food and daily use products in the local community. Gerardo has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Gerardo joined HSPFI to improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerardo successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which he used to purchase additional products to sell. He is requesting his third loan, for 11000 PHP, which he will use for the same reason. He plans to use the additional revenue to expand his business.

About HSPFI

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita A. is from the village of Gusao, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 56 years old, married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Lita owns & operates a general store. Lita has been engaged in her business for 18 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Lita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Lita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy products especially goods to sell.

location.town: Sindangan-Gusao, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del No

loans.name: Faig

texts.ru:
Faig jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Emu 42 qoda. On pereselenec iz Agdama okuppirovannaya teritoriya Karabaxa i seychas jivet v Baku. Eqo deti uchatsya v shkole i zanimayutsya muzikoy. 

Faig Muxtarov v etom biznese prodaji odejdi uje 7 let. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit novuyu odejdu  ved vperedi idet osen i shkola  i on xohceh kupit osenniye veshi i odejdu detyam malchikam dlya shkoli dlya pereprodaji.
texts.en:
Faig is married and has two children. He is 42 years old. He has relocated from Agdam which is an occupied Karabah territory and now lives in Baku. His children go to school and also take music classes. Faig M. has been in the business of selling clothing for seven years. At this time he needs 2000 AZN to buy new clothing to prepare for the autumn and school season and he wants to buy seasonal school clothes for boys.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new merchandise for resale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine I. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local alcohol at home and is requesting a loan to stock crates of beer to sell.  She is 42 years old and her husband is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar at the market.

loans.use: Stock crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Nemesio

texts.es: Nemesio tiene 42 años, vive en compañía de su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niño aprendió a las tareas del campo, es así que siembra papa y maíz principalmente, su esposa y sus hijos son el apoyo principal, y cada cierto tiempo verifican constantemente que los cultivos estén libres de plaga de insectos, pero cuando el trabajo es mas intenso, contrata el servicio de peones. Afirma que le agrada bastante trabajar en el campo porque lo realiza de manera independiente y sin presiones. Aunque su labor es sacrificada  es compensada cuando llega a vender todo lo cosechado, es por esta razón que desea adquirir más terrenos y aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita por que sabe que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima temporada de siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Nemesio is 42 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their own home. He learned to farm when he was a boy and now raises mainly potatoes and corn. His wife and children help him and periodically check the crops to make sure that they are free of insects and disease. When the requirement for labor increases, he hires additional field hands. He tells us that he enjoys working in the fields very much, because he does it independently and with no pressure. Even though it’s hard work, it’s rewarded when he sells his harvest. This is why he wants to acquire more land and increase his number of animals. This will be his first loan through MFP and he’s very happy to know that he has financial backing. He is also glad to be part of a communal bank, because its members are very united and responsible. He appreciates the people who manage this loan and it has been very helpful to the progress of his business. He will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer for his next potato planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo R., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Intizorhon's Group

texts.en:
Intizorhon M. is the leader of this group loan. She is 31 and married with two sons and two daughters. The sons attend school and the daughters are not yet old enough. Her husband works in a factory and earns 8000 KGS per month. Intizorhon raises poultry and seeks a loan to purchase more chickens and turkeys for breeding.  In the future she plans to build a shed and start repairing the house.

Sanabarhan B. is the treasurer of the group. She is 32 and married with two sons and two daughters.  Her husband works in construction. Sanabarhan breeds farm animals, reselling some animals after fattening, and she earns 2000 KGS per month.  The loan will enable her to purchase some farm animals for breeding and to purchase building materials to start repairing the house.

Talantbek G., age 26, is married. His wife is a teacher at university. Talantbek is building a house for his family and applied for a loan to purchase cement for building the house.

Nargizahon M., age 26, is married. Her husband works in construction and she breeds poultry, earning 900 KGS per month selling eggs and chickens.  She will use the loan to purchase more chickens for breeding.  In the future she plans to start repairing the house.

About Mol Bulak Finance (MBF):
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line:
- People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society)
- Planet (keeping environmentally friendly)
- Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously)
MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: The Reincarnates (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Renacientes  está formado por un grupo de 7 mujeres, son amigas y  muy buenas compañeras, trabajan en diferentes actividades  y  con un mismo fin de ayudar a la economía de sus hogares para así salir adelante y entregarles un mejor futuro a sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad está ubicada al  sur de Ecuador, es capital de la provincia del Azuay y está situada en la parte meridional de la Cordillera andina ecuatoriana. Su centro histórico fue declarado Patrimonio de la Humanidad por la Unesco en el año 1999.

La Señorita Mayra S. vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación. Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de juguetes actividad que empezó hace 2 meses y tiene confianza de que le va ir muy bien, vende en una escuelita de la ciudad. También hace 7 meses cuentan con un puesto de comida en la parroquia de Ricaurte, donde vende una variedad de platos. 
La Señorita Mayra es muy joven, tiene 18 años, es soltera y tiene  una bebe de 4 meses de edad. Vive  con sus padres quienes son un gran apoyo para ella, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.  Su crédito lo va a invertir en su hija ya que necesita ropa.
 
Sus metas son  retomar sus estudios del colegio ya que los abandono cuando estaba en quinto curso y también desea superarse para entregarle a su hija un mejor futuro.

La Señorita. Lorena L. vive en la parroquia de Narancay Alto en la ciudad de Cuenca. Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la fundación. Nuestra socia tiene de 26 años es soltera y tiene un hijo de 3 años y 3 meses de edad. Vive con sus padres y ayuda en la economía del hogar, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
La Señorita. Lorena  trabaja hace 7 meses en un camal de pollos en donde los pela, los lava etc., labora desde las 7 de la mañana hasta que termine con su trabajo y el resto del tiempo lo dedica a su hijo. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa y vitaminas para su hijo.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The community bank named "The Reincarnates" is a group of 7 women. They are friends and very close colleagues. They each have different businesses but they have one goal in common, to contribute to their family's finances, to keep on progressing and to provide a better future for their families. They live in various locations throughout the city of Cuenca. The city is located near Cordillera along the equator. In 1999 Unesco named the city a World Heritage site. Mayra Simbana lives in the district of Miraflores in Cuenca. It is the second loan she requests. This member sells toys, a business she started two months ago but she is very confident of its success. She sells in a small school in the neighborhood. Seven months ago she also set up a food stand in the Ricuarte district, offering a variety of foods to her clients. Mayra is a very young woman. She is 18 years old, she is single and she has a 4-month old baby girl. She lives with her parents and they are a source of great support for her. They rent the place where they are living. The loan will be used to buy some clothes for her baby. Her goal is to go back to school. She stopped going when she was in her fifth semester but she wants to improve herself, to provide her daughter with a better future. Miss Lorena L. lives in the Narancay Alto district in the city of Cuenca. This is the third loan she requests. She is 26 years old, she is single and she has a 3 year old son. She lives with her parents and she contributes to the household economy. They rent the space where they live. Lorena has worked in a chicken farm for the past 7 months. There, she processes the chickens, plucking their feathers, washing etc. She works from 7 in the morning until she has completed the work she was assigned. The rest of the time she dedicates to caring for her son. The funds will be invested in the purchase of clothing and vitamins for her son. Her goal is to have her own home one day.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and vitamins.

loans.name: Sanayelen Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SANAYELEN sont  quatre femmes  toutes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans,  5 enfants et vivant dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  d’articles divers en générale tels la vente de tubercules avec  ROKIATOU D., les condiments alimentaires, les habits, du charbon de bois etc.
ROKIATOU D. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  3 chargements de charrette en tubercules (ignames, patate douce, pomme de terre, manioc)
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et  dans les villages voisins. Les tubercules sont  vendus en famille et au marché à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 65.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Sanayelen group are four women who are all married, average 35 years of age and have on average five children each. They live in monogamous families in Sanoubougou 1, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (Mali's third administrative region).

They are on their second loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso. This group of women sell a variety of general products, such as tubers (this is the case for Rokiatou D.), condiments, clothing, firewood etc.

With her loan Rokiatou D. is planning on buying three barrow loads of tubers (yams, sweet potatoes, ordinary potatoes, cassava). She gets her supplies at the large market and in neighboring villages. She sells the tubers within the family and at the market, on a retail basis for cash and often on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 65,000FCFA, of which part will be used to help her husband with the daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase tubers

loans.name: Ararat

texts.en:
Ararat dreams of having his eighteen year old daughter graduate from university.  She attends university in the capital city of Armenia, Yerevan.  Ararat lives in the village of Panick in the Shirak region of Armenia with his wife and three sons. Ararat is a graduate of medical college and is proud of his education.

Due to difficult economic conditions, he has been self-employed as a farmer for the past twenty years. In order to support his daughter, Ararat is looking for a loan to expand his cattle breeding business. With the purchase of additional livestock, he is expecting his family's income to increase by around twenty percent. As a life long resident of Panick, Ararat lives near his extended family and all are involved in the agriculture sector.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Segundo Manuel

texts.es:
Segundo Manuel M. Q. tiene 54 años. Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive  en el cantón de Guaranda en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos.

Segundo pertenece a la Ventanilla  Guantucoto ubicada a media hora de Guaranda perteneciente, es un grupo que se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería especialmente a la siembra de maíz y papas en la zona de la sierra y en la zona de la costa al arroz, esta ventanilla tiene 25 miembros.

Segundo se dedica a la agricultura por varios años,  siembra maíz y papa, además tiene animales de cría y ganado para luego vender,  las comprar las realiza en Guaranda y vende en el mercado mayorista de la  misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para la siembra maíz, papa. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades de la familia. Enfrentan desafíos como plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es comprar vehiculo y comprar casa.
Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Segundo Manuel M. Q., 54, is married and living with his wife and children in the canton of Guaranda, Bolivar province.  He has 5 children.  Segundo belongs to Ventanilla Guantucoto, located a half-hour from the Guaranda area.  Ventanilla, a group that makes its living in agriculture and livestock, in particular planting corn and potatoes in the mountain area and rice in the coastal area, has 25 members.  Segundo has made his living in agriculture for a number of years, planting corn and potatoes, breeding and raising animals for sale as well.  He purchases them in Guaranda and sells them in the main market in the same city.  He is requesting a loan to buy supplies to plant corn and potatoes.  The loan will help him to supply the economic necessities of his family.  They encounter challenges such as pests and diseases in the crops.  His dream is to purchase a car and a house.  He loves to participate in sports.

loans.use: Supplies for planting

loans.name: Mari Luz

texts.es:
Mari Luz es socia del Banco Comunal “Sol de Oro” ubicado en el distrito de Juliaca,  provincia de San Román, departamento de Puno, tiene 31 años de edad, de estado civil  casada y tiene 02  hijos. La señora tiene estudios de educación superior.

Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 01 año, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de productos de belleza.

La señora solicitará un nuevo crédito por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en los productos de su negocio.

Su sueño para el futuro  es tener una tienda de cosméticos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y compartir experiencias.
texts.en:
Mari Luz is a member of the “Sol de Oro” (Golden Sun) community bank which is located in Juliaca district, in San Román district, in Puno department.  She is 31 years old, married, and has 2 children.  She completed her higher education.

Mari Luz has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 1 year.  Her first loan was for 500 nuevos soles which she used to increase the working capital of her business selling beauty products.

She is requesting a new loan for 300 nuevos soles to invest in products for her business.

Her dream for the future is to have a cosmetics store.

What she most likes about her community bank are the meetings and the sharing of experiences.

loans.use: To invest in products for her business

loans.name: Guiselle

texts.en:
Guisselle M. L. is 40 years old, married and has two children.  She lives in Caballo Blanco, Cartago, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. Guisselle has a business producing handmade woven garments including sweaters, toques, gloves, scarves, socks, etc. She also offers decorating services for special events such as birthdays, communions, and work parties. Her main source of revenue is her garment business, but she involves herself with both activities in order to maintain a steady stream of income. Guisselle has been working in this capacity for the past eight years.  Her revenue generating activities have helped her to provide for her children.

This will be Guisselle's first loan with Fundación Mujer. Guisselle decided to apply for a loan after completing a capacity building course in business administration at the Foundation.  With this loan, Guisselle plans to make investments in both of her productive activities. Specifically, she plans to buy different colors of high quality wool and make repairs to her weaving machine by replacing the cones.  She also plans to use the loan to purchase balloons and party decorations. Currently Guiselle has pending orders in both of her activities.  She lacks sufficient working capital in order to make investments, which would enable her to satisfy the demands of her clients. This loan will help to address this obstacle. 

With two children and a home to take care of, Guisselle is busy most days until 3 PM. She dedicates the hours between 3 and 6 to weaving. If necessary, she will weave after dinner until 11 PM.  When she provides party decoration services, her husband assists her.  Guisselle´s long-term goal is to fulfill her business plan, which includes generating sufficient revenues from her productive activities in order to open a weaving workshop and a gift shop. As mentioned, the main factor inhibiting the growth of her business is a lack of access to working capital. Guisselle plans to use this loan to make bulk purchases of quality raw materials, which will ensure a better price from her suppliers and lower her overall costs of production.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials and party decorations and to repair equipment

loans.name: Fredrick Mutunga

texts.en:
Fredrick, age 36, is married to Annastacia and together they have five children who are all in school. He runs a small hotel / food stall in Kiwani, Emali town. Most of his customers are average income earners from the surrounding areas. He has been running this business for 14 years and his income has been good thus far.

Fredrick was introduced to KADET by the credit officer in charge of Emali office. This is his third loan from KADET and he intends to use it to buy a better cooking stove and add more kitchenware and foodstuffs like flour, cooking oil and rice to sell to his customers. He hopes to grow his business so that he is able to give his children better education and a good life.
